Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: capetown2011
Reviews.Content: The hotel is average, the rooms are a bit outdated, the bathrooms need a total makeover as they are still brown. Internet is only free in the lobby which is very annoying. The personnel was awfully arrogant and inefficient. A plus is the pool on top of the roof as well as the small gym. It is not so close to a subway station, like a 15 minute walk and therefore not that comfortable. In general, Kowloon is a cool and vibrant area and close to many sight seeing activities such as the ladies and night market or the sneakers street.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for the markets, transport, and food”
Reviews.Author: dashinasia
Reviews.Content: Great pool, good rooms, polite friendly staff. Tip: walk up to Mong Kok East Station it's a lot closer and it's direct for shopping in Shenzen. Walk around the streets for local food, cheap and tasty, with good variety. If you are going down to the markets bargain hard and you will not only have fun, if you smile while your at it, but your likely to get a bargain. Also the hotel has a free shuttle bus to Monk Kok station and down to the Tsm Sha Tsui station for the ferry and downtown.

Reviews.Title: “close to Mong Kwok shopping district, convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: FamilySpringBreak
Reviews.Content: Nice fairly comfortable room but wouldn't say its a 5 star..Pretty standard 3 star facility. The Hotel is convenient as most things are short walk or cab ride around Hong Kong. Make sure your driver goes to the correct Metropark Hotel as we were originally dropped off at same name sake hotel 10 minute cab ride away from Kowloon! Annoying! WiFi in lobby only, seating limited. Can get umbrellas at main level too and we needed them. Main desk was helpful changing over some US cash for me. Unfortunately we had two noisy nights in a row. We called security but they did nothing to calm folks down next to us. Why do some folks shout so loud rather than just speak calmly? We ate in a small diner a few doors down the street from Hotel for a very reasonable price vs eating the hotel buffet. Only a few blocks to sneaker street, camera street so a shoppers paradise etc.Can grab clean but crowded subway down to Tsim Shaw Chui shopping too. Lots of restaurants very close by or just wander around enjoying the markets, lights at night etc... . We took 3rd party shuttle service to airport which was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: lkcampo
Reviews.Content: Last time we visited Hong Kong, we stayed in YMCA at Salisbury Road. While the location is considered more upscale, it costs more and the room smaller. Metropark Kowloon is located in Mongkok, best known for its hustling and bustling. The room was good size, and service was cordial and friendly. The hotel shuttle to TsimShaTsui was pretty cool. While there was no WIFI in room (only ethernet), so we brought along a mini router (cost $20US), and voila the whole family got online.

Reviews.Title: “July 2012 Enjoyable stop-over”
Reviews.Author: GoldCoastFarang
Reviews.Content: After getting off the plane we hopped on the Airport train to the city,there we were ushered to the bus terminal to a shuttle bus direct to the Metropark hotel.This eliminated the usual drama of getting to a hotel in a foreign country.We had no problems checking in and were very happy with the room and the other Hotel facilities.The hourly FREE hotel shuttle to the Ladies Market and Downtown to near the Kowloon - Hong Kong ferry terminal was a bonus.The staff were always helpful and caring..... an added highlight was Teresa's Kitchen close by which served great meals at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Alasdair S
Reviews.Content: The hotel exceeded my expectations in all areas. The staff are very helpful and accommodating, highlighted by their response when my daughter became ill and had to be admitted to hospital. The staf went out of their way to help, taking us to the hospital and helping with the admission process. Finally, they ensured that we could extend our stay without fuss and provided exceptional additional support. I highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Dates of stay at Metropark, Kowloon was from 20 August 2012 until 24 August 2012”
Reviews.Author: Rowie123
Reviews.Content: The good - room was very clean, good facilities including the rooftop pool. Free wifi in the lobby, shuttle bus to Mong Kok and Nathan Road. The bad - Front reservation staff were not very welcoming when I checked in, nor did they ask me about my stay when I checked out. One night during my stay I placed the do not disturb sign on my door, yet the next morning I received a phone call from housekeeping wanting to know if I wanted my room cleaned..thats all well and good however the point of having the do not disturb sign on my door is that, well, I dont want to be disturbed! All in all, this is a nice place to stay for a reasonable price

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeSolo
Reviews.Content: Good rooms and helpful staff. A bit far from the center but they have a shuttle service and the subway is quite close. Breakfast is decent and can also be had in the business lounge, if you want to avoid the families.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Central location”
Reviews.Author: reefimagery
Reviews.Content: First time in HK so I didnt know where to stay but I found this in a good location, taxiable from everywhere! Not too far from the airport. Price seemed to be fair considering HK is the cheapest of places. Staff very freindly, good WIFI, Quite comfy rooms although there was no veiws. I would definatly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great services, very safe & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Abby C
Reviews.Content: We are staying at the metro park right now for four days. After travelling for 17 days in different hotels from Beijing to hong Kong, this is one of the better ones, and a nice way to finish out our family trip. Convenient, friendly, and efficient checkin. We travelled with nine people and were able to fit an extra cot in three standard rooms, and we still had enough room to move around. The only downside is that we were on the 5th floor, and smoking rooms are on floors 3 & 4, so you can pick up some of the smoke in the ventilation. Theres a pool and fitness room on the 17th floor--not fancy, but a nice bonus. Buffet breakfast was convenient, but overpriced $HK 110; with teenagers & young adults it was easier ( and signicantly cheaper ) to grab a Danish & coffee at the in house bakery. Not fancy coffee--just a good cup of Joe. Sip Sip lounge has happy hour from 4-9 and two for one drinks--very convenient. There is a shuttle that leaves every half hour for the local market & mong kok metro station, but it's only a 15 min walk anyhow. Theres even shuttle service to the airport for $HK 110; a taxi might be cheaper depending on how many people you have and how much luggage you packed with you.Tons of bakeries, 7-11,& restaurants along the way, including McD. Teresa's restaurant is three doors down from the hotel; they are very loud & friendly, and they appear to have a lot of foreign patrons, as they have a full set of English menus & single serve plates. There's an HSBC ATM machine next door that's well used to take out extra spending money. I wouldn't have any problems staying here again; after traveling across China, this was one of the safest places I felt I was staying in...lots of staff everywhere. Bonus tip: most places in China and Hong Kong didnt have in room wireless, so pick up a wireless router to plug into the Ethernet cable. We were able to share access across three rooms with 6 iPhones & 3 iPads & everyone was happy keeping in touch with their friends back home, without having to hang out in the lobby for hours. Cheers! Abby from Langley,BC Canada

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay and nice location”
Reviews.Author: Lynn8038
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the central part of Kowloon about 500mts from The MTR, and ladies market. The staff were very helpfull and always had a smile. The room was small but very well laid out with tea and coffee facilities. The breakfast was very good at a fair price. I am a regular visitor to Hong Kong and I would recommend the Metropark, it's close to the markets, MTR and the shops of TST if you need to go there, just to top it off there is a free shuttle bus too. WELL DONE METROPARK AND THANK YOU !!!'

Reviews.Title: “small but very clean”
Reviews.Author: Lady-Lefaye
Reviews.Content: the room was small but very clean. the people in hong kong were so friendly and nice and everyone speaks english had everything needed great location -in the middle of everything 20 minute taxi ride from disneyland

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nanda T
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel for the price. We stayed on the club floor. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Good location and free shuttle bus every 30 minutes to the harbour city. Breakfast was very good. English speaking staff. The room was good. This is very very good compared to another hotel we stayed in Hong kong.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gum168
Reviews.Content: We stay in Hong Kong regularly to visit relatives and generally stay in a different hotel each time. This is one of the best for the price range that we've stayed in. We stayed on the Club floor and the staff were friendly and attentive, much more so than most Hong Kong hotels. We thought it was worth the extra to stay on the club floors. The breakfast on the club floor is more peaceful and relaxed than in the main restaurant downstairs, but the selection is much smaller, so we only ate breakfast on the club floor one morning, the rest of the time we ate downstairs in the main breakfast restaurant and the food selection on offer was really good. The club floor free afternoon nibbles and drinks from 5pm to 7 pm was also much appreciated. The room was clean and quiet, and although the usual bland hotel style, the decor was new looking. The room size was larger than most hotels we've stayed in (except the more luxury Novotel Citygate). The free shuttle bus was very convenient and we used it most days, although the nearest MTR is only 10-15 minutes walk away. That isn't far, but depending on the time of year, the weather in Hong Kong can be not just hot, but extremely humid, so walking can be uncomfortable at times. That's when the shuttle bus is really appreciated. The pool is on the roof and we used this everyday for a swim before setting off for the day. We didn't use the gym, so can't comment on that. All in all we were very impressed and we are very likely to return to this or one of the other hotels in this group in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Jo”
Reviews.Author: SJT2001
Reviews.Content: Nice and well positioned, free shuttle bus every 1/2 hr to CBD. Great breakfasts. Staff very helpful. I would suggest deluxe rooms. English speaking staff. Nice bakery shop in the basement, few deli shops close by. Walking distance to Mong Kok underground station.

Reviews.Title: “Location and hotel ok”
Reviews.Author: Elsje G
Reviews.Content: Nice they have à shuttle bus to 2 interesting places. For shopping you can also walk for 10 minutes. We even enjoyed The swimming pool of the hotel. Nice place for a couple of days. Staff was also very helpfully.

Reviews.Title: “It's okay. Location not the best”
Reviews.Author: Jeffsey500
Reviews.Content: Check in was fine. Their english wasn't the best but it was enough. The check in lobby is on the second floor so dragging luggage up there and then to the room is a little annoying. They have a lot of bellhops that almost seem overly eager to help though. The elevators are a little slow but they do go from ground up to the rooms. Mind your step sometimes they don't stop quite level with the floor. The rooms are comfortable, but rather old. Like 1992 old. Carpet was surprisingly clean, but I still used the complimentary slippers. Air conditioning a little under powered but it's enough. They had complimentary water which is nice. The minibar fridge is big enough to cram in other stuff around their mini bar "amenities" Bathrooms are clean enough, but also very dated. There's a grille at the bottom of the bathroom door with 1 inch slats so it felt like I was doing my business in the room... Toilet was hard to flush in my room, figured out that if you pump the handle 3 times it works well. Location was not the greatest. About 1.5 km walk to MTR Mong Kok station. Normally not a big deal but when it's 34°C and 100% humidity its annoying (walk takes about 20 minutes). The proximity to the Mong Kok markets is great. You can shop, then go back and drop stuff off. There are a few busses out front, but unless they go exactly where your destination is, don't bother. The concierge is really good at helping you figure this stuff out. There are a few Metropark hotels in Hong Kong. If you're asking for directions or using a taxi ask for the Metropark hotel on Waterloo Road. There is no Wifi in the rooms (wow.....). There is wired internet for free. Wifi is available in the lobby for free (the signal is pretty weak though) Check out is fine. Luggage storage is complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “Good 3 night stay”
Reviews.Author: nightshade7
Reviews.Content: Good place. Nice rooms. Downside is that the hotel is a long walk away from the MTR, so if you stay here, I suggest learning the bus routes.

Reviews.Title: “A cosy, friendly and comfy base for your stay in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: designlady
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel without hesitation. It's situated in Kowloon, not far from the ladies market, many malls & eateries. The hotel offers a brilliant (free!) shuttle bus all day that sets off every half hour and stops near Mongkok MTR/Ladies market & Tsim Tsa Tsui. We used this pretty much every night. The entrance lounge to the hotel is wonderful, very comfy and has a bakery, two restaurants & a hotel bar also. The staff all seemed friendly; particularly one staff member 'Mirror' who went above & beyond any expectations we had. She gave us five star treatment, without a doubt. There's also a 7/11 a minute or so away from the hotel which was good for buying things like milk, biscuits, water etc and an ATM just a few doors away. I had a bad reaction to Mosquito bites when I was out there and as a precaution, they changed our room and even upgraded us. It was more than kind and they even made sure I was seen by a GP within half an hour so I could get medication. I was very thankful of their gestures. This meant we experienced both the standard room and the club class room. To be honest, the standard room is probably below the luxury level of UK hotels (a bit outdated, odd vent on the door of the bathroom that you could hear through..), however it's very clean & certainly wouldn't be enough to put me off staying there again. We were happy with the standard of comfort, particularly with the price we got this hotel for. As for the club class, it's bigger & has a nicer finish to it. You also got a bowl of fruit in your room and some nights we were given a chocolate on the pillow. Cute gesture! Both rooms were very quiet. While we didn't try out the rooftop pool, I did take a wander up to it and thought it looked clean & nice to bathe in. We had the breakfast one morning & it had a good selection; something to suit pretty much every taste. The hotel bar was comfortable & good for wifi access and a drink after a day of exploring the amazing city that is Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Family Room”
Reviews.Author: Joe_joey
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at 6th floor family room. the room has one queen size double bed and a single bed. the room is tidy and spacious but the air cond have to take time to cooling the room. There is free wifi in room while we stayed in July 2012 but the speed quite slow sometimes..Their front-desk staff quite friendly and polite, give us valuable information and quick check-in and check-out process. the housekeeping was done everyday and replenish complimentary mineral waters everyday. They provided free shuttle bus to Mong kok MTR and TST MTR and come back to hotel only available at TST MTR runs every half an hour. the bus very puncture but too small...You also can choose to walk to MongKok MTR about 10 mins from hotel. Surrounding here only have some local eateries, one western restaurant, mini-mart and 7-11.Not a crowded place compare to Ladies market or temple street.

Reviews.Title: “Thrilled with this hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Darbec
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our 3 night stay in this hotel. We booked the club room, and happy that we did. Service was very efficient with check in on the floor, and the rooms are lovely and spacious, comfortable beds and lots of extras. We enjoyed the afternoon happy hour with a drink of your choice, and some dim sum and sweets on offer. We got evening chocolates and a card with the next days weather forecast, and a daily newspaper left in the morning. We had the breakfast on the club floor and it was more than adequate. The staff are friendly and helpful and we got a late check out included in the deal. The pool is not big, but perfect for a hot afternoon, and it is a 10 minute walk to the ladies market. The only downer was the shuttle, because if it was full, it was too bad. People sat in there for ages in the heat to ensure their spot. The number 7 bus out the front was worth the $4.40. Overall, we loved our stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased July 2012”
Reviews.Author: wings
Reviews.Content: Family Room for a stay of 6 nights. Originally assigned a room on a floor that was not yet renovated (10) which was clean, but showed signs of wear in furniture and carpet and had a musty smell. Our concern was met very efficiently and we were given the option to upgrade to a deluxe room (renovated) on the sixth floor. I did not know the difference when I booked using an online hotel company. The cost is very minimal and the difference is like night and day. So be sure to book on one of the renovated floors, which should be marketed as 'deluxe' I am told. Floors 1-6 and 19 are currently renovated, others to follows. Our room had 1 Queen and 1 single bed. Great bedding with a duvet and lots of extra pillows. Blackout curtains for a good sleep , as well as we did not hear any noise within the hotel or from outside, and I am a very light sleeper. As far as checking in and checking out time frames, well it really depends how many people are requesting the services at the front desk at a certain time, just like any business you que up for. Any time I looked over at the front desk or had reason to speak with one of the staff , there always seemed to be an adequate number of employees on the counter. Your wait time depends on when you show up and what the staff are having to deal with really. Breakfast offered a variety of selection and kept us going until dinner. Although a couple of mornings we chose to eat at a local restaurant , as you exit the hotel it is on the right, Teresa's kitchen. Great ambiance and has western style breakfast at minimal cost, yum. This recommendation came from an earlier posters suggestion and it was a good one! Shuttle left promptly on the half hour and we always managed to get a seat. Although with the humid weather, taxi's being inexpensive and plentiful, we often choose to not opt for the shuttle. We used the octopus card for public transport , a must ,rather than digging out change. Nearest MTR is Mong Kok East Rail line (light blue) 5 min walk or nearest main line Mong Kok (red) is about 15 mins . Pool was nice after a long day, no issues. Hotel restaurant for dinners serving western food, not impressed, it was just so so, but we were tired and just wanted something to eat before going to bed. Again, breakfast is great though! There is more than 1 bakery in the area and have very very yummy items to choose . 7-11 convenience store down the street for water and snacks From previous posters, I was expecting alot of places to eat in the area and felt extremely limited. i would say this was the biggest disappointment with the hotels location. There are local eateries, but not any serving western food, this is perhaps why the information may differ. Large bank Hang Seng across the street, where we used ATM and exchanged money to RMB for a 50HKD service fee for any amount. We had issues with the internet connection in our room . It was promptly dealt with by the IT person. I was offered the hotels internet /computer to use because of the problem ,more than once without an issue. I also had reason to request documents to be printed and I was again offered the hotel's printer to use . Furthermore I had a package delivered to the hotel by DHL and was once again delivered promptly to our room. There was another instance where my son left our door ajar when we went out for the evening. The hotel security left us a note that they noticed this and shut our door !! We had 2 mac books sitting out as well as several other items. Really appreciated this service ! On our last day the kids went swimming and I had wet bathing suits to pack. The laundry dried them for me at no charge. SO ALL I CAN SAY IS THE STAFF BENT OVER BACKWARDS FOR US and made our stay seems like a 5 ***** star hotel all the way !! HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL. Be sure to stay on a renovated floor however to avoid any disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Gemma86
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for 4 nights in April 2012. We were pleased with our room which was spacious and had a nice on-suite bathroom which was very clean. PRO's * The hotel ran a shuttle bus every day which was free to Mong Kok and Tsim Sha Tsui, which we used throughout our stay. Both stops are great to access local transport to get in and around Hong Kong. * The hotel lobby had free WiFi. * Free bottled water in your room every day. * Roof top swimming pool. * Small gym facilities. CON's * No in room ironing facilities. Overall pleasant stay at the Metropark Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “A mini New York City. The hotel was adequate.”
Reviews.Author: lcsw2010
Reviews.Content: Kowloon is amazing. it never sleeps. I wandered around every nite till late, and there was always action there. The thing I liked most about the hotel was the Hotel Shuttle which was quite good. It takes you to Mong kok (Ladies market) and TST every 30 minutes and it's free. The staff were adequate, and the restaurant was not bad. The room was adequate, with a comfortable bed and shower. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karen H
Reviews.Content: We got a summer deal through Metropark's website which was very good value - $250AUD for 2 nights, which included buffet breakfast each day, unlimited internet (requiring an ethernet port on your computer), and return airport transfers. The hotel also has a shuttle bus to Mong Kok (which is only about a 5 minute walk away anyway) and to the harbour front and free wifi in parts of the hotel (we logged in at the breakfast restaurant which was handy). The pool was small but nice and had sun loungers to sit on. The pool lifeguards were diligently stopping people from running around the pool. Our room was good, although I was a bit disappointed that there was no bath (I misinterpreted the bath/shower description on their website to mean a shower over a bath, but I think it actually meant bath or shower). There were slippers, but no bathrobes (given it's not a 5 star hotel, we weren't expecting bathrobes). Most of the hotel floors are non-smoking which is great, although the people in the room next to us obviously thought it was OK to smoke in their bathroom - and the smoke went through the vent into our bathroom so we had to close the door and put the fan on. Nothing the hotel can do about that, but it was a bit annoying. The rest of the room was good - the fridge was actually cold, the TV had lots of channels, you could control the air conditioning temperature, and complimentary bottles of water were provided each day. Buffet breakfast was nothing spectacular (especially compared to a 5 star hotel), but still had everything you need - someone to make you an omelette, scrambled eggs, cereal, etc. The only thing missing was hash browns, but they did have potato wedges which was a treat! The location is good - it's in Mong Kok which is where a lot of local markets are and there's a lot of good shopping within walking distance. And if you want to go further afield, the shuttle bus to the harbour is great. And there's a supermarket (Wellcome) literally across the road. All in all, a good deal for a 3 star hotel in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Awful experience”
Reviews.Author: FoodSnob24
Reviews.Content: Standard rooms, got what we paid for in that respect, nothing special. Terrible service, the staff were rude - not the best introduction to Kowloon/Hong Kong! The Pool is nice, shuttle service is fantastic and very handy but I won't be staying here again, to be honest it made my short visit to Hong Kong terrible and won't be returning in a hurry.

Reviews.Title: “Very good basic hotel for the short visit in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Totti K
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (2+2) visited Metropark Hotel Kowloon during July 2012. The deal that we got through web based travel agency was very good for a 7 night stay. This was my 26th time in Hong Kong and for our family 9th time. Pro's - Room was modern and clean. - Everything in the room worked as promised. - We stayed on the 6th floor and the noice from the Waterloo road did not disturb us. - Hotel shuttle was quite good, it takes you to Mong kok (Ladies market) and TST every 30 minutes and it's free. - Pool was on the roof and we had plenty of sunshine to enjoy, some issues with order by the poolside (see below). - The gym next to the pool has few basic cardio-vascular exercise machines and Wii, nothing fancy, no free weights and if the gymn has more than 4 people, it will be crowded inside. Con's - The only base in the hotel with wireless access seems to be in the lobby (I dont know about executive floor and lounge), and it was ridicillous to come downstairs during evening hours. On many nights the lobby was rather crowded with people and their phones, iPads, computers etc. reading their emails and making Skype-calls. - Even though the pool is on the roof, lifeguards are very inactive when it comes to the unruly behavior of some families. The pool is small and children (and sometimes adults) were allowed to jump in all over, even though clearly forbidden. It was impossible to swim in the pool or have smaller children in the pool (like we did) when 10-15 year old children were jumping in constantly. - We originally booked a room for 2 adults and 2 children. The hotel tried to charge an extra cost for the children, which we refused. After some harsh negotiations and ultimatums we got a family room with two large beds that was enough for our needs. - Breakfast is certainly not worth the price the hotel is charging. Better luck with Wellcome across the street or the restaurants in the same block. All an all, the hotel deal was decent, our room was modern and clean and pool on the roof was ok. If you are visting Hong Kong the first time, I would recommend to use a hotel closer to MTR system or even better, on Hong Kong Islan.

Reviews.Title: “Quite ok, but the staff were busy.”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_Finland-73
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 1 night on Junu 2012. Location quite good, room ok. Staff were very busy, so had to wait service for quite some time (during check-in, check-out was ok).

Reviews.Title: “irfanindia”
Reviews.Author: irfanind
Reviews.Content: the rooms were stingy didnt get our rooms till 3pm the staff was unattentive rooms were cramped breakfast was sad everything soggy the breads had fungus on it the concierge were bloddy rude was a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Very cold room”
Reviews.Author: ojnab
Reviews.Content: We stayed for ten nights 17 to 27 June, 2012, be aware that the room can become very cold, air conditioning not to be turned off as per their instruction, so take your overcoat you definately will need it in the room. We were upgraded to floor 16 which is classed as a club room, the room itself is not very large and we believe is the same size as any other room in this hotel, why they have a large club chair instead of two smaller chairs and table doesn't quite make sense for comfort in these supposedly better rooms. The shower is over the bath,but there is a very good selection of bathroom products to use if needed. The buffet breakfast included for ten mornings we felt did not change very much from morning to morning and needed more variety, obviously set for the two night stay people. The hotel overall is a basic four star venue, we feel it may be better to pay a little more and stay elsewhere, the shuttle bus is very good, for convenience to the MTR station and Kowloon shopping, running half hourly, rooms are sprayed regularly for any bed bug infestitation which may occurr. Overall it was an enjoyable stay, but perhaps we should have split the ten days into five at this hotel and five somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A three star hotel with a four star attitude”
Reviews.Author: Semlohjd
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 6 nights.. The hotel rooms are perhaps a little dated but the staff are more than helpful , the bar is comfortable and the food, excellent.. If it is any sort of a recommendation.... I would return , without hesitation .

Reviews.Title: “more for less”
Reviews.Author: thefilipinobulldog
Reviews.Content: Stayed at a club room for 4 nights. Sadly, the smoking rooms do not have bath tubs. showers only but the showers are strong and the hot water is excellent. For a club room, i would have expected first class toiletries but for the price i guess you get what you pay for. the club lounge serves excellent excellent coffee which you can have anytime. The 5:30-7:30 snack is ok although not great, you get sandwiches, cakes, sweets, maybe fries, some fried dimsum, and your pick of beer or wine. The lounge is small but there are also just a few users. The breakfast in the lounge tends to be simpler, with about 4 dishes less than the the one on the first floor, which is mostly crowded. However, the service is pretty much below standard, even for club room guests. i mean, nobody helped us with our luggage and when I asked for a room with a bath tub, it took them more than 30 mins to reply that i had to go up to the lounge to get some explanation. the shuttle bus departs on the dot (8:00, 8:15, 8:30, 9:00, etc) and leaves you at the edge of Fa yuen sneaker street at mong kok about 150 meters from the mongkok station and at the side of peninsula hotel in TST through a scenic route along the bayfront. It departs every 15 mins from 8 to 11 i think then every 30 mins thereafter. And mind you, in hk, you cannot talk to the driver, its almost illegal i think, They are allowed only two stops by the government so you just cant ask them to stop anywhere. The bread and cake shop on the ground floor is nice and the bread is delicious. you should try the thrift shop that sells wines near the hotel, got a lot of nifty things from there.

Reviews.Title: “Two good overnight stopovers!”
Reviews.Author: c0mmuter
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Cathay Pacific Holidays website as it offered a variety of deals (hotel+breakfast+airport transfers+late checkout) when you booked a flight so it was perfect for our stopovers en route to Europe and back. We chose this hotel mainly because of its price/good reviews ratio and also because it has a swimming pool...a great asset when catering for families! Check in was speedy but both times we had to request a change of room! First time they gave us a non-smoking room as requested but upon entering it was clear that not all clients abide to the rules...the stench of smoke was sickening!Reception was great to promptly change our room without any fuss. Second time around the room they allocated us only had 2 single beds ( we r a couple with 1 child).The booking was done correctly from us so even if they tried and get away with a rollaway bed i asked to be given what we booked for and we were finally given a much larger room that had 1 double bed and 1 single. Rooms are probably starting to look a bit worn but they are very clean. Air con works but it wasn't really easy to adjust the temperature but considering the heat outside it was just bliss to chill out in there! Breakfast was a feast! They have an amazing buffet full of any sort of food from continental to asian, hot and cold and even an egg cooking station with a chef ready to cook them to your liking right there in front of you...quite an attraction for my young one! The hotel shuttle bus is fantastic for trips to the Ladies Market (which is a 10 mins walk) or down to Tsim Tsa Shui (the waterfront from which you can see the Symphony of Lights free on every night at 8pm). The shuttle runs every 30 mins so you never have to wait long in either direction. The cake shop within the hotel was great for snacks and sugar cravings and according to our daughter they had the nicest doughnuts! (Prices are also very affordable so could be a good alternative for meals) The Sip bar was a bit on the expensive side but nice to be there to relax after a busy day sightseeing and shopping! ;) The rooftop swimming pool is not as big as it looks in the hotel website photos but still big enough to have a swim into! The fitness room is small but well equipped it even had a wii fitness video game on and a Vibra-train (so great to exercise without effort!). Concierge people were always very nice to help with luggage and airport shuttle boarding. The first time we were there they even paid(well i guess the hotel did..)the taxi fare to take us to the airport because the shuttle was too late! They have free wireless internet connection in the lobby and free cabled broadband in every room. I can't really fault this hotel! We were quite pleased with both our stopovers!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NarelleMc
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to Metro Club Floor,the room was a good size and clean and comfortable.Their transfer from the airport is HK110 but they do provide a free shuttle to MongKok and Tsim Sha Tsui,it runs every half hour.The local buses stop right out the front,for Nathan Rd and the ferry get no 7 or 81c.We bought an octopus card which can be used on the bus,ferry,metro and some retail stores.This saves the hassle of using cash and ending up with a pocketful of coin.The hotel does provide a laundry service but would suggest to go to laundry accross the road it is alot cheaper.The Sip Sip Bar downstairs was really good for a drink after a day out,happy hour goes for about 4 hours-buy one get one free.Local restaurants were really good.Tour information was very good too,we booked a day trip to Macau.

Reviews.Title: “Metropark Kowloon: Clean, good location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: TheLittleWelsh
Reviews.Content: The Metropark chain has several locations across Asia and in HK there are 2 that I have stayed in one centrally located in Mong Kok, The Metropark Mong Kok (near Prince Edward MTR) and the other one, The Metropark Kowloon, is in the outskirts of Mong Kok (near Mong Kok East Rail Station). I prefer to stay in the Metropark Kowloon as its just a bit further away from the madness of Mong Kok but close enough to walk to it. It also has a pool and a better bar. The rooms are immaculately clean and you have all the usual standard facilities in the rooms - hair dryer, safe, tv (only a few english channels), tea and coffee making facilities and you will also receive a daily english newspaper, daily weather updates and 2 chocolate mints! The pool is a good size and is on the top floor - its open air and is usually shut in the cold months (December). There is a small fitness room next to the pool - it only has 2 treadmills, a bike and some weights. There are 2 restaurants in house, a chinese and a western one. The food is ok but a little over priced. I ordered a burger one night and it was quite tasty so I'd recommend that if you are staying in one night. The bar, Sip Sip Bar, is on the ground floor and is fab - the ladies that work there are very efficient and remember your favourite drinks. Its a quiet, reasonably priced and chilled out space to escape the madness of Hong Kong. If you're hungry there is also a cake shop selling pastries and breads on the ground floor which I have bought from several times. Opposite the hotel is a Wellcome shop (supermarket)and also there are several 7-11 shops around the hotel so you can buy water, snacks etc. There are a few noodle shops and bakeries also very close to the hotel and I have been to pretty much all of them and can recommend all of them! They all serve fantasic food and are within a minutes walk of the hotel. The nearest station is Mong Kok East Rail station which is on the Kowloon Tong line (light blue) and is a 5-10 minute walk away from the hotel. You can also walk to Mong Kok and jump on the MTR line (15 minute walk). You can pick up a map from reception so you know where you're going. The hotel does offer free shuttle bus service to Tsim Sha Tsui as well which is handy but sometimes the MTR is more fun :) The staff are fantastic and all speak perfect English. There is a lad in the concierge team called Benjamin who is really helpful and friendly so look out for him if you need anything. I have always stayed with Metropark when I visit Hong Kong, they are good, affordable and clean and I highly recommend them.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: Forbery
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights here on a stopover. Staff very friendly and helpful. Room smallish and a bit outdated, but clean and fine for just 1 person. The free broadband was fantastic. Nice rooftop pool and well located for Ladies market and "sports shoe shop" street. Enjoyed the free shuttle bus to Tsim Sha Tsui.

Reviews.Title: “smells not so fine”
Reviews.Author: likeitis100
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it's not in a busy tourist area. The room I had was not so nice. As noted by other reviewers, there's a smell about it. The bathroom smells, the room smells, the corridors smell. The furnitures old and the walls patchy and grey, in need of repainting. The front desk staff were efficient but were indifferent. Overall it's a 3 star standard hotel. I paid close to USD150, which I think is pricey for what I got. If you can get a cheap rate, then you do ok.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, in a central location”
Reviews.Author: Mervleicester
Reviews.Content: We are presently staying at the Metropark Kowloon, and are finding it convenient, clean, reasonably priced, with very good facilities. Although the travel agent had booked our daughter's family a standard room, when we checked in and the receptionist saw that they had a young child, the hotel upgraded them to a family room, with an extra bed without charging any more. It is these little touches which make an ordinary hotel extraordinary. The room is comfortable, with free broadband, unfortunately wi-fi is obtainable only in the lobby or on the Club floors, but by visiting the computer stores in Mongkok you can purchase a portable wireless router very cheaply for use in your room and you can enjoy wi-fi. The hotel staff are eager to help, and most speak some English. We have truly had a delightful stay, and are sorry that our two week family vacation will end soon.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money & good location”
Reviews.Author: Ben_MY
Reviews.Content: My family & I ( 2 adults & 2 kids ) stayed at this hotel on 25/5 till 29/5. We booked a family room. The room is clean but the only complaint I got was the ciggarret smell ! Can't really tell where it came from but every time when we returned after a long day, sure will smell it! This hotel is close to everything. MTR stations (5-10 minutes walk), bus station (just outside the hotel), night markets (10-15 minutes walk or hotel free shuttle), restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to be!”
Reviews.Author: Brooke S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the last two days of our China trip and it was a great place to lay our heads! It had a great shuttle service which took us to the harbour as well as the shopping streets. They have a great tourist TV channel which helped us plan our days there. The service was exceptional. This hotel has a lot of great ammentities and is in a great location in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Super, no complaints at all”
Reviews.Author: Naomi08
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying here for 6 nights. We chose to take an upgrade which meant we were on a higher floor (17th), had exclusive use of our own check in and enquiry desk and our own area to eat breakfast. The upgrade was well worth it. Service was truely impecable (not something you can always say), nothing seemed to be too much trouble. We were able to enjoy happy hour which made us VERY happy! Free drinks and excellent snacks for 2 hours every evening. We thought this was amazing and really was evidence of the hotel going the extra mile to accomodate visitors. Breakfast was excellent. Our room was immaculate and it was always cleaned very promptly each day. Our turn down service was useful, especially as it included a weather forecast. The pool was a welcome escape from the madness of Hong Kong and its temperature was the best I have ever known, cooling but not so cold you struggle to get in. The hotel is a little way from the harbour front but the shuttle bus takes you all the way down to the bottom of Kowloon and is very regular and picks up until 10:30pm so it is very convenient and far easier than walking in the heat. Overall, a great stay. We have stayed in expensive hotels where the service was no where near as good as the Metropark Hotel so well done to them and thank you for a great break! We would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, tidy, good location!”
Reviews.Author: tammz_nz
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in early June. Good location, about 5 minutes walk to train station, less to most markets and food shops all around! Rooms we clean and tidy however they are old and could do with a makeover. Free wifi in the lobby area, and the staff were very good and helpful. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need for a enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Tholi660
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice and think the location is great. A little disappointed with still being able to smell smoke from the smokers level even if when we were on a non smoking floor other than that the rooms are comfy and clean. Staff freindy and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay in this wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sunray98
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June 2012, this was our third visit to Hong Kong and our third stay in the Metropark. I have to again give the hotel 10/10. the Service, the Food, the Staff everything about the hotel is fantastic. When you arrive the Bell Boys take your bags up to your room, when you go in to the hotel the Concierge directs you to reception, the reception team book you in and give you loads of information, you go then to your nice clean well laid out spacious room, which has loads of storage space, we stayed on the 11th Floor and one of the cleaners on that floor is called Can, she went out of her way to advise us of places to visit, nothing was too much trouble for her. There is a swimming pool on the roof, the staff are excellent when you go up there you swap your footware for some comfortable flip flops that they they supply, they also give you a towel and if you are too hot they will get you a parasol to shade you from the sun, the whole are is very clean and the view is brilliant, the staff are very helpful and when you have finished you can have a lovely shower where shampoo and soap are supplied. The food ate the hotel is wonderful, I expecially liked the breakfast the choice is amazing, and if you are pekish during the day there is a cake shop attached to the hotel where you can get cakes and savouries which are amazing. So all in all the hotel is Fantastic, the Staff are brilliant and yes, we are going back next year, there are too many places of interest to list in Hong kong in this short review, so you should plan before you go because there is so much to do, National Georgraphic say thay one of the top 50 things to do in the world is go on the Star Ferry, by the way when you are out there get an Octopus card for Bus and Ferry etc. P.s the people of Hong Kong are wonderful, kind and considerate. Carol & Don

Reviews.Title: “Good for the value”
Reviews.Author: mannyandmabel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good for the very reasonable price, which even includes free breakfast for 2 pax per room. I requested for 2 rooms with a connecting door and it was graciously provided. Unfortunately, my niece's bed in the adjoining room had bed bugs and she had red marks the following day. Nonetheless, the hotel management changed her bed immediately. Housekeeping doesn't clean the room as well as other hotels we've stayed in. They only fix the bed and the bathroom but doesn't touch the dresser, the top of the ref, the floor. If you your left shoe was left under the bed and your left shoe was left near the dresser, it will still be in their original places when you get back. The guest relations manager, Mr. Keith, went out of his way to provide us information on how to get to Disneyland and Ocean Park. The hotel also provided us with packed breakfast on the day we checked out because we had to leave early.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: joecheong
Reviews.Content: Hi All, I stay at the hotel for a night as I could not manage to book for the first 4 days of my stay in Hong Kong. I like to thank the staff at metropark for their great service,check-in was done in less then 10 minutes.Room is clean and facilities are good ,hopefully wifi would be provided in future for all rooms so children will able to access online in their room. Location is 15 minutes slow walk to Mongkok and the Mongkok East MTR station.There is a free shuttle to Mongkok and Tsim Sha Tsui area.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay, literally.”
Reviews.Author: ohaday
Reviews.Content: I was at the hotel during May 19 to May 21 with my family for vacation in Hong Kong. First thing first, the location is somewhat far from convenient; It is about 10 minutes by walk to Mong Kok area (and so does the MTR station) but fortunate enough the hotel provide shuttle to Tsim Sha Tsui area every 30 minutes. The hotel area also has selection of convenience store. The room I got has a smell of cigarette and the windows were locked therefore I cannot ventilate the smell away. The size is similar to all other hotel in Hong Kong, fairly small but not a big deal as Hong Kong has much to explore that would take the whole day anyway. I really like the fact that they offer 4 types of pillow to choose from, includes the lovely Down - that make my sleep very peaceful! If you are looking for a place to stay (and nothing else), at reasonable price, and you would be mostly in the city - then this hotel should be on your list of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Under rated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thompsonfour
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on the 11th to the 13th of May 2012. What an enjoyable stay. I was on the Club floor (16th). The rooms may not be that big but they are clean and everything else makes up for that. The staff are extremly effecient, it took less than 5minutes to check in and i am almost certain checkout was just one minute. This hotel delivers what it says it can. The shuttle bus is very useful and the hotel is at a very convinient location. If you enjoy shopping and good food, then this is the best spot to get around to some of the local resturants. Plus it is within a few minutes to what is called ladies town where a lot of bargain shopping takes place. For other locations you can take the shuttle bus that will drop you at main points to get to where you would like to go. A very clean, modern and cozy hotel. I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced and under-serviced”
Reviews.Author: Savin-ion
Reviews.Content: We liked - Location if you would like to stay in Kowloon in the proximity to Mongkok district and close enough to the electronic goods retail street, sports goods retail street and Ladies' market - Sip Sip bar located next door to the hotel entrance with its cosy ambiance however without clear positioning We did not like - Service which is average like in majority of HK hotels especially in comparison with other South East Asian countries like Malasya, the Philippines, Indonesia, Singapore etc - Room condition which is most likely requires renovation - Per room price which does not allow to tell about a fair quality / price ratio, although the majority of the HK hotels we stayed seem to be overpriced and under-serviced We advise - Visit retail streets of the Mongkok especially if you are interested in the electronic gadgets - Try the hotel located at the Hong Kong island with more modern districts situated over there if it does not matter for you what part of HK to stay

Reviews.Title: “JoH”
Reviews.Author: JoH883
Reviews.Content: A friend and I spent 7 nights at this hotel and were absolutely blown away. We got a great deal through the hotel's website for a room on one of the Club floors. Club floor guests have access to a lounge, via a dedicated staircase, where complimentary breakfast is served; and free happy hour drinks with hot/cold nibbles are available. (Club floor guests can choose to eat complimentary breakfast in the main dining room if they prefer.) There is also a dedicated check-in desk and computer room in the lounge, and free in-room wifi for Club floor dwellers. The lounge staff are very welcoming and happy to help with information and directions around Hong Kong. The rooms were spacious (by HK standards), clean and quiet, with comfy beds and numerous pillow types to choose from! Every night, a weather report for the next day was left in our room when the beds were turned down. The concierge staff were very obliging and happy to arrange transport to any destination. We made almost daily use of the Hotel's free shuttle (which runs every 30 minutes) to the Star Ferry Terminal. But the railway stations (local MTR and train to China), the Ladies' Market, and good shopping are all within easy walking distance. There is also a shuttle bus stop right outside the hotel that connects to the Airport Express Terminal in Kowloon. We could not fault this hotel and would stay there again. But I highly recommend a stay on one of the Club floors.

Reviews.Title: “Fine and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Sponch136
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 3 nights, comfortable and clean rooms and fine service. Good value for the money. No wifi in the rooms but one in the lobby. In the northern part of Kowloon and bit out of the center but free hotel shuttle service to Tsim Sha Tsui is really convenient. I can absolutely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business and travel”
Reviews.Author: Vitalino
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 3 nights on a business trip. Easy way from and to airport by a free city shuttle bus and MRT. There is a free hotel shuttle bus every 30 minutes to harbour. Big rooms, very fast internet in the room free of charge, reasonable price. Good breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Comfort Room”
Reviews.Author: Wistin
Reviews.Content: Metropark Club Floor offer nice and convenience accommodation and and room facilities. Room size is good with comfort bedding and toiletries amenities.

Reviews.Title: “30 hours in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Declan_01
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in March 2012 as I was given an amazing opportunity to make a short trip to Hong Kong. I picked the hotel primarily based on price and access to public transport. The Hong Kong Rugby Sevens was on at the time so accommodation on Hong Kong Island was even more limited and expensive than usual. I booked the hotel through a travel agent and managed to get a very reasonable rate of approximately £80. The location was ideal and only about 10 minutes walk to a metro station. The free shuttle service to Tsimshatsui was very useful. The staff were friendly and efficient upon check in . The room I was allocated was very clean but in need of a refurbishment. However I had expected this after reading the previous reviews. If I was going to be there for any longer and spending a reasonable amount of time in the room I would have considered upgrading to a more modern room. I thought the buffet breakfast was exceptional value with a really good variety of western and Chinese options and this set me up perfectly for a busy day of sightseeing. I did not use any of the other restaurants, bars or other facilities at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel itself is very good, other guests not so much”
Reviews.Author: snough
Reviews.Content: I am a Hong Kong local and returned for a family reunion. I usually stay at my relative's home but there was no room so my brother and I stayed in a twin share. I cannot fault the customer service of the hotel. It was always clean, comfortable and staff were very helpful at all times. The room was more spacious than I thought it would be for Hong Kong and even on the 6th floor we couldn't hear any traffic. I liked that the curtains plunged the room into almost complete darkness. The bathroom was small but the shower was very large and water heated up very quickly. If you're averse to air conditioning, you're going to have to make an effort to turn off the air conditioning, it seems to come on even without your keycard being in the slot. They had 4 different options for pillows which I liked a lot. I thought the hotel was good value for money, I booked for AUD150 per night in April, no breakfast. We also made daily use of the gym and pool. The pool was wonderfully refreshing in the humidity of Hong Kong and the gym is sufficient. There were 4 machines to use and a ~5 x 3m space to stretch etc in. They also had a TV screen with Wii available. I ran into some resistance using my own exercise DVD but managed to convince the staff that nobody else would come up to use Wii (which they didn't). Hardly anyone else used the gym. I would have liked if the gym opened earlier than 730am but that's Hong Kong time for you. The location is very convenient to Mongkok, a short 10 minute walk away. There's plenty of food options around nearby including a supermarket opposite the hotel and many cafes open at all hours so meals are not a problem. The only minor issue was that we shared a floor with noisy Mainland Chinese visitors who would keep their TV on loud til midnight and open their doors wide talking loudly to each other while eating food on their beds. They would also sometimes get up very early and do the same thing. It's a cultural thing and extremely unpleasant. Overall a great option; I would stay there again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Hkheng
Reviews.Content: Although it's located few blocks away from Mongkok MTR, there are free shuttle bus services that drops passengers off near Mongkok or Tsim Sha Tsui MTR. The staffs were very friendly & helpful. The room is very clean. Very comfortable environment. There's also free wifi at the lobby area. Would definitely go back again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Kowloon Hotel offering full breakfast and prompt service”
Reviews.Author: EvaI1
Reviews.Content: The Metropark Kowloon offers a spacious room in Kowloon. The hotel shuttle takes you to Mong Kok subway on a regular basis. The buffet breakfast provides a great start to the day. It would be nice if the coffee cups were larger since I notice people taking the soup dishes for their morning coffee. Requests for assistance was promptly dealt with by the housekeeping and maintenance staff. Location is good for nearby markets and local eateries.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Wilf S
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in march and 1 night in april 2012. I stayed in the Club area of the hotel and found the lounge to be very quite and comfortable with coffee/tea and newspapers and a 'happy hour' each evening with drinks and snacks. Buffet breakfast was excellent with a wide range of choices available. Staff were very friendly. Hotel is located slightly away from the the CBD but was easily reached by MTR.

Reviews.Title: “satisfactory but little expensive”
Reviews.Author: vikb4u
Reviews.Content: we read lots of reviews before finalising this hotel.we were looking for a hotel near the polytech university and we also wanted a hotel near the market in kowloon.we booked executive floors,which are better than their normal flours.the view was not very good from the room as our room was on the back side of hotel.the room was small. the metro line was around 300 to 400 mts,not very near as claimed.hotel has a regular drop facility from hotel to mongkok market on regular intervals. the breakfast was ok (the first floor restaurent offers better choice of food in breakfast as compare to executive floor restaurent). the pool was on top floor but small.overall satisfactory hotel but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaDD
Reviews.Content: The service and email arrangements were very good and efficient. The shuttle service to/from the airport was really good too. Hotel staff were friendly and made my room change very smooth. Pricewise - was one of the cheaper ones. Rooms - The first night I was there myself and got given a room that was basic and the bathroom was old. It was a bit uncomfortable and the air conditioning could not be controlled - it was still under the old system. The bathroom was well worn out with the bath plughole filled with hair and 'stuff'. However, the second night I moved rooms to the Family room and it was a very different story. The room was new and looked like the photos on the website. The bathroom was new and clean. Location wise is a nice 10-15 min walk to the MongKok East train station or 20+min walk to MongKok. Overall was an OK stay - made better by the family room when others joined me.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable stay and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Robin T
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel in Dec2011. I find the location gd. near to quite a few eatries. and also walking distance to TST. it also also just 1 min walk to price edward MTR. u can shop along the shops while walking to and fro TST. the only setback is the hotel is under going some upgrading so the room tends to be noise from 8-9am onwards. nite time is ok.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Jan C
Reviews.Content: At first when booking in on the first floor of the hotel, I had my reservations about the quality. We stayed there for 5 nights (family of six in three rooms). The service was impeccable and we were booked in no time. Location is not the greatest, but the shuttle bus that leave the hotel every 30minutes makes a huge difference and takes you near to wherever you want to be. The swimming pool is divine and the breakfasts were to die for. Book out time of 14hoo helped us a lot as we flew out late afternoon. The rooms are what you can expect in Hong-Kong, small, but comfortable. We did feel the hotel was somewhat “tired” and needs a refurbishment soon.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely I would recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: joanne m
Reviews.Content: When we got to the hotel it was very early in the morning; nevertheless the hotel made sure that they got a room ready for us very quickly. The breakfasts were great as was the food provided by room service. Although it is a little further away from the harbour than we realised, there was a punctual bus that left the hotel every half an hour and returned from the Peninsula up until 11 pm at night. You can either get the same bus to the Ladie's market or it is a short walk from the hotel. The staff couldn't be more friendly if you were staying at the Ritz. We had an amazing, although unfortunate experience there... my daughter got sick over the Easter holidays so a doctor couldn't come to the hotel to see her. Somebody from the hotel came with us to the hospital and stayed with us until we had gone through all the correct procedures to see the doctor. Likewise a few days later she had to see a doctor - this time the doctor downstairs was open, and a member of staff came with us, and stayed with us throughout our visit. I have never experienced anything like that. Because my daughter was not well the hotel let us keep our room until 7pm with no extra charge. I can't recommend it highly enough! The rooms were nice, we never made it up to the pool but I'm sure it's lovely and I believe it's unusual in Hong Kong to have a pool, the air conditioning was excellent, and the staff wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Situated in good location for shopping experience.”
Reviews.Author: was2005
Reviews.Content: The hotel situated in central of Mongkok. Very near to ladies markets. To RC Car and other RC fans, this hotel is about 300 meters from the famous Kwong Wa Street. Where you can find all your RC needs. The breakfast choice was not to my liking thus I am not recommending it. Overall I was happy with the service provided by the counter staff and the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Will come back again!”
Reviews.Author: Wanderlustzz
Reviews.Content: Had a 5d4n stay at metropark kowloon! Pretty pleasant hotel with good service! Staff are generally friendly and helpful. Room is what i expected and housekeeping staff are very efficient. Only minus is that the lift area is pretty narrow and lift takes awhile to come as there are only 4 of them. Shuttlebus services are really convenient as it stops at mongkok too, additional to tsim sha tsui. Request for 2 different type of rooms to be side by side and they arranged it! Very pleased. It would be even better if Wi-Fi is available in rooms FOC too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel to book if you have lots of time to spend in HKG”
Reviews.Author: sonicpizza
Reviews.Content: Room and lobby of this hotel was clean and nice. There was free wifi in the lobby so that's a great plus. The Mongkok Station is probably a 10-minute walk. The walk is actually fine for grown-ups but having 2 kids in tow makes it difficult. They have a shuttle service that will bring you to their stop in Mongkok and Tsim Sha Tsui every thirty minutes and then pick you up at the same spot going back. The bus gets filled, though, so you have to be there 10-15 minutes earlier if you're a family. This is generally a good hotel to stay in if you are not running on a tight schedule. Getting ready to board the shuttle and waiting for it to finally leave actually eats up a lot of time. A good one hour or so each day is probably spent on that. It could've been faster to get around HKG if the hotel was a lot closer to the MTR station. Also, we left a $100 deposit to the hotel upon check-in which was refundable upon check-out. We forgot to get the deposit, though, when we checked out. We only found out about it when our travel agent from Manila informed us the next day to go back to Metropark Kowloon Hotel to get our deposit. It was such a hassle because we were right in the middle of a fun day at Disneyland. My husband was the one who went back to get the deposit. It took him a good 4 hours to do that because of all the hassle of having to look for our hotel receipt in our luggage, take a bus, ride MTRs, etc. This could have been avoided had the front desk staff reminded me to get the deposit upon check-out. When I checked out, the receptionist just called to have our room checked and then she said everything was okay. It should have been mandatory for their front desk receptionist to remind each customer to get their deposit upon check-out every single time.

Reviews.Title: “Okay place to stay, staff great, rooms small”
Reviews.Author: travelwmn
Reviews.Content: Last minute decision to stay in Hong Kong three night, would have preferrred staying in Harbor area. This is very walkable to the market, which is amazingly huge. They ran a shuttle every half hour to the market and harbor, which was very convenient. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I went to the front desk to ask for an electrical converter and it made it to my room before I did! When I checked in I asked if I might upgrade and they said they had upgraded me to a Deluxe Room. Fortunately I was travelling alone - it was small, but comfortable. The bathroom was very nice (and small, but ok). Other than the carpet being a bit tacky/sticky, the furniture showed wear, but was a comfortable bed and clean. The restaurant and bar service wasn't great (but I guess when travelling alone you have more time to notice you can't get anyone's attention). Overall, I would consider staying there again, but for not being near the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarpl
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Rooms ok. not enoough storage Location - good, not near a metro station, but in front of the hotel at least 3 bus-lines. There is also a free shuttel every 30 min.. and texi. Breakfast buffet was very good and reach. if you come for more then a day, buy the "octopus card" for all public transportation, and you can even buy with it in 7/11 and sturbacs. you can recharge it at 7/11, as well as in the metro station. .

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, but nice and clean hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Tarnold8200
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night while in Hong Kong. It was a nice clean hotel, in a pretty good location. They have shuttles that take you several places, but it is very easy and cheap to use taxis. It cost 20 HKD (about 3 USD) to go to the Temple Street Night Market and 40 HKD to get to the Star Ferry. Their shuttles only go once an hour, so it was nice to have more freedom than that. Concierge and Bell Staff were very nice and helpful. There are several fast food restaurants near the hotel, within walking distance. Do not take their shuttle to the airport for a tight connection. It picked up on time, and then took over an hour to pick up at three other hotels, before getting to the airport. The whole trip took forever, so add some extra time for your flight if you choose this option

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Surprised it is on a 3 Star”
Reviews.Author: Gow
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in February, I arranged the hotel transfer which was the easiest way as you jump on a bus and arrive your hotel, although quite expensive at HK$110 compared to HK£90 on the Airport Express, it does get you to the door. I had a room on the 6th floor, which was a great room, very clean with nice decor, bathroom was modern and clean. I liked there was free internet in the room, I had my notebook so it was just a matter of plugging in and surfing/emailing friends. I heard the wifi in reception was slow, but the speed of the internet in the room was great. I read some reports of reception being slow, it was not as fast as others I have been but adequate and they were curtious. The only issue was a few staff in the lobby were a little "Not interested", but only a few, other days were great. I had a room only and had breakfast in the cake shop at the hotel. The mushroom and potato bakes were stunning......for only HK$8.....yummy.....The location to me was perfect, was only a 10 min walk from Yau Mai Tei.....and only 5 mins from Mongkok east (which is perfect if you are going to Sha Tin races which I did.....what a great day out), if you don't wanna walk to Hong Kong front, the hotel offers a free shuttle bus.....which I took if I felt lazy, other wise I walk about 45 mins to Tsim Sha Tsui.....:).......down Nathan road. I did not go to the restaurant as there was many around the area and cheaper and better value. The sip sip bar was nice though.......:).....show all the premier league matches......:)......I would certainly use this hotel again.......:)....I booked mine through netflights.com and had 3 nights for the price of 4 and 15 online discount.......the room worked out to be around £40 per night..... Bargain

Reviews.Title: “Review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated just at the edge of the central part of Hong Kong. You could get another hotel that is more centraly located for the same price. The rooms are small but clean and have enough amenities. The reception staff was friendly and helpful I cannot say the same about the concierge. The room we stayed in was a bit noisy (some closeby ventilation) during the evening and had a poor view.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: balraj13
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an easy 10min walk to the night ladies market and Nathan road another 10 min stroll away. We stayed on the 10th floor in a back facing standard room .There was no discernable noise, but then we had come from India where it is comparatively noisy. The room was of a similar size to what you get in Melbourne and there was complimentary water bottles each night. The bed was comfortable ( we got sick and spent 15hrs in bed )and the bathroom ok though some of the detail finishing was of a lower standard. The only complaint would be that the air con seemed to take a long time to be getting very warm, as if the thermostat didn't work ( it was very cold in March), and there were no extra blankets. The curtesy buses were very handy to get direct to Tsim Sha Sui and the Airport. ( The airport one is not from the hotel). Overall a good hotel and would be prepared to stay here again. ( Not that I want to go back to Hong Kong ).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: E F
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. The room was lovely and modern, comfortable and kept very clean. In a very good location, we walked everywhere. We arrived early in the morning and checked straight in. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely return.”
Reviews.Author: Mull07
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in February for four nights during our first visit to Hong Kong ...based on the reviews here and the price. We stayed in a room on the Club floors and it was extremely good value with breakfast and happy hours included. The room and bathroom were very clean, well equipped and comfortable. Robes, slippers, a large umbrella and fruit provided and you even get a choice of pillows!! Luxurious enough for us. Staff were always friendly and helpful.The shuttle bus service was very convenient to get to the river and ferries. We also enjoyed our walks to the local MTR. We will definitely return..to Hong Kong and this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Stay on Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: suggs99
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Metropark Hotel Kowloon on Sunday lunchtime, for a 6 night stay having got a very good price for the Club rooms, this included, breakfast, 'Happy Hour' Which is 2 hours of free drinks and snacks in the evening, free wireless internet and use of the club lounge. so it actully paid for itself. Check in was ok, though a little slow, the service in general in the hotel was very good, but occasionally we found one or two members of staff, sadly lacked the customer service element of the job. After a kip, we ventured to the club lounge for Happy Hour, which is beer, some spirits, juice etc and snacks. The snacks varied by the day. Drinks were topped up and service again in general was good. The swimming pool was closed for maintenance, which was a shame, but the weather for the duration was not 'swimming pool' weather with the exception of one day. The rooms were fine, normal city break size, LCD telly, mini bar, complimentry bottles of water suppiled. Breakfast could be taken in either the club lounge, which was more a continental affair, or downstairs in the restaurant, which is a greater selection. We tried both and the quality of both very good. As was the cake shop on the ground floor. Locally as many have mentioned is a 7/11 and circle K store, a Macdonalds and some local restaurant. Ladies Market is 5 minutes away and the MTR station about 15 minutes. We walked to the waterfront at Tsim Sha Shui in 45 mins. I would recommend going through Kowloon park if you can, a) for the relief from the traffic and b) for the relief from the 'copy watch' 'tailor' etc hawkers. Hong Kong park is also very nice. We used the hotel shuttle bus to Tsim Sha Shui once and it was fine. Booked the airport bus back to the airport with little problems. So overall a really good value stay, one or two niggles, but nothing major.

Reviews.Title: “My second stay here”
Reviews.Author: naej
Reviews.Content: This hotel suits me just fine when I am in Hong Kong. Both times I stayed on the club floor with unbelievable rates. Worth the extra. No problem with the location and the hotel bus very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Anujbhargava
Reviews.Content: Hotel is connected to airport by airport buses, which stop at the hotel entrance. Its a good looking place, slightly expensive. Our room was small, we barely had place to walk . But basic amenities were provided, like tv, toiletries, tea maker, etc. breakfast was good. service was not the best, but acceptable. location is very good. its near a metro station and famous ladies market. hotel also has city tour operators, and free bus service to some of the main tourists spots in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel service”
Reviews.Author: amysabrm
Reviews.Content: i just came back from hongkong and stayed at METROPARK HOTEL KOWLOON Hongkong. I Have choosen this hotel after read a good comments from tripadvisor. 100% recommend to others who are planning to have a vacation in hongkong. As other say, FREE SHUTTLE BUS to nearest mtr and mongkok areas make us convenient to travel around.The staff very helpfull..The room more spacious compare with other hotel in hongkong..Upon arival at airport, go to booth 17 b (metropark transportation service) you can request limousine, or mini van (alphard 7 seater ) which cost only HKD 650.the tansportation bill will be included in your hotel bill.So you dont have to pay to the driver.. Shops, 7-11 ,circle k very close with this hotel.. got clinic attached with the hotel building.. so overall we are enjoy stayed in metropark hotel kowloon.. For those who are plan to go to shenzhen too, do book thier hotel link metropark shenzhen..this hotel have dinning room, kitchen and 1 bedroom. very nice hotel ...

Reviews.Title: “A bit remote m but ok”
Reviews.Author: pine129
Reviews.Content: My company booked me when our regular hotels were booked. I was annoyed at the taxi fare, but was easily offset by the lower room rates. The hotel was very busy during my stay- almost hectic. We were booked in Club level rooms and I found them satisfactory. My colleagues advised that normal rooms are smaller. Club level included breakfast and internet. I found the rooms comfortable, but close to being in need of updating. Cleanliness was fine, but the rooms probably will need upgrades within a year. The front desk was always busy and in my opinion should have had more staff working. I will stay here again due to room rates if I am on Club floor.

Reviews.Title: “V good hotel”
Reviews.Author: KenKnighton
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights and we found it to be a very good hotel. Staff were helpful and the breakfast was excellent. The free shuttle bus was great and we used it many times.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable”
Reviews.Author: traveller_0977
Reviews.Content: I have been to HK twice, the rooms are exceptionally cramp but that is normal for a standard room. Fulfill basic needs and location wise is not at a hot spot where it is near to MTR, 10 to 15 mins walk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: GullibleBristol
Reviews.Content: This mid price hotel offers more than meets the eye. Rooms are comfortable, clean and well serviced.Although the hotel is a little way off the hustle and bustle of Nathan Rd, regular free shuttle buses run to MTR stations at Mong Kok and Tsim Sha Tsui. Restaurants offer good value for money, especially the 'House of Tang' which has a fantastic range of authentic Chinese dishes on offer. Discount vouchers for guests are provided for both restaurants. The 'Sip Sip' bar has a 2 for 1 offer on all drinks from 4-9 each day which is a bonus. However, what makes this hotel stand out is the unfailingly friendly and attentive approach of the staff. This is the second Metropark hotel we have used and high quality service has been a characteristic of both. We would certainly return

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Garbage”
Reviews.Author: fandm12
Reviews.Content: I go to Hong Kong twice a year and usually stay at the Metropark in Causeway Bay. They were sold out during my visit this time so I decided to stay at the Kowloon location. This hotel is garbage. The rooms are damp, old and moldy. The beds are uncomfortable. The carpet is gross. My friend and I were afraid to walk in the room barefoot because of how dirty it was. I traveled with a friend this time thinking this hotel was like the one in Causeway Bay and I was ashamed of it. The pictures on the website do not represent the current stay of the hotel. The wifi is terrible in the lobby. It's pathetic that a hotel in HK does not have wifi in the rooms. During the mornings, everyone huddles in the lobby on their ipads and phones trying to connect to the internet and it continuously fails. I found the front desk staff to be unhelpful and rude. I asked them a few questions and I was ignored. Instead, they were always so helpful to the non-Asian foreigners. A bit biased, in my opinion. Also, it is not a 7minute walk to Mongkok. It is more like 15-20 minutes. Terrible location. Overall, it was a horrible stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: JonnyMorrison
Reviews.Content: Well, this is was the first time that I had been out of Europe and the heat was amazing, so staying in this lovely hotel made it all better and I really got used to the heat quickly. The room was a twin room on the 7th floor (if I remember correctly) and it was lovely. It was clean, the bathroom was nice and all in all was a really great room. I only went to the restaurant in the hotel for breakfast one day because it was quite expensive (as expected in a hotel), but I went to Teresa's Café which is just next door and did cheap breakfasts (even did a bacon sandwich, which I was craving at one point) and I went for a meal a couple of times too. I really recommend going there. The location on Waterloo Road I found to be great even though it's not incredibly close to an MTR station, I found the 10 minute walk to Yau Ma Tei rather nice. I didn't have much to do with the staff, but when I did, they were always very helpful and attentive. The swimming pool on the roof is an absolute godsend in the heat and I thoroughly urge you to go up and try it. I thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone and I will be staying there again in Summer 2012, booking through Dial-A-Flight because they have cheaper prices at the moment.
