Reviews.Title: “Decent value for money”
Reviews.Author: russellc100
Reviews.Content: We booked three nights in this hotel on (free) airmiles. Subsequently we were given what I suspect is one of the worst rooms in the hotel - on the 19th (top) floor just across from the lifts and in close proximity to the lift motors. So the noise from the lifts was incessant (earplugs required at night). Also very low water pressure, shower reduced to somewhat of a trickle. Still because it was "free" we didn't feel at liberty to complain about it. Otherwise this hotel was satisfactory - rooms were clean and comfortable, everything worked as it should etc. The location is reasonably good. Lots of shops and restaurants in the immediate vicinity. It's a 15 minute walk down to Mong Kok, ladies market etc and takes maybe an hour or so to walk down to Tsim Sha Tsui, harbour, star ferry etc - but there is also a regular free hotel shuttle bus that takes you down there, which is a very good service. There is free broadband in the rooms, but it's via an ethernet cable so limited to 1 computer at a time and obviously won't work on iphones etc. There is a small gym and pool on the roof of the hotel. The gym had a functioning treadmill and a few other machines, adequate and as per expections for a hotel gym. Overall this hotel gets a tick and since it was free we can't complain too much about the downsides.

Reviews.Title: “Star Factor: Shuttle Bus”
Reviews.Author: tangibleprseence
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for 3 night near to Lunar new year. The hotel service is good and the staff is always ready to help. They are patient and courteous. The room that I stayed in is a little worn out, perhaps due to age. But it does have it cleanliness standard. The standard double room is slightly small but it still have moving space. Service is good. They tidy up the room well and punctually everyday. As the weather is cold, there is a card left by the attendant to remind us to wear more clothes. The hotel is near to Mongkok MTR, but walking distance is still long. The shuttle bus helps a lot and it is always very very punctual.

Reviews.Title: “my favorite hotel in HK”
Reviews.Author: rawsushi
Reviews.Content: stay in the upgraded rooms (all on 16 and 17). it's a little bit more but but you get free breakfast, free happy food (good enough to be called a dinner) and free alcohol. rooms are very clean, beds are great, showers are strong and hot, and the TV channels provide lots of options. you can get a FREE shuttle to/ from airport you can enjoy the pool (on roof) in summer you will get great service

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: doshshirl
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed in this hotel for 5 days three weeks ago. On the day of check-out, my mother reported a loss of a HKD1,000 note to the hotel staff and claimed that she could have left it in her room before check-out or could have dropped it outside the hotel. Immediately, four hotel staff in suits brought my parents to their room and searchted the room thoroughly. They even lifted up the bed mattresses even though the money could not possibly be there. We were simply amazed and surprised by the 6-star service which we never expect from this hotel. After returning to our country, my parents found the HKD1,000 note. =) The shuttle bus was very regular, which makes it very convenient to town even though the hotel was not near any mtr.

Reviews.Title: “A great base for exploring Kowloon and New Territory”
Reviews.Author: rwgansley
Reviews.Content: We have visited HK six times in the past and returned to the Metropark after staying there 18 months ago. It is not the hotel to stay in if it is your first time in HK, it is quite a journey to Hong Kong Island (45 minutes)which is the best place to explore the first time around. We returned to the Metropark because we love the area around Mong Kok,not just the markets(the ladies market can be expreienced anywhere in the world),but there are numerous other markets selling all things weird and the wonderful within a short distance of the hotel. This year we did the flower market, the"buttons and bows market", the goldfish street and the songbird park. All of them unique to Hong Kong. There are many interesting temples around Kowloon,some of them being very active (Tip; get hold of the book "DK Eye Witness..Top 10 Hong Kong" or Insight Guides " Hong Kong Step by Step" We explored the New Territories from the hotel on our last visit using the MTR, local buses and light railways...it was fascinating, specially the walled villages. All of these activities would be more difficult to do from hotels on the island. What about the hotel? It is functional, not the sort of place to spend a great deal of time sitting around. We found that the room we had this time was nowhere near as spacious as the one we had on our previous visit. My wife was frustrated by the lack of hanging space and drawers, we were there for 7 nights and had to live out of our suitcases. We booked room only and did not try the hotel food, a bit on the expensive side for us. We enjoy going local and so used Teresa's Cafe two doors away from the hotel. It is very LOCAL but obviously caters for quite a few evacuees from the Metropole. They have a breakfast menu in English for the English. Bacon, eggs(fried/scrambled), hash browns,toast tea,coffee and orange juice are on offer. The service is quick and friendly, the bill rarely came to more than £7 for the two of us. The shuttle bus service is good, taking you to Mong Kok MTR or into TST(Star Ferry Terminal). We often gave the bus a miss as the walk to Mong Kok MTR station only takes 10 minutes. Often the bus has problems with the volume of traffic on the roads and takes longer than 10 minutes. The Metropole is great value for the money. It is the perfect centre for exploring the alternative Hong Kong. We shall no doubt book there again when we return to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in good location.”
Reviews.Author: MickDNorfolk
Reviews.Content: Convenient for major markets and places to eat. Free shuttles to airport train and to ferry/waterfront. Efficient and pleasant service and clean well-sized rooms. Had a bakery/cake store attached that offered delicious, cheap savoury and sweet buns ideal for breakfast. With a bargain internet booking, this was probably the best value hotel we have ever stayed in. Will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “City break”
Reviews.Author: Geoff C
Reviews.Content: Great location and facilities. We stayed here in December and really enjoyed it. The staff are so helpful ( the manager even lent me his mobile phone to sort an issue with travel co. as reception was busy). The rooms are just what you need with plenty of room and are surprisingly quiet for a city. MTR stations and bus stops are minutes away and although the hotel provides a courtesy coach to the Star Ferry take a walk down Nathan Road and absorb the atmosphere. We tried both restaurants and the bar and all were superb but the food and service in the House of Tang restaurant were exceptional. Altogether highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Calm oasis from hot Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: PTCooper
Reviews.Content: Every year my 3 business partners and I go somewhere in the world for a boys week. In 2010 we visited Hong Kong and stayed at the Metropark Hotel, Kowloon. This was the 3rd time I'd visited Hong Kong, but the first time for 2 of my partners. 3 is my lucky number and this was certainly my most enjoyable visit, partly because I knew my way around by now, but mostly because I had found an excellent, but not over-priced, hotel. Their in-house restaurant served excellent breakfasts, the food was so good that we went against our normal rules and even ate a dinner in our hotel. Their pool was a welcome oasis for a mid-afternoon cool off and break from the hustle and bustle. The staff were friendly and helpful without being intrusive, and their shuttle service was on time, every time. With the traffic congestion in Hong Kong that was quite a feat. Every time I visit Hong Kong I like it more and more, so this hotel stands a very good chance of seeing repeat business from me.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel some distance from most sites”
Reviews.Author: Wren104
Reviews.Content: Metropark Kowloon has many pluses, the shuttle which takes guests both to a local metro station and to the Star Ferry teminal, its buffet breakfast is varied and delicious and the Chinese restaurant (House of Tang) provides good quality meals. Rooms are not as small as some reviews suggest, certainly the 9th floor room where we stayed for three nights (not a club floor room) compared favourably in size with many hotel rooms in, sy, London. What prevents the hotel scoring 5 stars is its location, some way from any sights. It's possible to walk to Nathan St in about 10 minutes but is not near to any other of the major sites. Reasonably priced, a good choice for a few days but not if you only have a day or two.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: shiborime
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference from 26 December 2011 to 2 January 2012, first trip overseas for me. I stayed at the Metropark Hotel, Kowloon, and found everyone from the cleaning staff to the reception and management to be very friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay within easy walking distance to the MTR (metro). The room was a twin share, club room, comfortably appointed with all essentials. My only problem was the hardness of the bed, but I am especially sensitive, so perhaps felt it more than others would. I had a great time and would love to return in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “very clean and accomodating staff”
Reviews.Author: Theresa Y
Reviews.Content: I spent Chistmas with my whole family in Hong Kong. When we arrived at the hotel, the staff was very accomodationg. The bell boy, the reception people, restaurant manager and waiters of Palm Court and even the driver of the shuttle bus was very kind and courteous. The hotel lobby was very clean. The buffet breakfast was excellent. ur hotel room was also very clean. I will come back again to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not really a 4 star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jacklin_chang
Reviews.Content: Apart from the shuttle service, which is not a novelty, this hotel lacks the minimum service to pretend to this title. I book two rooms- one double and one triple -- Family Room on the 10th floor ( not the club lounge) and the cleaning was of irregular level, table not cleaned, Tea was omitted for two days and had to ask for it, the doorman who is paid to open doors for the guests, simply chat with his colleagues and let you open the door yourself. The furniture shows age and there is rust stains in the bathroom. The telephone set has not seen a cleaning cloth for long. The foam bath has an almost replusive smell of over ripe orange. Fortunately the shuttle service is fine and you have a newspaper morning. Among the other good things are -the free internet service, free water bottles and free chocolate bite with your weather forecast every night. The pool and the gym on the 19th floor are of an acceptable level. Good location since you cross the road and there is a Wellcome supermarket as well as a laundry service Man Yee. Very soon a starbucks coffee shop will open in the Victory Avenue the first road on the right. The toilets was faulty and the maintenance had to intervene twice though this was done quickly. I would recommend the hotel if you are not itchy on the service and is of the type of resident who spends most of his time out of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault”
Reviews.Author: panther029
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at the Metropark and enjoyed every one of them. Our room was not large but certainly ample space for us and it was very clean and tidily presented, The staff were at all times courteous, friendly and obliging - albeit in a rather business-like manner - not surprising I guess given the high proportion of business travellers. The buffet breakfast was nicely presented and plentiful. We had the buffet dinner (in the same restaurant) one evening and while a nice selection is available, we thought it just a little overpriced. Anyway, given the great location of this hotel, with hundreds of eateries within easy walking distance, why eat in? For us, the location is perfect, right on the edge of old Hong Kong with all it's colour and activity... and the free shuttle bus makes it easy to get around too. Couldn't fault the Metropark for location, accomodation and service,,, we recommend it. Oh by the way, the pre-booked shuttle to and from the airport is a good value option.

Reviews.Title: “I will choose this hotel again!”
Reviews.Author: IreneSalazar-Paj
Reviews.Content: My family spent a trip here in Hong Kong and we chose this hotel. I will rate this hotel for cleanliness 5 star, room 5 star, and front desk/concierge/information desk 4 star. The free shuttle to the nearest MTR was helpful and an advantage. Their food (breakfast buffet) was good and sufficient, they also offered as a discount card! The location is perfect as well, you can walk to go to nearest train stations, there's a nearby bus stops, short stroll to night markets, and the Airport Express shuttle bus drops by in front of the hotel---very convenient. Overall, it was a great stay and nice experience in Hong Kong. This hotel completes our trip!

Reviews.Title: “We keep coming back ...”
Reviews.Author: Jan238
Reviews.Content: We've now paid 8 visits to Hong Kong, and this was our 7th stay at the Metropark. So okay, the furnishings in our room looked a bit worn, but the room was clean and comfortable and the staff were very pleasant. One thing we'd definately recommend is the breakfast in the Palm Court restaurant - plenty of choice for all tastes. The only very minor gripe is that the bath towels provided are a bit on the small side for us larger Europeans. The hotel is in an ideal location if you want to see the "real" Hong Kong, because you can comfortably wander around the nearby streets without being continually accosted by tailor's touts. The free shuttle bus to and from Mongkok and Tshim Sha Tsui is an advantage, although taxis won't cost you a fortune. If you want somewhere that offers good value for money, then the Metropark is definately worth consideration - I hope we'll be staying there again on our next trip !

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeSolo
Reviews.Content: Good rooms and business lounge. Nice food but since this is Hong Kong I preferred eating out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Food and Service”
Reviews.Author: ferrets111
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights during a stop over to Sydney. I flew in from London, tired and very very hungry as Virgin Atlantic's service is shocking. I used the transfer from Hong Kong airport and it is smooth and only $100hk each way, on arrival I was taken to reception and welcomed and quickly checked in. I had a great room and everything you could want from a city hotel. The bathrooms are large and the shower is warm and very powerful. I had room service which is cheap and good quality. I chose this hotel as the location is fantastic and close to all the sights of Kowloon. The complimentary hotel shuttle bus takes you to the centre and a stop close to the metro (very cheap metro and so easy to use). The bakery is great and offers some nice options (perfect for a grab and go option). I'd go back here again. I slept well and was refreshed for my onward journey to Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable for HK”
Reviews.Author: Car933
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 night in early Dec 2011, because it is not far from the attractions in Kowloon at a reasonable price and a descent room size for HK. Also free in-room internet and free shuttle to central attractions in TST, the shopping and the Star ferry, every 30 minutes. 10 min walk to ladies market and 15 min to MTR station Mong Kok and Langham Place mall. Service was excellent and place was clean. Only negative was room was too cold had to shut off A/C every day.

Reviews.Title: “Faded and grubby hotel”
Reviews.Author: alexia b
Reviews.Content: Quite cheap I guess, but dirty and smelly (our room was 'non-smoking' but obviously hadn't been so for long - the cleaners spray deodorant when they do the rooms, but it soon goes off and the horrid, dirty smell returns). The public areas are of course much better. The restaurants are both mediocre and over priced. We ate chinese one night and Cajun chicken the other. The Chinese was quite good but the Cajun had barely even sniffed the spices so was very bland, and was served with a very little rice, plus cauliflower, tinned carrots and broccoli! We had two stays a month apart (pre-booked) and both times we arrived they had trouble finding out booking - not amusing after a 12 hour flight! Beds were comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended Hotel for Filipinos”
Reviews.Author: CzarinaMaye
Reviews.Content: It's my second time to stay in this hotel and so far so good! :) It has the basic amenities that every hotel has to offer so please do not expect it to look like the Peninsula or Shangri-la. From the airport, you can ride the airport express going to Kowloon station. The airport express offers free hotel shuttle service (look for gate K5) that would bring you directly to this hotel. Since we booked for a club room, we were able to check-in earlier (we arrived around 9am) than the usual check-in time. Most hotels in Hong Kong offer hotel rooms that are really small. But with Metropark, you get the usual standard size room so its not really that small. Bathrooms were small but at least they're squeaky clean. Hotel also provide adaptors with no extra charge in case you need one. Hotel is a bit far from Yua Ma Tei MTR (10-15 mins walk) so If you have plans to go out, the hotel offers free shuttle service going to Mongkok and Tsimshatsui area every 30 mins. There's also a bus stop in the hotel so you'll have no problems with transportation As for food, we availed our buffet breakfast in the Palm Court together with the rest of the fam. They serve almost the same array of food everyday. Its not the best but its definitely a filling breakfast that would give you enough energy to tour around HK. I wouldn't mind going back/recommending to family and friends. I love Metropark Hotel Kowloon and I can't wait to go back! :)

Reviews.Title: “An okay stay but probably not again”
Reviews.Author: artemis1
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed here for about a week mid November. We had stayed here last year but only for a couple of nights, I guess you don't mind things as much when you're hardly there at all. We had a double room booked on the Metropark floor. The room we got initially was fine, faced the back of the hotel so quiet. But, when I went to unpack my case, no drawers, except for one small one in the wardrobe. What are you to do for so many nights? I didn't want to be living out of my suitcase, and as it was, husband had already taken up the space to lay his suitcase out so there was only floor space ( and limited) for mine so I'd be tripping over it all the time. We complained ( convinced also that last year the room was bigger) and grudgingly got given another room across the hall. it was slightly bigger, well thankfully big enough to store my case upright in a corner but still not a drawer to speak of. Ended up having to lay out my underwear for the week and socks adn t-shirts on the chair. Really weird. Anyway, that was the first pain in the backside. Next one - brekkie. We knew from experience the choice on the Metropark floor was a lot more limited than on the lower level but one day we were in a rush so thought we'd just get some juice, fruit and toast. This was at 10am, brekkie served until 10.30 am so not cutting it too fine. No tables laid out for any new guests, had to ask about that. Went to get a glass for juice, no glasses, asked for more. Then went to get fruit, barely a slice so asked if there was any more available, and told that was it. Great. So we went downstairs and got our brekkie there. Now this is supposed to be for business travellers as well as holiday makers. I get that most business folk would have been on their way by then, but you can't offer the service and then provide nothing. Poor service as far as I'm concerned. Otherwise, the stay was fine. Our second room desperately needed a refurb despite charging a lot more than last year. They have a hotel shuttle which we used on occassion. Best bit was probbaly the free drinks in the evening, nice to have a couple of glasses of wine before heading out for dinner. The changed the hours for this , was 4-6 but now a much more appropriate 5.30-7.30. Food - ate most nights we were nearby at Teresa's which is next to the hotel. Food fantastic, Chinese menu much bigger than the English translated one but even if you have to stick to the trnaslated one, you won't be disappointed. Can't recommend Teresa's enough! Would I stay at the Metropole again? I like the location but used to live nearby so I'm biased. Love the markets nearby, but have to question hard if I'd put up with the stanadards of the hotel. I'd rather pay more and stay at the YMCA I think.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, though lift noise can be bothersome”
Reviews.Author: danspetson
Reviews.Content: Being a first time visitor to Hong Kong I had my reservations about staying here, wondering if it would be too far away. But for me it was perfect as I got to see plenty of Hong Kong, but was away from all the hustle & bustle. The free shuttle service from hotel to either MongKok station or Tsimshat sui was great. You can then pick up the star ferry over to Hong Kong island, which I loved doing, so cheap & quick & easy. Once on the island, I just hopped on & off trams all day exploring, at 2.30hk$ a time it is incredibly cheap,about 20p a ride!! Sit upstairs and just watch the street life. Hotel management are wonderful, especially Keith. Cab fares are equally inexpensive, it cost around HK$20 - £2, to go from Tsimshat sui to Hong Kong Museum of history ( closed Tues / free admission Wed ). The roof top pool was nice enough - had the sun been shining i'm sure I would have loved it - unfortunately, visiting in November, i saw lots of rain.Though when I came back in December, the weather was better. The hotel Buffet breakfast offers plenty of choice & eggs freshly cooked to your liking. Take the free shuttle to Mongkok - there is a great market there - don't forget to haggle!! You can easily walk back to the hotel from here in 10-15 minutes. Conveient supermarket across the road. I'm returning here in 3 weeks and look forward to it. Area recommendations Hong Kong island MongKok station & area for market Must see Take star ferry to Hong Kong island, then Bus 15C to catch Peak tram. Ensure you have exact change or be happy to not receive change on buses. HK$2.30 for 15c per passenger, I just deposited 5HK$ for the 2 of us, was not worth worrying about a couple of pennies overpaid! Do ride the trams, impossible to get lost, they all eventually come back down the main road where you can catch star ferry after 10 min undercover walk. Now the negatives: Lift very noisy, the first room I stayed in backed onto the lift shaft and kept me awake the whole 3 nights. I returned there 3 weeks later after a trip to Thailand and was put in a different room, which although did not back onto the lift, I could still hear the lift. Some of the other guests I spoke to also complianed about the lift noise and also asked to be moved. We were all located on the club floors, so you would have hoped that these rooms would offer superior facilites and sound insulation etc. The hotel were concerned about my comments and made efforts to accomodate me, but in short the noise from the lift is awful & for a hotel of this class should not be beyond them to address! Sleep is obviously the reason you need a hotel room, so it should be the hotels priority to provide an environment to allow this to happen. Small rooms & small beds. Club rooms only beneficial if you take advantage of the free drinks. The ladies on duty are great at topping up your drinks, however if it is the guys on duty you have to ask for drinks, they will not offer. Free drinks only available between 530 & 730.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel with free shuttle”
Reviews.Author: HBBMalaysia
Reviews.Content: As requested I was given a handicapped room, non smoking floor and very near the lift. The room is big, and clean. I stayed for 7 nights book through RCI.It had a sip sip bar, Chinese restaurant and a western restaurant and room service.My flight was delayed for 5 hrs so we reach the hotel past 11pm We had no dinner yet and by the time we had checked in it was past 11.30pm and hotel restaurants were closed and we are not familiar in the hotels surrounding area to get food. Luckily the chef for room service was willing to serve us a bowl of wan tan noodles though they are closing for the night. Best of all, they provide a free shuttle bus every 30 mins making 1 st stop at Mangkok and the last one at Hankow Street(Tim Tsar Tsui). Save us from taking taxis and MTR is a distance away. Food is everywhere near the hotel. Hotel food is pretty expensive and not so good. Dont eat at hotel restaurants. However, I find that the hotel towels are a little brownish and does not smell fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Far enough away but close enough too”
Reviews.Author: DiamondGeezerUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights and people told us to stay on HK island rather than Kowloon but once settled we were very happy with the location. The shuttle buses will take you to the nearest metro and then onto the harbour front if you want. The ladies market and numerous other streets are walking distance and we found the area to be much better than by the harbour were vendors were constantly stepping in front of you and trying to sell you stuff. The roof top pool is great for when you fly out as you can store your luggage and then chill out before taking a shower. There is also a gym by the pool. The rooms are fine with wifi and the usual facilities. There is a small bar which has a happy hour - which is good because of the usual high hotel prices.

Reviews.Title: “satisfied!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nims_11
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for 4 nights..all in all a good hotel to stay at.its very conveniently located. although there is a free shuttle bus from the hotel to the main shopping area,we never could get on it as it was always full with local tourist.which we dint really mind as the ladies market and d train station is at max 10 min walking distance. the breakfast is very good as well.the only disappointing bit were the size of the rooms.we booked deluxe room and was still very small,which was still alright as the only time we were in the room was night to sleep.so all in all,a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Service & Quality Sleep!”
Reviews.Author: kthln_wong
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd time staying at this hotel. Stayed here 2 years back, was so satisfied that I decided to stay here again. The service was still as good and the room have not seemed to have changed at all! Their beds are very comfortable, and their area is not noisy. So you can have a good sleep at night. They also provide free shuttle bus service to 2 strategic location and the hotel itself is at a strategic location in Mongkok!

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: Calgarytripper11
Reviews.Content: Our reservation was done through a travel agent. We stayed 5 nights with our adult daughter in a triple room. It was really a double room with an extra bed put in as there was very little room to move about. But we were out most of the time . The check in and check out was quick. The room was a little dated but clean and we have no complaint about the amenities provided. The free shuttle service came in handy and ran late into the night. Most of the hotel staff were friendly and we were able to get the info we wanted.Overall our stay was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “It's a poor poor class 4 hotel. I've seen so many much better in this class.”
Reviews.Author: louismichaelphillips
Reviews.Content: Avoid if you can. It's not in a good location, it's smelly and a bit scruffy.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel to stay in!!”
Reviews.Author: NIKITINU
Reviews.Content: We were in metro park for 3 nights.the room was very small and there was no view from my room.the location of this hotel is far from the main area shim sha sui,but the free bus shuttle is a great benefit.I would recommend this hotel specially for it's free bus shuttle,every half an hour to shim sha Sui and mongkok.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny tiny room, unpleasant location and lobby”
Reviews.Author: lingoling
Reviews.Content: I was utterly disappointed with metropark kowloon. We stayed at metropark causeway bay and loved that hotel. This one though is another story. The rooms are super small even in HK standard. The lobby is a mad house and the location bleh. Service is alright but overall the worst hotel I stayed at in HK. Plus there is a very loud mechanical sound coming from the elevator which can be masked only if you turn the AC full blast. We stayed in a room farthest from the elevator but the noise resonates throughout the floor. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: l b
Reviews.Content: This hotel was first class from my arrival to departure. I arrived early and was offered either a smaller bed or smoking room to check in immediately or wait for a queen bed & non smoking. I opted to wait. My bags were taken and stored. I arrived back at the hotel and the front desk manager Keith Wu expedited my check in. The front desk officer Mirror took me to my room and explained all the features. I asked her about sights to see etc and upon my return that night there was an entire package on my desk completed with transportation details eg what bus or subway to take. Housekeeping, concierge, shuttle bus drivers to pier and the shuttle bus to the airport were excellent. Location was perfect. Lookng forward to my return.

Reviews.Title: “Clean spacious and comfortable rooms, Indifferent front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: JEmmanuelLasPinas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located close to the Ladies Market. A scheduled shuttle bus takes guests to the waterfront but seats are very limited. There are non-smoking floors. We got a Superior Room which was quite comfortable. The bathrooms were cleaned promptly by pleasant housekeeping staff. There is a small pool and fitness facilities on the top floor manned by courteous staff. Which is why it makes me wonder why the front desk is indifferent and not very welcoming. The breakfast buffet is adequate. There is a bus stop just steps away from the hotel. Over-all a good place to stay but there are other hotels for the same price. May or may not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “On our way back from RWC 2011”
Reviews.Author: sutton-womble
Reviews.Content: This was the better of the hotels we stayed at on our trip. Good room geat food and cheap. Their is a bus that takes you in to town every 30 mins.The hotel has a small pool on the roof on the 19th floor it's ok if you like hights if not don't look down. As their is not much around the hotel. The hotel runs a trip to the peak we did our own trip there and saved loads they wanted $278 (hong kong) we did it for $78.

Reviews.Title: “RWC 2011”
Reviews.Author: Richard C
Reviews.Content: We stopped over in HK on the way to New Zealand. This hotel is in a far from ideal location and the rooms are dark and dated. We were very disappointed with the dingy room and the grotty bathroom. Would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Jambc1234
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for three nights in May. It was easy to get to from the airport (the airport express bus takes you right to the hotel) The room itself was comfortable, decent sized, clean. The hotel does have a shuttle bus that goes to and from the dock. Not the most central location, but it's a short walk to a busy tourist shopping street (take a right out of the hotel) Breakfast in the club was small, but good. Breakfast in the main room had a very good selection.

Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel in "ok" location”
Reviews.Author: ptirvine
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a 6 day trip with my wife. Like most rooms the Hong Kong area, it is not too big. But still functional. Hotel was clean and a good value. For vacationing, I would not stay here again for the location alone. It is a 10 minute+ walk to the nearest MTR station and it is not that close to anything that might interest me. But other than location, the hotel was pretty nice with good service. Tiny workout room and small pool.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: wkiran
Reviews.Content: This being our first trip to Hong Kong, have requested the Hotel staff 3 weeks in advance to provide us all rooms toegther (3 rooms) and early chec-in, we arrived for check-in at 2:00pm only to discover that the rooms are not ready, we were made to wait for more than 3 hours. The quality of service is bad, the rooms are not clean and the staff is staff is not courteous. The A/C is switched off in the night (1:00am to 4:00am) and afternoon (1:00pm tp 4:00pm) leading to lot of discomfort.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: barbiehen
Reviews.Content: This hotel on the surface is a little dated, however, it is clean and the staff are helpful. I would recommend for $300 HK Dollars you can upgrade good value. The pool is on the 19th Floor and it is next to the Gymnasium, staff are very helpful. Great Location next to Ladies Market, and the Hotel Bus will take you anywhere you need to go at no extra charge. I would recommend this hotel to families and singles. Don't take the hard sell for excursions, its cheaper to do these yourself, as you are next to the Metro which is super efficient and really cheap. The hotel bus drops you off next to the Star Ferrys which is great and this only costs $10 HK for four adults, great value.

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: WoonLee
Reviews.Content: The rooms were decently clean and the staff is quite friendly and helpful. Although the location is not directly next to the MTR station, but it is within walking distance to many highly recommended restaurants in Kowloon, the Women Street, and with a whole lot of ammenities around in Kowloon. They also provide airport and MTR shuttle (Mongkok and Tsim Sa Tsui MTR). Recommended for travellers looking for a good bargain 3-star hotel. (My double room was less that $100 per night)

Reviews.Title: “Metro Park Metro Star- Up market”
Reviews.Author: fluffycloud9
Reviews.Content: On our first trip to Hong Kong we stayed here at the Metro Park Kowloon, we only had a few days so spent most of it out of hotel, but the facilities seemed very good, lost available shop/florist/bar/snacks/pool. Buffet was very well presented and had wonderful variety. Rooms well kept, clean and modern. Air conditioning worked well, sometimes a little too well in the public places such as reception/lobbies etc, bit chilly compared to the humdity outside. Interesting Hong Kong traditions such as not using floor 13...i like superstitions!

Reviews.Title: “valued for money”
Reviews.Author: Mild-Jesper
Reviews.Content: It quite far from MTR but hotel has free shuttle bus available to Mong Kok and Tshim Sha Tui also you can take bus number K5 in front of hotel to Kowloon station for Airport Express train to Airport very convenience. Nearby hotel on left side has a local restaurant with good tasty. Free WiFi available in lobby area I stayed during 8 - 10 Sept.11 with my family

Reviews.Title: “Location and access links adequate, with rooms at good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Cantabflyer
Reviews.Content: I would have to say that I might not choose this hotel if it were my very first visit to Hong Kong, as the rather drab area and transport access issues already mentioned by others make it better for those already used to getting around, eating locally, and hunting out MTR stations. However, I ended up booking this hotel for cost reasons as I needed downtown access but did not want to pay the very high rates that can happen in central hotels when the convention centres are full and active with Expos and conferences. I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised by this one - I had stayed in a Metropark in Wan Chai last year and vowed never to return, but this one in Mong Kok seems well above the average for its price point, offering relatively spacious rooms, free wired internet access, and generally a good location albeit requiring a bit of a walk to the nearest MTR station. Loved the pool as well. Quality of the soaps and shower gels was not that great - think low budget gymn - and my wife in particular commented that the shampoo was very poor and oily - so best to bring your own or buy something better at the local store.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good For Business”
Reviews.Author: Emma13a
Reviews.Content: There are better hotels in Kowloon than this for business. Not a place where you would want to host business appointments and make an impression. The SipSip bar is seedy and pretty univiting. There were people sleeping with backpacks in the entry foyer. Not the right kind of place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: PoojaMukul
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Metropark for three nights.It's connectivity to the Airport & rest of kowloon is incredible.The shuttle to Tsim Sha Tsui makes commuting simple & for free.The rooms are very comfortable & with free Wi-Fi.There is no language barrier,the staff can all communicate in English. The location was central.We shall stay there again when we visit Hongkong.

Reviews.Title: “Good but could be better”
Reviews.Author: fredskitchen
Reviews.Content: The pros : free shuttle serice to Tim Sha Tsui, free shuttle service to the airport, not as expensive as other hotels of the same standing, the rooftop pool is awesome and is worth an extra star! The cheap restaurant on the left as you exist the hotel. The cons : no wi-fi in the rooms, The wi-fi is in the lobby where there are only 2 computers... At a cost! The rooms are small. You're a good 20 mins walk from allthe Mong Kok.

Reviews.Title: “For budget conscious college kids, this hotel was the place to be”
Reviews.Author: CNYC
Reviews.Content: Three of us decided to embark on a weekend excursion to Hong Kong and Macau and decided to book three nights at Metropark Hotel Kowloon. Kowloon is definitely the place to stay if you're looking to save money. Metropark had all the basic necessities for the duration of our stay. The location was prime due to its close proximity to the Ladies' Market (tip to travelers: Be ready to haggle at least HALF of the price they offer you) and the MTR-Mong Kok station. It shouldn't be more than a 10 minute walk to the train station from the hotel. As for the furniture, there was nothing special. We had double beds and a bathroom with the usual small complimentary necessities. The room was clean so nothing to complain. There is free wifi in the lobby and a complimentary newspaper every morning to your room. Be sure to catch the daily hourly shuttles from the hotel to the train station and the ferry station that takes you to Hong Kong. MAKE SURE TO CATCH THE 8PM LIGHT SHOW AT THE HARBOR. STAY ON THE KOWLOON SIDE. The skyline at night beats New York City's at night. Another plus is going to Victoria's Peak shortly after the light show. That is a view I'll never forget in my life. If I ever come back to Hong Kong, I will probably stay here or the YMCA at the harbor.

Reviews.Title: “4 star hotel with the service of a 5 star one”
Reviews.Author: Shano18
Reviews.Content: During my last trip to Hong Kong I stayed at Metropark hotel in Kowloon. It may be a 4 star hotel but had the service of a 5 star one. The rooms were clean and quite spacious as well as comfortable. The service was great. The housekeeping staff was very kind and would appear with a smile every time they were called for. The breakfast was exceptional with a huge variety of dishes, and excellent service. The hotel also had a free shuttle bus that would drop us to a number of locations including the ladies market, goldfish market and avenue of stars. The location is also worth mentioning with the Grand Century Place and Langham Place at walking distance from the hotel. I would definitely suggest Metropark hotel for its affordable rates, great service and location.

Reviews.Title: “A VERY GOOD HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: 186390Graham
Reviews.Content: IT was a STOP OVER HOTEL as RECOMMENDED BY TRAVELBAG on ROUTE TO SYDNEY FROM HEATHROW, We stayed there for three nights we were very happy with the choice,there was a hotel bus that run you to the harbour where you can get The ferry to HONG KONG ISLAND, with stops on the way (free) THIS METROPARK HOTEL is in the heart of KOWLOON were you really get the feel of OLD HONG KONG

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: DipaP
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with complimentary shuttle bus into the main part of Kowloon as the hotel is a bit far out - shuttle goes every 30 minutes. Good selection for breakfast, room is spacious with great facilities (inc. hairdryer). Staff are very helpful and there is free wi-fi available in the hotel lobby.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing unforgettable trip”
Reviews.Author: pat t
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the metro park for 5 nights lovely hotel only complaint when we arrived at about 9.30 am been travelling over 24 hours I personally had not slept for 2 night so was very tired badly needing a shower and had to wait 2 hours before we could get in to our room my husband a pensioner me not far behind were left in the foyer to wait not a very good start, but that was the bad bit the rest was brilliant lovely hotel very clean and cool as hong kong very humid but all building have air conditioning and believe me you need it. The hotel has a great free shuttle service which has to stops one central to kowloon and the other to the ferry to go over to hong kong which is very cheap we went over every day. The rooms were very clean and breakfast was good plenty of choice, most of the staff were very helpful just the odd grump here and there, would definatley go back it was the most amazing visit ever. While in hong kong you must go to victoria peak , ocean park to see the panda's and aquarium, ride the trams and visit all the markets including ladies market and stanley market . Avoid the trip to turtle island very up setting how the man handle the poor turtles just so holiday makers can get photo with them really upset me and my family

Reviews.Title: “good central location friendly hotel would go back”
Reviews.Author: morag j
Reviews.Content: friendly helpful staff, good central location shuttle bus a bonus in an area you fell safe when out walking. If going to stay at this hotel try out theresas kitchen just a few shops down for a meal great place great value . Bar staff great happy hour buy one get one free 4-9 everyday if not used your free drink but had enough for the night staff take room number and you can have it next night. breakfast room ,good choice of food very hard working staff

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: agataa
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. Really good hotel, great location, free shuttle bus to few locations. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “good, safe base for exploring Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Theresafromnorway
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights in Dec.2009 on the first stop on a tour of China. Had a Club/Executive room on 18th floor, having asked for an upgrade on arrival. The free breakfast included in the upgrade paid for itself, plus the service in the executive lounge was really good. Waiters took my order and came over regularly to check if everything was OK. Room was nothing special, but perfectly adequate, loiked out over some hilly part of the city so was relatively quiet. Ladies Market a short walk away, and the free shuttle bus to the shopping precinct meant that you could easily get from there to the Harbour District to take the must-do ferry trip across to the other side. Highly recommend a trip to Dante's Peak, where you get stunning views of Hong Kong. Take the funicular up, it's a highlight all by itself! There's a great restaurant up there, food is great and service outstanding. Would recommend the Metro Park Kowloon to any tourist as it is well located for exploring Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, good position near Mong Kok”
Reviews.Author: WizardMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Spent five days at the Metropark, Kowloon first week August and was pleasantly surprised, with just a few small annoyances. The Hotel position for ourselves was fine, we wanted to be near the shops, bathroom and electrical shops of Mong Kok and this suited us just fine. The hotel runs a 30 minute shuttle service to the shop area, but walking took just 10 minutes. Check in and out pleasant, accepable and problem free. The 18th floor room was on the small side, clean and comfortable with all expected facilities and a reasonable view of the Hong Kong sky line. The hotel is a little dated and I could find fault with decor, carpets etc, but none of this took away from the efficiency of the hotel. Breakfast is expensive, but we were given a voucher on check in which reduced the cost down for the first morning by a third, however on presenting the voucher we were told to come down each day, advise our room number and we would receive the discount each day. Quite confusing and if we did not use the voucher the first day we would not have know we could get a good discount each day. Make sure you get a breakfast voucher on check in. The breakfast selection is wide, with fresh egg cooking station and all expected breakfast choices. On two occassions, once at check in and once whilst lining up to enter the restaurant rude locals (?) pushed in ahead of us leaving us fuming in the line. Hotel staff, who could not have failed to see what had happened, should have had the courage to ignore these people and taken the next in line (us), but neither did and looked after the locals first instead of ourselves. (no further comment necessary) If you want to use a hotel computer there is a charge of 10HK dollars for 15 minutes. Very little cost but in the scheme of things penny pinching. These days most hotels have free computer use for their guests. The pool and gym area is not open until 7.30am each morning. This may well be fine for holiday makers, but for some who have business activities to take care of, this is far too late. I spent my exercise time running around the streets. The pool and gym area looked fine and inviting. Perhaps the most annoying of all was the ground floor porters, on check in our 2 cases were removed from the taxi promptly and taken to our room. On departure we manhandled five cases ( yes a very productive buying expedition) to the ground floor and were left to fend for ourselves in loading the taxi whilst the porters looked on. As an aside this reviewer finds the Mong Kok area the best in Hong Kong for a wide range of good especially if your looking for bathroom and electrical goods. So bottom line, good quality hotel, good positon for Mong Kok, but out of the way for other areas, 10 minutes walk to Mong Kok underground station and shopping, 5 minutes to main line station to China (Mong Kok East, direct line to Wo Lu and shopping at Chen Zen). All in all highly reccomended for the cost and would stay again if my business was to be around the Mong Kok area. If travelling by taxi beware, there is a Metropark Mong Kok, this review is for the Metropark Kowloon, get them mixed up and you will be dropped at the wrong hotel, our taxi driver took us to the Mong Kok hotel first.

Reviews.Title: “Really Good Service”
Reviews.Author: SheltieJim
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 days in July and we could not find fault with anything, The staff go out of their way to help you and are very pleasant. The Hotel has a Rooftop Pool which is perfect for "Cooling Off " on hot days and the restaurants are of a very high quality along with their own Cakeshop.We also received a couple of complimentary Breakfasts from the Hotel Management and do we mean breakfast, There was everything a person could think off laid on, Hot and cold food, fruit, Juices etc. Their Sip Sip Bar is well decorated and we had half price drinks for 4 x Hours most nights. This Hotel lays on free Buses into the shopping areas every half hour which is a bonus while searching through the many markets Hong Kong has. I will try and use a Metropark Hotel in which ever country we visit as they give a very good service

Reviews.Title: “hotel required major renovation!”
Reviews.Author: babylemon_1986
Reviews.Content: It wasnt the first time that i came hong kong and certainly we were expecting and looking forward to stay in a good hotel like Metropark kowloon. However the day when we arrived, the service was really slow! There's more than 7 staff in the reception but it required more than 30 mins just to check in. It was the first time i came across a hotel that required more than 30 mins just to fill in the registration form + looking for hotel rooms. Service is definitely very important for a hotel brand + image. With such service, i will never want to book with Metropark Kowloon again. Additionally, when i asked for upgrading to renovated room. We have to even pay a hefty fee of HKD 170/night. Isnt it what the hotel supposed to be providing for guest in the first place? We want new rooms & not rooms that are POORLY maintained + OLD FURNISHINGs. We wouldnt mind paying the price but the service was really bad, rooms are poorly maintaned, especially the toilets. THE TOILETS TOTALLY REMIND ME OF THE OLD PUBLIC HOUSING OR HDB. totally disastrious. Mind you, this is our first night and i've already had lots of terrible experiences with the hotel. I really dunno how to continue staying my 2nd and 3rd night.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain .”
Reviews.Author: Travelaholic_10
Reviews.Content: Location was great ,lots of good eating places nearby. Especially, Fung Lao which serves really good and cheap dim sum. Easy to get taxi and they provide shuttle bus. Room was clean. Dont expect anything amazing, everything was just average. I got really nothing to complain with that kind of hotel rate. Check in and check out were fast and easy. I would probably come back if i want to save money on hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: annafrancophile
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms. My mom and I stayed in one while my brother and his wife and their 2 little daughters stayed in another. They gave us connecting rooms. The hotel is relatively old. But it is still very presentable and clean. The rooms were warm enough for Hong Kong's winter temperature, but there were days when it gets a little cold in the early morning. Or maybe that was just me 'cause I get easily cold. We stayed for 5 days and everyday they would give us little candies together with a weather update for the following day. Staff were helpful and there were enough staff who could speak English. It was very convenient for us to stay there. It was a 10 minute walking distance to Mongkok, but they also had a shuttle bus that was available the whole day to take you to Mongkok and Tsim Sha Tsui. It was also very easy to get there from HK International Airport. We took the fast train to Kowloon. And from there we took the airport shuttle bus, which stopped directly at the hotel. We did the same thing going back. The neighborhood was quiet. There were lots of small restaurants, bakery, convenience stores (7-11 and more), mini groceries less than 5 minutes walk from the hotel. We really felt at home in the hotel and were very satisfied with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “THIRD TIME AND STILL GOOD”
Reviews.Author: donsilby
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October 2010 for the third time and it was just as good. On all occasions the rooms were very clean and comfortable. There was an LCD television in the room but to be honest we never used it. Biggest plus was the broadband internet in the room at no extra cost. Although this was via cable the lead was provided. The rooftop swimming pool was nice to use and there were never many people using it when we were there. There is a regular shuttle service down to near the Avenue of the Stars area which also stops at the night market area on the way. Breakfast does contain bacon, eggs and beans along with the usual continental breakfast and chinese breakfast dishes. You have to order fried eggs, at no extra cost, if you require them. There is an MTR station just a ten minute walk away and so this hotel is a good base to explore Hong Kong. Overall we had a very pleasant stay here.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: xixili
Reviews.Content: we spent 2 nights in this hotel recently and absolutely loved it. granted the rooms were small but considering the location and convenience it was easily overlooked. the hotel provides a shuttle every 30 minutes with the first stop being very close to Mongkok MTR and the last stop being Tsim Sha Shui. The hotel has its own bakery downstairs and the buns/pastries were just fab! Opposite the hotel there is a supermarket so thats a plus point as well. Ladies Market is 10 minutes by foot but we took the shuttle there. On the way back we took a cab which cost us HKD$20. All in all we had no complaints and all requests were promptly handled. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel and great value!”
Reviews.Author: marymcd
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after reading reviews for six hours on TripAdvisor, and am very happy with the hotel. They have everything you need - beds that are not too hard (difficult to find soft enough in Asia, so this is double thumbs up!); pastry shop in lobby, good free shuttles to two shopping areas, laundry and grocery store across street, and rooftop pool is nice and clean! The room and bathrooms are very nice, and I would recommend for families and couples as well as solos. Desk personnel very helpful! Free wired internet in room and flat screen TV as well as mini-fridge and plenty of space for luggage, too!

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay and would come back again.”
Reviews.Author: Tisme59
Reviews.Content: This was one of the few hotels I could find in Hong Kong to accommodate a family of 5 without using a rollaway bed. We booked a family twin and a twin on the 5th floor. These were very comfortable and clean, newly refurbished rooms. The staff were polite and friendly and we made good use of the efficient shuttle bus service to Mongkok and TST. Good buffet breakfast with lots of choice although we only had this twice as it was quite expensive at HK$454 for our family (with 2 children only eating toast or pastries). Nice pool and fitness room on the 19th floor. We also used the hotel's shuttle bus service to and from the airport which cost HK$1k for our group. The only thing that would have improved our stay would have been to have connecting rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Hotel-Guru-Kat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights and the first thing we noticed was how friendly the staff were. Whilst we were checking in one of the Guest Relations staff called Mirror welcomed us and asked us what we were planning to do whilst we were in Hong Kong. She also gave us some maps and wrote down information to help us get around. This was a big help and later that night when we got back to our room she had printed out information about all the things we said we wanted to do/see and put this under our door. We were so impressed and it was a brilliant help to us, as we knew how to get places, what price, opening times etc. There are lots to see and do close to the hotel and we were able to walk to the night markets. Taxis are quite cheap too and the hotel shuttle bus was handy. Our room was quite nice, a little dated but comfortable. There is a roof top pool as well, its quite small and basic but you get a view from up there! My boyfriend really enjoyed local food at the restaurant next door, I'm vegetarian so I didnt eat there but he recommends it!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Samuel-Westwood
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for a week and would highly recommend the metropark! brilliant location 5 minute walk to mong kok which is an amazing busy place with the ladies market, true chinese food stalls, restraunts and you can also get the MTR underground here too or there is a shuttle bus all day from the hotel to the MTR! the hotel was great and nothing to complain about but do ask for one of the newly renovated rooms which are perfect! the swimming pool on the roof was such a bonus to relax around after a hard day out in the hustle and bustle! for you guys who are unsure about HK i highly reccomend staying here in kowloon, true chinese culture with hardly any tourists, cheap prices etc because it is where the locals live, and only 5 mins on thr MTR to the centre of hongkong island which in all fairness wasnt a spot on kowloon (mong kok) if you want true Hk stay here if you want more glitzy, expenisve, more tourists then stay over on hongkong island! cant wait to go back, hopefully on our trip to shanghai or malaysia! genuine good quaily 4* hotel, didnt eat in the hotel once unfortunatly as there were SO many restraunts and stalls just outside the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly and helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: ebleta
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in the hotel. Its not far to metro stations-around 10 min to hong kong central, plenty shops around. Swimming pool on the top. Clean and tidy inside.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service that makes me feel like home”
Reviews.Author: MissKong
Reviews.Content: The service in Metropark Hotel Kowloon is top notched. In particular, I wish to compliment Mr Admond Chan of Front Office Department who displayed professionalism in hotel management as well as sincere care and concern to guests like myself. I would also like to thank Mr Banny Ng for his reply to me. Their warm hospitality touched my heart. It was really a wonderful stay at this hotel I called home in hongkong.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place”
Reviews.Author: ansh9899
Reviews.Content: Locating this hotel was not a problem at all, though it is far off from the Hong Kong International airport and also from the Hong Kong Central Ferry Terminal. The hotel is located very close to the MongKok MTR terminal (walking distance 650m) and from the famous ladies market. The hotel though is a bit far from Hong Kong Central and the main shopping district of Hong Kong - Tsim Tsa Tsui. Hotel is good is you are travelling alone or a couple, however if you have young kids who don't need extra bed or even if they need extra bed, the room gets cramped. The hotel did not have King sized bed, so on request, the best they could do was to put both the single beds together. The sleep quality though was ok. The bathroom was very clean and spacious.The hotel had bus facility from the hotel every 30 minutes to take you to Ladies Bazaar or the Mongkok station and upto the Tsim Tsa Tsui. Language is a problem in Hong Kong and we did face some problems in the hotel as well. The concierge service and the travel service provided in the hotel though was top class and courteous. The breakfast buffet was a bit of a problem for us as we are vegetarians as usual.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: sapphire53_9
Reviews.Content: Having read some reviews of this hotel i was a little worried over what size room i would get, however i was pleasantly suprised, ok so it was not a ballroom, but it was not an egg box either. there was room to move around the bed freely, not much hanging space for clothes, and no drawers, but there was a stand to put your suitcase on, so for four days i was there i kept most of my clothes in the case, the room however had tea-coffee facilities, flat screen tv, a small fridge stocked with drinks for you, and a laundry service. we had breakfast in the palm court each day, with pleanty of choice for anyone, and we had one evening meal in the palm which was great, also ate in the bar during happy hour, meals were cheaper in here and good value. hotel runs shuttle bus to mongkok and also very close to star ferry, just over the road from drop of point, this saved us money, didnt have to buy a octopus card. staff at the metropark could not do enough for you to make your stay a happy one, i walked across lobby floor with a postcard in my hand i had just bought, was on my way to reception to see about stamps ect, when a kind man stopped me in my tracks, you have postcard madam you want sending, i replied yes, he said 4dollars and took the card from me, he then explained the hotel send them for the guests and that was part of his job, excellent service i thought.and this was typical of the attention to detail the staff at this hotel take. the swimming pool was on the 19th floor, and it was lovely, also the gym is next door to the pool, loads of shops within walking distance from hotel and loads of eating places too. im only sorry that i wont be staying at this hotel again, because i really liked it, but the journey to hongkong for me was a one off, i dont intend travelling that far again, but if i did, id definatly stay at the metropark kowloon again. the hotel was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: LuluBurke77
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights with two young children it was brilliant, the staff were very accommodating, rooms were spacious, half hour walk to markets.

Reviews.Title: “The staff made our stay most enjoyable.”
Reviews.Author: debbiegordon
Reviews.Content: Nice quiet non smoking room, comfy beds, very good room service, thanks Shirley. Lighting in room could be brighter. Lovely rooftop pool. Loved the free shuttle bus service to and from downtown. Concierges posted our mail. Customer Service Manager organised our VIP tickets to a show in Macau, and the restaurant made me a special small meal when i was not very well. Sip Sip bar staff excellent. Check in and out procedure very quick. Yes if we come to Hong Kong again most certainly we will stay with you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Reasonably Priced”
Reviews.Author: praveents
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 days, well managed hotel, rooms are spacious, has a nice Pool on the roof top. Provides free shuttle service to TST and Mongkok MTR and also for nearby shopping places. Good Value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: gingerfig
Reviews.Content: The Metropark Kowloon is outstanding value for the money. I stayed here while I was on business in Hong Kong. It is a little far from Hong Kong Island (where I had business), but they hotel had a courtesy shuttle bus that took you to Mongkok Station or the TST Terminal. The hotel room was clean, the staff spoke very good English and the service was exceptional. I have recommended the Metropark Hotel Mongkok to other colleagues who are traveling to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “just right as a base”
Reviews.Author: Angellous
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 days, it was clean well laid out and the staff were very helpful. the Free shuttle base to the harbour was very useful and always ontime

Reviews.Title: “The best for moving aroung Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: clif_francis
Reviews.Content: Very affordable and clean hotel with a great location in Hong Kong. The shuttle service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: Snapper1982
Reviews.Content: I got a good price directly through their website as opposed to the usual consolidated search sites. The hotel is a 15-20 min walk away from Mong Kok MTR station and is only 10 min away from the busy shopping areas of Mong Kok (Read 'ladies Market'). With the MTR station being where it is, the rest of the city isn't too disconnected either. The hotel has a nice functional roof top swimming pool and Fitness Centre next to it. Wifi is available only upto the 2nd floor which was a little inconvenient. However there is a LAN cable available in the room so business visitors can get work done. They arrange for a pick up service from the airport for a fee of HKD 98 (As on May 2011). All in all, I'd rate this hotel quite highly and will recommend it to visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Good value near with good transport options”
Reviews.Author: robsonap
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel room on tripadvisor, via one of the outsourced accomodation websites they use called hotels.co.uk, and was pleasantly surprised at the price and quality of the hotel. For AUD120 a night I got a reasonably large for Hong Kong standards and it was clean. I barely stayed inside the room as I was walking a lot around Hong Kong. The nearest MTR station was about 10 or 15 minutes walk. Also the main retail roads in Mong Kok are about 10 or so minutes walk. Once you get onto the MTR most of the tourist attractions are easy to reach. Free broadband internet via Ethernet was a pleasant surprise, which helped plan for the tourist places to visit for the following day. The TV had a few English channels such as CNN, BBC, etc, which was handy and welcome for a brief news catchup every now and then. The staff spoke very good English, were helpful, and allowed use of printing facilities for boarding passes, etc. The hotel offers a bus service to and from the airport for 100 Hong Kong Dollars, and it takes about an hour each way. Definately worth a stay if you can get a good price!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convenient & Affordable.”
Reviews.Author: su_lim08
Reviews.Content: Stayed here again for 4 nights in May and thoroughly enjoyed the stay. We normally use hotel rooms as a base since we are always out exploring the city most of the time. However, cleanliness and accessibility are our top priorities of any hotel we stay at and Metropark Kowloon fits the bill! Getting to the hotel from the airport was fuss-free as we used the airport shuttle to Metropark. Upon arrival, checking-in was smooth. When we first entered our room, it smelt of tobacco (ours was a non-smoking room). However, we decided to let the air-con run for a while, came back a while later and the smell was gone. The nearest MTR is Mong Kok, a 10-15 minutes walk but we took the free shuttle bus to Mong Kok everyday and from Tsim Sha Tsui back to the hotel every evening. The buses were always on time and provided excellent convenience to start off your day and to end it. Had the hotel's buffet breakfast every morning. It was okay, the spread was adequate but by the third morning, we were wishing that we didn't include the breakfast in our stay and instead, had gone out to eat! Suggestion: Eating out would be a better option as there are better food out there. Internet provided in the room was fast and reliable. Complimentary bottled-water was appreciated too. Overall, a pleasant stay once again!

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: Pierre3631
Reviews.Content: Totally unimpressed with this hotel, it's staff and the room that we checked into. On first inmpressions it looks okay- but the staff seem disinterested (which only prepares you for the drab rooms and lousy overpriced cuisine). All I can say is thank goodness I was only here for two nights as part of a stopover returning from Sydney. One more thing: if you want a made-to measure suit whilst in Hong Kong DO NOT go to NEW HONG KONG FASHIONS- they totally ripped us off!

Reviews.Title: “clean, adequate hotel”
Reviews.Author: ohmytians
Reviews.Content: location-wise, it is not fantastic as it is rather far from mongkok MTR station. it is nearer to mongkok east mtr which really doesn't serve much purpose if you want to sightsee or shop. it is about 10 minutes walk to ladies market which wasn't too bad a walk but after a long day of walking with all our shopping load, the walk was quite torturous. the shuttle bus service is great but it doesn't return from mongkok so the only way back from the street markets is walking. the shuttle bus does take you to and fro tsim sha tsui which saved us a train ride and some money. be sure to visit tim ho wan on kwong wa street which is rather near the hotel. awesome and cheap dim sum with one michelin star but be warned of the long queues. there are also a few cafes and restaurants beside the hotel so getting food around the area wasn't a problem. bus services 2 minutes walk from the hotel brings you to jordan, star ferry terminal, china ferry terminal, nathan road so it is quite easy to navigate around the area. the room was not very big but it was clean and an extra pillow was given. mineral water was provided everyday. clean towels were provided everyday though we left them on the rack. there wasn't free wifi but there was free broadband and LAN cable if you brought a laptop.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT CONCIERGE SERVICE AND ALL-ROUND VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: colleenand
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in a number of other Hotels in Hong Kong over the years, and will definitely choose the Metropark in Kowloon again. The tariff was reasonable, the room small but adequate, spotlessly clean, very safe, free wi-fi (the next Hotel we stayed in,in Singpore charged $10 for 15 minutes!), and the concierge staff were particularly helpful. Immaculate small Business Centre venue where we were able to meet our Agents for a private meeting......at no extra charge!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: donna255060
Reviews.Content: hotel was good with excellent service from staff , standard room could do with a upgrade but was comfortable enough for our short stay, restaurant was first class in price and food quality, tourist agent within hotel was excellent and very helpful

Reviews.Title: “Affordable & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ZigaDolhar
Reviews.Content: I was staying in this hotel for 10 nights during the Vis Moot. Since I rarely stay at hotels above 2-3 stars on my travels, this hotel was a very welcome "upgrade" in terms of leisure facilities (swimming pool and Nintendo Wii!), a bit expensive yet affordable all-you-can-eat breakfast with good variety of cold and hot dishes, fruits etc. Room service was excellent and the personnel in general does demand/expect tips (though is glad to recieve them :)) for even the smallest favors. The biggest drawback in my experience was the distance to the subway (appr. 10-15 minutes walk through some heavy-pedestrian blocks), which is somehow offset with great hotel provided shuttle service. Also, airconditioning is kept on at all times and may prove disturbing in first few nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: pelikanm
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Metropark Kowloon Hotel in June 2010.This hotel is great value for money, which you pay for it.The only negative thing is distance from subway station, but there´s a bus stop just front to the hotel. Can not write anything bad about the hotel, the staff is very helpfull and professional, nice swimming pool on the roof. I just do not reccomend to visit Hong Kong in June as it is extremely humid and warm there- in night 29 degrees, during day 31 degrees and clioudy with heavy showers. Otherwise Hong Kong is the BEST city I´ve ever been to!

Reviews.Title: “Quite OK accomodation in Kowloon. Generally happy.”
Reviews.Author: PM1001
Reviews.Content: The MetroPark Kowloon is well located if you intend to spend more time in Mongkok and environs but not quite so if you intend spending more time in Tsim Sha Tsui, with the bottom of Nathan Road about a 30 minute walk from here. . However they do run a regular shuttle bus to and from and that helps temendously. I stayed in a regular room which was quite adequate but I wish I had known about the Club Rooms which are superior having been refurbished and upgraded at some time fairly recently - They are only slightly more expensive. I would be happy to stay here again in terms of service, value and standard, The hotel is friendly and staff helpful. However there was one issue that caused problems for me ------- I cannot prove this for certain but you would be well aware to be careful about it. When in HK I used my credit card once and only once - at this hotel when they wished to swipe it upon my arrival. At all other times I used a different chipped and secure debit card for all transactions. When I arrived back in my own country I found my credit card details had been stolen and I had been the subject of identity theft. As I only used it once while away I have to assume that there is a strong risk that someone on staff stole the details and sold them, although as I said I cannot prove it absolutely it seems the only way it could have occurred. I can't really hold the hotel fully responsible as criminals can be found everywhere (although it may not speak well of its security arrangements for handling guest financial details). You have been warned and should take precautions (whether you stay here or elsewhere I should add).

Reviews.Title: “Markets close”
Reviews.Author: kiwienvy
Reviews.Content: +walkable to all main markets with littlies we still did it. Shuttle to markets very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a good and quiet location”
Reviews.Author: SF49erFan8
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a clubroom floor and was very pleased with the hotel. The room was nice and clean with all the amenities. Bed was very comfortable with a good selection of pillows. The staff on the 17th floor were very helpful and polite. Breakfast was good and preferred the mezzanine buffet versus the club lounge due to more variety. If your schedule is flexible, stay there during the weekdays, since the room rate is cheaper on weekends. Stayed here a week and paid $120 weekdays and $200/night weekends. Free shuttle available, which was very helpful if you prefer to give your feet a little break. However, the subway station was only 10 minutes away and a nice walk.

Reviews.Title: “hassel FREE STAY IN HONG KONG”
Reviews.Author: crestimpex
Reviews.Content: This is a prefect hotel to stay in HONG KONG , With all aminities loaded , which is inclusive of " FREE CONTINENTAL BREAK FAST , FREE LOCAL CALLS, POOL ACCESS , -- -- ETC " Amazing prices for spacious ROOM IN HK ,

Reviews.Title: “Just OKAY- No value for money”
Reviews.Author: Nisha_11
Reviews.Content: We (Me and My husband) has booked the hotel well in advance even then ended up in getting a twin bed instead of double bed, when asked reception for a change obv no rooms were avail. The room did not feel fresh and we were lucky that we were so tired after a long flight that we managed to get some sleep. I have stayed in nicer hotels for the same price maybe HK is just expensive!

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: oz_flashpackers
Reviews.Content: we had a nice room, though small (perhaps same for rest of HK), seemed to be newly refurbished. no real view. the staff were friendly. pool temperature was cool but a nice area. the breakfast was a great start to the day. location was good (near electronic, sports and other shopping). not far from subway and parks too.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Canadian079
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on price primarily and it was a solid choice. We took the airport express to the Kowloon station where we then took the K5 free shuttle to the hotel. This service is very good and efficient. Check in was quick and without problem. That was when we noticed that we had forgotten a bag on the shuttle bus. The staff immediately called the shuttle company for us. A few minutes later we went to the concierge desk who called again and was told that a bag was found. So off we went on the shuttle to claim the bag. We were certainly thankful to the staff for their concern and help. Our room was fine even though it looked to an apartment building. The room was large enough for us and very clean. The bathroom was modern with good amenities. The pool and exercise room are on the top floor. The pool is heated so we enjoyed a swim after our workout. Breakfast was very good although the room was crowded between 9:00 and 9:30. The only drawback to the hotel is its location. It is a long walk to the metro stop (the hotel does provide a free shuttle service). However there are numerous restaurants nearby as well as shops. Getting to the hotel was quick and easy. The price was right and breakfast was good. If we go back to Hong Kong we would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT stay at the Metro Park Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: DegusRastaman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Metro Park for one night only on 6th March and wished I had stayed longer. What a fantastic hotel and GREAT value for your money. The hotel is ideally situated near to the markets where you can get great bargains and what’s most impressive is that the hotel offers a free bus ride every 30 minutes to the harbour. The breakfast was just awesome with so much choice on offer. There is also free internet in the hotel lobby. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and will certainly be staying again when I next visit Hong Kong (God Willing). A GREAT hotel. Fantastic value for your money. Hong Kong Harbour is just breathtaking. What an amazing place. I want to go back already. I Just loved the whole experience with wonderful food.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and good proximity to Ladies Market”
Reviews.Author: SekFoong
Reviews.Content: Can't praise the staff enough.. everyone from the frontdesk, concierge, Guest Relation Officer, housekeeping were very helpful and quick to respond. Room was comfortable but furniture was a little dated however everything you need is available. They even had a selection of pillows for your sleeping pleasure. That was great. Shuttle bus was punctual and useful for access to TST About 10 minutes to Mongkok MTR however it's a very nice walk passing by all the shopping in ladies and sports market and load of eateries/restaurants/cafes

Reviews.Title: “Very legit budget hotel definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTraveller72
Reviews.Content: I used Tripadvisor extensively on my recent trip to Hong Kong so I thought I would add to the discussion... I stayed at the Metropark Hotel in Kowloon from Feb 15-23 and couldn't have been happier. Other reviews have said that the hotel is not in the best location, but I disagree. It is located very close to Mong Kok only 5-10 minutes from ladies market and some very good shopping but it is still far enough away that there is virtually no noise and feels very safe. The other closest hotel I saw, the Stanford, is right in the middle of the madness. I liked that I had everything accessible but was still far enough away to get some peace. There is a hospital and school within a couple of blocks and the area is very safe to walk at night, even 4 am on your way home from LKF, Wan Chai or Karaoke. The walk to the MTR is not too bad once you adapt your walking to Hong Kong pace. I am from North America where we walk slow, but once you get up to speed its only 10 minutes at the most.
