The best entrance/exit to use is A2 at Yau Ma Tei on Pitt Street. Straight down Waterloo road and right after the hospital and its just before Nathan Road. Make sure you get an Octopus card, your crazy if you don't. Also, every station has a "station map" that shows all of the exits and the local area. I got one from every single station that I want to and found everything I needed. You can get them from the service desk where you buy the octopus card. There is a 7-11 on the corner (what corner in HK doesn't have one) where you can buy your beer or pretty much whatever else you need. The hotel prices for alcohol and room service were pretty ridiculous considering you can just walk out the front door and get whatever you need at 7-11. I would also say go for the deluxe room. the western buffet breakfast is pretty good and worth the couple of extra bucks. I ate there almost everyday for my entire stay and the food is pretty good. The beds are a bit stiff for my liking, but I really wasn't expecting perfection for 100 CAD a night. The room was probably a bit small for anymore than 2 people. I was staying solo and was really comfortable. My room was also on the 16th floor which is the club floor and is really nice compared to some of the lower floors. The view was pretty terrible but then again if you want a view go to the peak or lantau. This hotel is a really good budget hotel, worth the extra money instead of staying at one of the mansion hostels. My advice is to take the hotel shuttle from the airport. Its only 100 HKD which is really cheap compared to the 240 HKD cab ride. Some advice on bargaining at ladies and temple street... you can probably get everything for about half of what they want. dont be afraid to walk away if they wont give it to you, they will grab you before you leave the stall and give you the price you want. you know you got a good deal if they are mad about it and wont talk to you. if they settle really quick, change your mind and walk away. everything is sold at more than one place and if they settle so quickly you are getting ripped off. there is also a stall in ladies market where you can get 6 t-shirts for 100 hkd so if you are planning on getting a I <3 HK get it there or you are paying too much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: LorraineCopa
Reviews.Content: The breakfast and shuttle bus made it for us. Shuttles every half hour take you to/from the nearest MTR and the Star Ferry wharf, it was so convenient and free. Shuttle to the airport is worth the $HK100 and the breakfast here was excellent. Supermarket opposite and bakery and cafe nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Needs major updates and itchy night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: MrsMonkWong
Reviews.Content: I would not stay here again. We had 2 rooms, both needed major updating. Everything is from the 80's. The bathroom ceiling were so water damaged it was disgusting. The buildup of caulk were inches thick and yellow. The website does NOT reflect what it is in person. What you see is not what you get. Spend a few more bucks and stay at a clean and comfortable place instead. Trust me, you'll want to relax and unwind after a full day in Hong Kong. Both rooms made us all itched like crazy. I know some rooms like the suites are upgraded so If you are planning on staying in a standard room, this place is definitely not for you. The hotel is also a 15 minutes walk to the nearest subway/mta station. They do provide free shuttles but many times it's full in the morning and returning is a nightmare since you have to time yourself to reach the boarding area at the right time. A minute off and the driver would leave. The shuttle stops service at 10:30pm so you'll have to hail a cab in which case many cab drivers will refuse to drive you because driving is actually just a few minutes away and not worth their trouble. The only good thing about this place is our housekeeper who was super friendly and made me smile every morning and the free internet access in the rooms (not wifi).

Reviews.Title: “Value for $$!”
Reviews.Author: QiaQia
Reviews.Content: Strategically located within many eateries in the vicinity. Getting around is not a problem at all as the hotel provides free shuttle bus services which run on every 30 minutes interval. The shuttle bus is very punctual and it will drop you either at Mongkok (near Ladies Street) and Tsim Sha Tsui (nearby Peninsula Hotel and MTR Station). Rooms are clean and come with complimentary bottled mineral water. Free Wifi is available from ground floor to 2nd floor. However, luckily enough, I can still detect Wifi eventhough I was staying at the 8th floor (= Will definitely stay again when I visit Hong Kong in the near future! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: LeBai
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms on line directly in September 2010 for our stay in Jan 2011 for 7 nights. There were some misunderstanding at the beginning in regards of whether the cost to be paid. Discounts were applicable as we booked in advance, but could not obtain the special package for staying for 7 consecutive nights as we stay at high season. Thus Complimentary airport shuttle was given to us both ways by Ms I. Wong, the business manager. We are greatly grateful gor this. Our stay in HK was so enjoyable. The rooms and services from staff were excellent. The complimentary bus shuttle to Mongkok station & Tsim Sha Tsui every half hour is great. Haven't been back to HK for more than 10 years, Metropark Kowloon had definitely made our stays so pleasantly enjoyable. Will be back to HK & stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You'll have no regrets for staying there”
Reviews.Author: MeyYouMinzi
Reviews.Content: Location - lots of night markets are in 5-10 min walk, superb shuttle service, but slightly far from busy city center. Staff - incredibly helpful, smiling and professional. Free wi-fi in the lounge area, wonderful backery on the ground flour, clean rooms, etc. The only thing - we didn't find out how to warm our room a little (+19 C didn't feel totally comfort), but that wasn't serious trouble. Anyway, the hotel worth its money!:)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service!!”
Reviews.Author: ssparkles
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week over NYE 2011. The staff here were incredibly helpful. The general manager saw us struggling with our bags on busy NYE and helped us carry them all the way down stairs and went out and called us a taxi hiimself. The rooms were very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel , awesome service , superb shuttle bus service”
Reviews.Author: Gauravcail
Reviews.Content: First of all I would like to thank this hotel for the service they provided .The Metropark Hotel Kowloon is located near the famous Ladies market of Mongkok which is about 10 minuts walk from the hotel and if you ask me even though this hotel is located at a distance from the hustle and bustle of Hongkong the shuttle bus service that they offer doesn't make you feel so ..... They have a bus leaving every hour which will take you to all the main market areas like Mongkok (proper) , Tsim Tsa Tsui etc .... The rooms were better than I expected them to be ..... they were very clean and were well stocked with fruits, complimentary water etc. Toothbrushes , toothpaste shampoo etc were kept in the bathroom ....... The staff was very helpful .... The person sitting at the concierge desk came out with me to explain to the taxi driver that we wanted to go to the Macau Ferry pier and also told us what the fare till there should ideally be .... My whole Family loved the stay in this hotel ..... at the price they charge it's just awesome ...... I would like to say a big thank you to the hotel for all the help they provided and will definately stay here the next time I come here .

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel but a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: matilda48
Reviews.Content: Hotel is not near the water but has an excellent free mini bus that takes you to the Peninsula Hotel which is convenient for the shops and ferries. Take care as there are 3 Metroparks in HK, make sure you go to the right one Pool was closed during Jan and Feb. Breakfasts were good with excellent service. Located within walking distance of the Ladies market and some good local restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Tom M
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in a Club room on the 17th floor. The room was a little small by American standards but fine for the two of us. Breakfast was included with the room either in the Club lounge or the dinning room down stairs. We ate in the dinning room every morning and it was great. Everything from eggs cooked to order to pork dumplings. Service was excellent from check- in to check- out. We used the shuttle several times and it was a great benefit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: monjunee
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Metropark Hotel Kowloon this Janauary. The Room is great, lots of facility in each room. I book in standard twin room, and the room is so good. The bathroom was clean. Overall this hotel is good enough for me. The Location is quite near to the market. Near this hotel there is ladies market. You can take a walk to reach there. The location is also near the MTR station which is make easier to you to go anywhere in HongKong. About the staff, they were very nice to us. Most of them speak English so no need to worry to ask them. They were very friendly and kind. and by the way, they provide free hotspot in the lobby. :)

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money excellent service”
Reviews.Author: LancashireLass10_10
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel we hadn't even made it through door when the staff came to help with our bags. This excellent service from all the staff we encountered continued for the duration of our stay. The room was fine would have perferred it to be slightly bigger. The blackout curtains were excellent and the wired internet connection was good. The location of the hotel isn't the best but the free shuttle bus more than made up for this. The breakfast was good. The bar was good value at happy hour a little pricey after. The bakery was really nice. Overall excellent service and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good and clean accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Fiona K
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. To get to the hotel, you have to walk for a distance of 15 minutes from the MTR station. You can get a cab if you don't mind paying the expensive rate. After getting to the hotel....everything was easy as you don't have to carry big luggages with you. The hotel room was clean and comfortable, even though a bit small. I guess it was Ok that size in Hong Kong. At least I still got free space to put my luggage and walk around! :) There were a lot of shops nearby the hotel and all the way to the MTR station...you can also walk to Mong Kok which is about 15 mins from the hotel only. Good hotel with reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in nice area”
Reviews.Author: Dekpau
Reviews.Content: The reason we booked this hotel was because of the price and its location. Metropark is a good hotel with all the facilities and service is good. If you want to use the metro several times a day, than the walking distance to the Mong Kok station is a bit far. But since you'll be walking through a busy and nice area (Ladies market and the two other shopping streets) you forget easily about the distance. However if you want to go to HK island, you can better take the hotel shuttle. Around the hotel there a several small supermarkets and bakeries. Also you can do your laundry for 30 HKD for 3kg laundry (much cheaper than hotel!). The room is comfortable and has everything you need. We can recommend the buffet in the western restaurant in the hotel. Ofcourse there are enough small ans cheaper restaurants (also Vietnamese and Thai) in the street where the Ladies market is. The pool is on the roof and great on sunny days. The pool will however be closed in January/February. But the gym is still open, where you can also use a Wii.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Bill1109
Reviews.Content: Only in Hong Kong for a couple of nights. But nice hotel, situated near the markets, hotel has a bus to get around with. Nice couple of resturants in the hotel, and a nice outdoor pool on the roof top. lovely little bar in the ground floor/ street enterance. Able to see the Premiership football whilst enjoying a nice long happy hour!....

Reviews.Title: “Decent quality hotel for a short stopover in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Gra50
Reviews.Content: Apart from a delay in making a non-smoking room available on arrival, the hotel was a good base for a short stop-over visiting Hong Kong. A little far from the main areas of Kowloon and a ferry ride from Hong Kong Island itself. Generally excellent service, but let down by the check-in experience. Room was functional, clean and comfortable, but lacked space for stays longer than a couple of nights. Gym and pool on the roof were useful after long flights and reasonably well equipped, though small.

Reviews.Title: “Great Combination of Location, Service and Price”
Reviews.Author: San_Fior
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Metropark from December 17th to 20th. It is a perfect hotel if you are looking for location, good service and price. The hotel is steps away from lots of stores. The room: General view: It's comfortable and spacious Bed: King size bed, very good night sleep Bathroom: Good shower View from the window: dull Strengths: Free Wi-FI, great breakfast due to lots of food options. We strongly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, & Non-professional staff”
Reviews.Author: MrsYeung
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd time stayed in Metropark Kowloon. The reason why I chose this hotel again was because their competitive price of long stay package & services. I was very disappointed after the three weeks stayed. Every morning at 6:00am I heard the ppl talked loudly in the corridor, and opened their doors smoking (even though I lived in the non-smoking floor). It's no use whatever how many times I have complained to receiption counter. The worst was their bellboy damaged my luggage, and no one said sorry or compensate to me. I have no time to negotiate with the bellboy cause I needed to catch the shuttle bus to airport. Frankly speaking, I won't consider to stay in this hotel again, NEVER ~~ Please make clear your mind before make booking with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel -Great location”
Reviews.Author: sasquatch27
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel at a reasonable price. The location is excellent, close to Mongkok and the night markets. Good area for shopping and eating. The airport bus booked through the hotel was a cheap and effective solution to get to the airport. Two metro stations were a short walk away and the bus to/from the Star ferry stopped outside the door. There was a free shuttle as well but we didn't need to take it. Buffet Breakfast was included and offered lots of choice. The inter worked flawlessly. The room while a bit on the small side was adequate and offered room for storage. All in all a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Good”
Reviews.Author: chookyan
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 8th - 13th Dec and like all the other reviews, the hotel is pretty good, good staff and excellent shuttle service down town. The only reason as to why I rated the sleep quality as 2 is because the blankets are far too thin especially for the winter month of Dec.

Reviews.Title: “hectic but homely.”
Reviews.Author: HarryYork
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 weeks.most people only stay for a few days as a stopover which is fine as there is very little wardrobe space and only two small drawers,We were on floor 16 which gave us club lounge facility ie,drinks and snacks from 5.30 till 7.30 also breakfast option,but mostly chinese ,so better to take breakfast in normal restuarante,everything you need here.,although air conditioning quite fierce,so take a jacket.bedrooms are fine on 16th floor with a small bath,but recommend a room not overlooking the main road,as the windows are not double glazed,and the noise is dreadful all night long,not good if you are a light sleeper like me.room attendant bonnie is great and does a good job,even put us a memory foam matress on our beds,they are quite hard.bus stops right outside the hotel to star ferry,and mtr underground about ten minutes walk away.There is a bar on the ground floor of the hotel with happy hour from about 4 till 9 but pricey,it is the only one in the hotel and no other entertainment available,so if you have children they could be stuck for things to do.The night markets are about a ten minute walk away,but not easy to find if you venture out at night ,better to look in the daytime first to get your bearings.I would recommend this hotel to single women ,as it is a very friendly and secure place and all the staff do everything they can to help.P.s there is a good laundry just across the road,the lady speaks good english and will wash press and put all your clothes on hangers for you,quite resonable,near by is also a suoermarket selling almost everything,and a mannings chemist just a few yards along.hope this is helpful,and apart from not much sleep we had a great time in the metropark.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: akku2010
Reviews.Content: stay at hotel was excellent,front desk is very supportive .girl at reception did'nt understand english .we want to extend our stay but again the language problem,so we have to checkout .shuttle bus is very useful for 1st timers,good staff,cakeshop provide yummy delicacies definately will come again.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Visit”
Reviews.Author: Larry1082
Reviews.Content: Although this was my eighth visit to Hong Kong / Kowloon, this was my first visit to the Metropark Hotel Kowloon. It will certainly not be my last. I booked directly through the hotel website, and arrived at the hotel via the Airport Express train and K5 shuttle bus from the Kowloon Airport Express terminal. Check-in was quick and professional, and I was given a room on the 19th floor. The room appeared to have been recently remodeled. The furnishings were tasteful and the room was immaculate, and was maintained in that condition by the housekeeping staff for the duration of my visit. I also experienced no problems with noise from the adjacent rooms, hallway, or outside the hotel overnight. In fact, the streets around the hotel are mostly vacant between 1:00 AM and 6:00 AM. Although removed from the primary hotel areas in Kowloon, the hotel offers efficient and frequent shuttle bus service to an area proximate to the Star Ferry, Hong Kong Cultural Center, and major shopping venues. The shuttle operates on a first-come, first-served basis, so plan on being at the embarkation point 10-15 minutes before departure. I did visit the on-premises Chinese restaurant and sports bar during my visit, and I recommend both. I did not try any of the neighborhood restaurants near the hotel, but did purchase an excellent sushi platter at a very reasonable price from the market directly across from the hotel. The in-room refrigerator was definitely a plus, as were the rooftop pool and exercise room. The free internet access is definitely a plus for any traveler. I think I have found a new home on future visits to Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “My second home in Asia!”
Reviews.Author: RiteshLakhotia
Reviews.Content: In total, I have stayed at this hotel for about 10++ times. The hotel is best by all means in Hong Kong. Since my frequent stay at the hotels, they have offered my a corporate membership. This membership gives me a free 2 way airport transfer, buffet breakfast, room upgrade. The hotel has nice and cozy rooms. the comfort and comfortplus rooms are recently renovated and more trendy than the superior. I just stayed on the club catergory room once, the hotel offered my an happy hour free usage of the club floor bar. The hotel has a free shuttle which runs every 30 mins to Mongkok, and Tsim Sha Tsui shopping area, which is a great help and money saver. The staff are quiet quick in both checkin and checkout ... breakfast is great, has lots instore for a veggie like me. Overall, for the money u spend ... u get twice the value for it .... i will highly recommend this property to economy business travellers!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Rubnel
Reviews.Content: Right from the check-in to check-out, the staff and their service was prompt and excellent. The staff's compliance to our special requests within the reasonable limits is very highly commendable. The rooms were adequate except in the lighting level which we have found even in highly priced hotels - our personal preference is well/brightly lit room. The amenities in the bathroom/toilet was sufficient. The buffet breakfast included in the package was a nice spread and more than adequate to start the day off. Hats off to their free shuttle service to the main points from where we could get the MTR to any place we needed to go. Overall the best hotel at the best price for the one who needs to shower and hit the bed after a full day of sightseeing/shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Busy but very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scorpionsholidays
Reviews.Content: Stop-over on our way to Sydney. Kowloon is about 45 mins from airport over those beautiful bridges. Kowloon is very busy but ideal for shopping and restaurants. This hotel is very smart and our room was excellent. Although very busy all the staff were very friendly and helpful. (Something we found with everyone in Hong Kong). If ever in HK again will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, good location, good restaurant, superb value”
Reviews.Author: WryFromMumbai
Reviews.Content: We switched to this hotel after a bad experience with the Dorsett Seaview in Yau Ma Tei. Helpful staff at the reception offered a low cost upgrade from a standard room to a deluxe at just 110HKD. From the earlier poky room at Dorsett, this was so much better. Clean, spacious 240 odd sq ft, well done rooms and spotless loo, all for 800 HKD a night thru Hotels.com. We booked the earlier one thru Hotels.com but when we complained about the rooms, they promptly helped us find and book Metropark. Well-located, close to Mong Kok within walking distance of Pizza Hut and McDonalds (handy when you have kids with you). Also just around the corner from loads of street shopping. The morning breakfast at the hotel is complimentary and has a pretty good spread and the restaurant is good too. They have a pool too though we didnt stay long enough to use it. I would strongly recommend the Metropark if you looking to stay in Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient hotel to explore Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Doncarlos30
Reviews.Content: We stayed with my wife three nights in the hotel in a classic room. Booked through the hotels web-site which allowed to book the airport transfer to the hotel directly. Negative: The first surprise was that they gave us a twin room instead of a double room. But we were so tired after travelling more than 20 hours that we had accepted it. The next thing was the noise problem. The walls are thin, and you can here almost everything what are your neighbours doing. The hotel bus transfer was very slow, the bus driver stopped in almost every hotel in the area. The had to wait a lot to get in/out from/to airport. The breakfast is very expensive and it is not included in the room price. So have to book it as an extra with the room. Positive: There are some restaurants in the area where you can eat breakast and dinner for a decent . The hotel is located in a convenient area in Knowloon. It is very good option if you want to explore Hong Kong. The metropolitan railway is near the hotel so you can reach almost everything from there. I would recommend to use it also to get to the airport too, as the hotel transfer is slow. Also there is a tourist office where you can book sightseeing tours. If you are in Hong Kong I would recommend to use the public transport to go everywhere as you can reach everything with it. Big advantages: The free high-speed internet in the room is a great extra! The Hotel has a free transfer bus which takes you to the Causeway where you can catch the Star Ferry and other public transport. And you are there at evening to not miss the Symphony of lights! Overall the hotel was not so bad, the member of the hotels staff were very polite and we were treated as a real guest. Congratulations for the hotels staff again and thank you very much!

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend to any tourist”
Reviews.Author: 12ReasonsWhy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Metropark in October 2009 for two weeks whilst holidaying in HK. It is a little further out from the central tourist hubs around the harbour, but I wouldn't call it a trek (unless you're really lazy) - it's only a ten minute stroll to the Tsim Sha Shui MTR station, there are buses which run regularly outside the hotel to the harbour, and the hotel has a free shuttle service - or, like us, you could walk the forty minutes it takes to get to the harbour and enjoy the sights en-route! The room was a decent size for a HK hotel, with a comfortable bed and seating area. It had satellite tv, air-con, and a fridge, which proved really useful as it saved us a fortune on breakfast. (We never ate at the hotel, but there is a cake shop on the ground floor and a great cheap bakers around the corner.) It was impeccably clean throughout our stay. We used the pool several times, which was a lovely treat, and we used the internet provided in a small room next to the lobby. The staff were polite and helpful, although sometimes there were queues at reception and a bit of a wait to speak to someone. I've stayed in Hong Kong several times before and this is the best hotel I've visited. I would recommend it to any tourist - and it's worth contacting the hotel directly to see if you can haggle on the price or room.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was great with a family feel.”
Reviews.Author: goberlou
Reviews.Content: First stay here, have stayed in many Hong Kong Hotels. Stayed 4 nights end of October. Checkin was easy and quick-bed was soft and comfortable. Rooms very quiet. Nice size for Hong Kong. Room had good english TV channels, Fridge and teamaker. Across from a Grocery store. The Hotel shuttle takes you to Ladies market area and Tsimshatsui for shopping. Goes every 30 minutes . Hotel has reasonable Hotel Shuttle at 98Hkd to airport especially if you have an early flight.

Reviews.Title: “Low price - but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: sashasawchai2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is has a somewhat worn feel, below average location, and poor service. On the other hand, for Hong Kong, it's very well priced. You could do worse, but I'd suggest trying somewhere else and/or paying a little more. Location: The hotel is about a 12 minute walk to East Mongkok station (not particularly useful) or a 15-20 minute walk to Mongkok station and Nathan Road. Even short distances take longer on foot in Hong Kong because of all the crowds and traffic! During the cool season the distance is just far enough to noticeably chew time out of your busy stop-over. During the hot season it would be really quite annoying. There is however a free shuttle bus to Mongkok and Tsim Sha Tsui every half hour, which was good. Service: The service is a serious letdown. There was a long queue at check-in, they had my reservation but none of the details (booked through Ctrip which has always been very reliable). We were offered a smoking room or a room with single beds. Not what we booked. When I got on my high horse, a non-smoking double room was miraculously produced. Worse was to come on checkout. We were cutting it fine for the airport in Shenzhen so I asked the concierge for the fastest way to the airport. He advised us to take a bus from a shopping mall 10 minutes away by cab. When we got there, we found that the bus would have taken twice as long as he said it would and was fully booked. Having wasted 20 minutes on this exercise in futility we ended up catching a cab at considerable expense and much greater stress than necessary. Environment: The rooms etc are quite reasonable and would count a rundown three star or good 2 star in most parts of the west. The beds were somewhat hard (as is asian habit/preference) but bearably so. The rooms are clean and reasonably well presented. The place was fairly quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice service”
Reviews.Author: alc24
Reviews.Content: Stayed there back in 2007 for a 3 week trip. Good location, price and service. Room not bad in size for HK standards for 3 ppl ( 2 singles and rollaway) Recommend the restaurants downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but to far from the action.”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanBob
Reviews.Content: Had a really comfortable stay at the Metropark. Room's were clean and comfortable, staff were helpful and the hotel was very welcoming. I wouldn't stay here again due to the location of the hotel, it was a good 45 minute walk to the ferry terminal. The hotel did provide a shuttle bus but due to the Hong Kong traffic it did take a while to get any distance on it.

Reviews.Title: “personal and friendly”
Reviews.Author: bowlsclub
Reviews.Content: Ideal location for bars, restaunrants, markets and Metro. Extremely friendly and helpful staff - nothing was too much trouble. Although in a fairly bustling area, our room was quite, clean and very comfortable

Reviews.Title: “A good base from which to explore Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: r40ngm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Metropark, Kowloon for 4 nights at the beginning of October. Although our room was on the small side, it was smartly decorated with an incredibly comfortable bed and perfectly adequate fixtures and fittings. The buffet breakfast was everything you could hope for- Vast selection, readily topped up and hot! We found the complimentary shuttle bus service to be very useful and overuled the fact that the hotel is not in the most central location. Overall this hotel suited our needs and provided a clean, comfortable base from which to explore Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is great staff are friendly and is in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Burleigh01
Reviews.Content: I satyed at the Metropark Kowloon in late September until early October. Upon arrival at the Hotel we were greated by staff with a smile who were very helpful. We stayed on the 6th floor in a tripple room which had plenty of room for us and our 11 year old daughter. The kids used the pool every day which is monitored by staff. the location of the hotel is great 10 minute walk to Ladies markets and Nathan Rd. the fitness centre is great and has a wii. Our package included breakfast everyday which was fantastic.and It has a great selection to choose from. The Courtsey bus to the markets and harbour is a bonus as we went on a night cruies on the harbour we met the shuttle when we finished which took us straight back to the hotel. The shuttle bus is first come firsted searved so I advised being down stairs about 15 minutes before the bus departs. I would recomend this hotel to anyone going to Hong Kong weather it is for business or leisure

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: travellingdoctor48
Reviews.Content: this is great place to stay, tho far from the center of town, has a shuttle to take you there. left my shoes and got it back with no hassles.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: Linden06
Reviews.Content: Thank you Metropark! We stayed here at the end of a six week journey to Scotland, England and Paris and out-shines most of our other accommodation. Staff very helpful, room comfortable and clean. My husband arrived with a stomach bug after eating a dodgy meal in London and the staff were very helpful in arranging him to visit the Doctor. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: gsfarmer
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Metro Park due to reviews of this hotel on your site - they did not disappoint – good hotel for price – cleanliness – Staff – free Wi fi in room a big + and shuttle Bus (although it would be a bit far out if this was not available – although busses did stop outside) Airport shuttle bus stop outside hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & helpful staff, Comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: craig_traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel on the outskirts of central Kowloon. Stayed on 19th floor in a clean and comfortable room with all of the modern conveniences. Big bathrrom with shower only. Convenient shuttle to TST. Staff very nice and helpful. Always esponded quickly to requests and good at providing information. Location is a bit out of the waym but the free shuttle helps. Cheap restuarants throughout the area, 7-11 down the street. Overall a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay here”
Reviews.Author: ReenaRBahrain
Reviews.Content: I stayed along with my parents here for 5 days and I must say that it was a great stay. Our package included the buffet breakfast which was really good. The staff were friendly and extremely helpful. The room service was fantastic. The shuttle service that they offered was great as both stops (Mongkok and Tsim Tsa Shui) has MRTs nearby and we could travel elsewhere with relative ease. There is a supermarket just opposite the hotel. The only downside was that sometimes we could get the smell of cigarettes in our room but was not such a big issue since we were not in the hotel room for most part of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location.”
Reviews.Author: juleyyeates
Reviews.Content: Cannot fault hotel in any way. Breakfast very good, lots of variety. Hotel shuttle bus is brilliant. First visit to Hong Kong for my 83yr old mother so we made good use of the shuttle bus. Would definitely stay here again and have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “High quality, excellent service and good value”
Reviews.Author: Porridge43
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd visit to the Metropark Hotel, Kowloon and on each occasion we have been delighted with the comfort and friendliness during our stay. We are always impressed with the meals in the Hotel and the relaxed atmosphere around. We have always booked a Club room which gives you the use of the lounge facilities with drinks and snacks in the evening. We will certainly recommend the hotel and hope to return in the future. Auchterarder, Scotland

Reviews.Title: “welcoming, friendly, helpful”
Reviews.Author: danae363
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in this hotel. it was my partners 60th birthday and they gave us a free upgrade and provided a birthday cake at no extra cost. We ate at the hotels restaurants and were welcomed and every need met. Although we were only there a few days we were made to feel special. Rooms extremely clean although small by Western standards.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Metropark Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: JaseUK1
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel close to Mongkok area of Kowloon within walking distance to Nathan Road. I have stayed before but now they have upgraded many of their rooms to a nice modern standard. They are called Comfort Plus and I can highly recommend them. The swimming pool also seems to have been updated and has a lovely rooftop location. For the price I would definitely recommend this hotel. Great new gym equipment and free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with our kids”
Reviews.Author: Bernie O
Reviews.Content: Great stay for the value, clean and very helpful staff. Free shuttle daily to Metro or other destination Location good for shopping just a few minutes walk to Mon Kok excellent breakfast service nice Pool area I really can recommend it for families or people which likes good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Relatively good value for money (except for sleep issues)”
Reviews.Author: edithalexis
Reviews.Content: Metropark Kowloon meets the standards of a good 3-star hotel, with all the necessary provisions and a little more (e.g. the bedside table is able to emit music, different types of pillows that you can specially request for). I'm not so sure about cleanliness because the entire floor area is carpeted and I always harbour deep suspicions about carpets and their microbe-breeding properties. The staff are generally friendly and helpful, no issues. Transport - it is great when you are travelling with a parent in the senior citizen category and there is a direct coach link between airport and hotel. Costs HK98 per person per trip. The ride can be booked upon arrival at Counter B17 in the airport. The free shuttle bus service takes you straight to Mongkok (where you can easily find the MTR, Ladies' Market and Fa Yuen Street with innumerable shops selling sports shoes at prices around $20-$30 lower than in Singapore) and Tsim Sha Tsui (MTR, big shopping malls and many different types of shops including bakeries, cafes, bookstores, retail stores, and so on - the Hong Kong Cultural Centre, Space Museum, Ferry terminal are also nearby). But if you prefer to be very near the MTR, you might wish to choose other hotels because to me, it is not within walking distance to any station. Amenities nearby - a supermarket across the road, eateries and bakeries lining the street on the side of the hotel. My only issue (which is a big one for me) is the ventilation/air con system in the rooms. Had trouble getting a good night's sleep which is unusual coz I always sleep like a log. Based on this, I will not be going back to this hotel, though I'm sure many others found it perfectly ok to sleep in. All in all, a good choice if you are looking for a decent 3-star hotel, and do not mind not having the MTR at your doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: JoMN1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for the remaining 4 days of our holiday and couldn't have been happier with the service we receieved. The porters couldn't have been more helpful and the staff were always happy to help. Our room was always cleaned to a high standard and clean towels provided whether we asked for them or not! The shuttle bus was very frequent and the porter even chased it down the road for us when we arrived too late to catch it and the driver stopped immediately. The stops on the shuttle suited us fine and everywhere we wanted to visit was within easy route of these stops. We were very pleased to receive a complimentary voucher for food and drinks too, something we weren't expecting. Would definitely return to this hotel again. Fantastic service, the staff are a credit to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great service, great internet, great food!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel8213
Reviews.Content: I had trouble finding anywhere reasonably priced in Hong Kong or Kowloon which included free wi-fi. We stayed at the Metro Park for 7 days and it was a great experience. It was walking distance to the metro and shopping centres but there was also a free shuttle every half hour (but often full). There were chinese laundries close by, ladies market and night markets were within walking distance too (although about 10-15mins). No complaints at all!

Reviews.Title: “If you enjoy passive smoking whilst sleeping...”
Reviews.Author: filo_roll
Reviews.Content: This was our third and final hotel stay on our hotel hopping adventure through HK. We paid a total of $HK2253 for three nights in the comfort room from wotif.com. Make sure you tell the taxi driver Metropark KOWLOON not Mongkok. Even though I told our driver this and pointed to the hotel on the map, and he even looked at it with his magnifying glass, he still took us to the wrong hotel! Luckily taxi fares are cheap, only $HK18 for the first 2kms. When we first walked into the room, it absolutely stunk of cigarettes. Unfortunately as I found out that night, the smoke was coming through the vents in the ceiling (see photos). I woke up in the middle of the night suffocating in a cloud of cigarette smoke. Although we were on a non-smoking floor, the guests next door were smoking up a fire. It was quite disgusting everytime we returned to our hotel room we would be hit with the stink of cigarettes. Also the walls are thin so turn up the air con to create white noise to block out the people next door. However, the higher I turned up the air con, the faster the cigarette smoke came in through the vents!! Housekeeping did the bare minimum. They made the beds yes, but they did not tidy up the room, e.g. empty bottles of water were not disposed of, the room service menu which I was reading and had left next to the bed, was left on the floor next to the curtains and I had to look around the room for it, towels were not folded properly and I doubt that new towels were issued even though I placed them in the bath and there was blood on the door handle to the bathroom (see photos). The room was quite run down for a 3.5* hotel. The porters are good and took our luggage up to the room and they opened the hotel doors for us which is nice. In terms of location, it is a 10 minute walk to the Ladies Market and Mongkok MTR. There are a few buses (81c, 271) that go past the hotel down Nathan Rd to the Temple St Markets. There are a couple of bread shops near the hotel and many convenience stores such as 7eleven where you can buy alcohol. If you like pets go down Victory Ave. The two starrred Michelin yum cha restaurant - Tim Ho Fun, is nearby on Kwong Wa St. Regarding the free shuttle (the wee bus!), there are only two stops, first in Mongkok about 3 blocks from the MTR and the second at TST. Judging by the little booklet thing they gave us I thought there would be three stops in Mongkok but no, so I wanted to get off but the driver wouldn't let me, then 10 minutes later he stopped the bus and told me to get off but I refused and told him I have no idea where we were, so I ended up in TST!! Regarding the hotel shuttle to the airport (not the airport express shuttle), you have to pre-book, that is before you check-out. It cost $HK98 per person. It took ages to get to the airport (1.5hrs) because it stopped at various hotels and got stuck in many traffic jams around Mongkok. 45mins later and we were still in Mongkok! There is free cabled wi-fi which was useful. Ethernet cable is provided in the drawer. The tv is the old box style and the reception wasn't that good and the channel selections weren't as varied as at other hotels. If I didn't have to passive smoke whilst sleeping I would return to this hotel but until they improve their ventilation system I won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, tidy and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Theleds
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days on our 5 week honeymoon. We got off the train and a free bus took us straight to the hotel. Check in was quick and easy. The room was clean and had maid service every day, the room was quite small, and we overlooked the local’s apartments which were in a pretty bad state. The roof top pool was nice and the gym was small, but offered a running machine and bike. Also there was a Wii for tor the kids that were staying there. It was quite close to Nathan Road and we found the No.7 bus was the best to get back and forth. Overall I would recommend this hotel as the price was cheap too.

Reviews.Title: “IMO not suitable for a one night stop over.”
Reviews.Author: Sandy151
Reviews.Content: IMO this Hotel is to far away from airport for just a one night stop over. We waited for 30 Min's at airport for our arranged shuttle collection,and hour travel to Hotel, this could well take longer if driver was dropping off at other hotel's. Had a very early start the next morning and a repeat 1 hour shuttle to airport. We both felt that our precious time was taken up with waiting and transportation to and from this accommodation, and not used for relaxing as we wanted. No available time not see or use any of the Hotels faculties. The bell boys were a joke, they expected a tip by just looking at our case. When we have good service, we will reward. Rooms that are given for one night only are not to a very good standard, both cups dirty, and shower needed a proper cleaning , but did not have the time or energy to complain. Hotel and distance may be OK if the stay is for longer than just one night. Sandy

Reviews.Title: “I hated the wee bus”
Reviews.Author: amr7
Reviews.Content: On first visit to Hong Kong we stayed at this hotel, the hotel was fine. The staff were very friendly and accomodating. Especially nice was the 19th floor swimming pool outiside, along with the gym. The room itself was okay, clean, but small and rather dull. The highlight of the hotel was the restaurant manager, who was excellent. The downside of the hotel, was the shuttle bus to Mong Kok and Tsim Sha Tsui as there were four of us, we had to make sure we were early, in order to get a seat on the bus to get to and from the hotel. Some evenings on returning back, while being collected in Tsim Sha Tsui, my daughter or son got on the bus, but neither my husband nor I got on, it was like a rugby scrum every evening while returning. On a couple of occasions we had to either walk, or get the MTR back to the hotel. In principle the free bus is a great idea, but in practise its a first come - first serve basis.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, everything we required for 3 nights”
Reviews.Author: Champagne42
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were very efficient and professional and friendly enough. The shuttle bus is brilliant. The restaurants are quite pricey, particularly the drinks but then again one does not have to use the restaurants as there is plenty available very close to the hotel. Overall we had a very pleasant stay and would stay there again if we were in HK.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: AllisonTuck
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely, very clean and comfortable with exceptional service. The staff throughout the hotel are wonderful and cannot do enough for you and made us feel very well looked after. Spacious room with all mod cons, comfortable bed, nicely furnished throughout with good storage. Good location, with only a 5-10 minute walk from Nathan Road, the night markets and the centre of everything. There's a handy shuttle bus running from the hotel every 20mins, free of charge which takes you down to the bottom of Nathan Road right by the Star ferry terminal. Small but welcoming pool especially after a humid day of hard walking. I can recommend booking various tours with the tour office in the lobby, particularly Lantao Island, the giant buddha, the city by night and the Jumbo restaurant - all excellent value for money. Great hotel which I'd definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “very good value”
Reviews.Author: tufty68
Reviews.Content: stayed for 4 nights booked online with hotels website. no problems checking in, room was immaculate & cleaned to a very high standard every day. room was very comfortable very good furnishings. didnt eat in the resturant .there are lots of inexpensive local cafes nearby . didnt use the bus service to get to hotel it would have been cheaper if we had. booked it back to the airport . we were boked on the 5,30pm bus . but we werent back yet so they transfered our booking to the 6,30. we couldnt fault this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasurable stay except for one rotten apple.”
Reviews.Author: su_lim08
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at Metropark Hotel Kowloon because of the many positive reviews on Trip Advisor as compared to the other hotels in HK. Prior to our arrival, the reservations department emailed to advise us on the hot weather in HK and reminded us to avoid prolonged exposure in the sun etc. We felt this was a nice gesture even before we departed for HK. Airport shuttle service to the hotel was quick and efficient. Upon arrival, we had no problems with the bell-boys bothering us for tips as we have read in several reviews. We simply said we could manage ourselves. Checking-in was smooth with no hiccups, we were upgraded to the newer rooms. The view in our room was nothing fantastic. The walls felt a bit damp and sticky, especially the section below the air-conditioner unit. The room had a musky smell, would have been nice if the room had air-freshener etc. The bathroom was just the right size, compact and truly functional. Our only gripe about the bathroom was the loosened shower rod which felt as though it could drop off anytime we were showering. Overall, we were satisfied with the room and service especially through the little personal touches such as complimentary fruits on arrival and chocolates along with a note telling us the following day's weather forecast. Staff at the G level spoke good English and were helpful in terms of directions and information. Not exactly the smiling sort though. Shuttle bus service was good but locations were limited - just 2, Mongkok and Tsim Sha Tsui. Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. It was clean and quiet. However, the one and only thing that turned us off - the unabashed driver of the hotel's airport shuttle bus taking us to the airport. He seemed to be overly nice to us during the journey from the hotel to the airport. Upon arrival at the airport, he took out our luggage from the compartment below the bus. As he was doing that, he turned to us with a big smile on his face and practically opened his mouth to ask us for tips. We were taken aback but tipped him nevertheless. We have taken countless shuttle buses provided by hotels and had never encountered such a situation. It is not about money but seriously, was it so hard for him to pull out our luggage without expecting anything in return? Afterall, we had already paid the required transport fee to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good price-quality ratio for a very decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: SilviaKeddie
Reviews.Content: The Metropark Kowloon is a good hotel with very good price-quality ratio. Make sure you get a room in the Club floor, as some of the lower levels seem to be a bit outdated. The rooms are clean, comfortable and we couldn't hear any noises at any point so it was perfect for resting. Kowloon wasn't a beautiful area of Hong Kong, going back we would stay somewhere else, particularly if you are not into shopping (and you prefer cultural and walking activities). The staff weren't overly nice but they were helpful and alerted us that we were leaving our phone behind in the room straight away, which was particularly efficient. We found the shuttle bus to Mongkok and the harbour area extremely helpful and convenient and saved us a lot of time an money. Knowing more about Hong Kong now, I would not book a hotel with a swimming pool given the weather doesn't always permit swimming or sunbaking.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel, But far from main area”
Reviews.Author: wenmarkei
Reviews.Content: On checking in and inspecting the rooms we found that the main road facing ones are bigger and had at least some sort of view, so we asked for a change since we were initially given a smaller one on the other side. The room was well equipped and the free internet was great. The buffet breakfast is ok for a short stay, they never changed the menu even once for the 8 days we stayed there. It is also very expensive specially for a child who is 4 years. We had to pay 66 HKD/day which actually was a waste since my son would eat only a bit. Normally children of that age are not charged elsewhere. The people manning the reception were Ok although not friendly. Bell boys were a nuisance and always asked for a tip, were quiet irritating in fact. Housekeeping was good. The hotel is located quite far from anything worth seeing, the nearest market is about 20-30 min walk. The shuttle bus is also useful only to a certain extent. We ended up using taxis which can be quite expensive. There a couple of bakeries around the hote, Panash is one of them. You get get some food at reasonable rates from Teresa which is just a block away from the hotel To sum it up, I would not stay here again since I think there are better options available elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, superb staff”
Reviews.Author: rosieandjim63
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the metropark from the 17th June 2010 for three nights, from the moment we arrived the service was second to none. We had chosen to take advantage of the club rooms which was really worth it. We were bed and breakfast, there was so much choice for breakfast that you did not know where to start. We did have one evening meal in the hotel that again was absolutely lovely. We took advantage of the free shuttle buses walked our legs off around the markets and then relaxed when we got back in the sports bar as it was the world cup and they stayed open while the games were on. We took the ferry across to Hong Kong Island (this was certainly an experience not to be missed), after shopping in one area we wanted to go to times square so we took the tram from one end to the other along with the locals only to find you needed correct change two hkd, (a kind lady helped us with this). We would certainly go back to Hong Kong again as there is so much to take in and do , next time for a longer stay. Would we stay at this hotel again? Absolutely!!!! first class service and faciilities. Well done to all the staff and management. Thank you for making our stay excellent cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TubesPendle
Reviews.Content: Hotel in a very good location for the markets only 10 mins walk, don't miss having a look at the fish/ pet market very different to British markets! The hotel has a shuttle bus that runs every 30 mins until 10.30 pm, it drops you right near the ferry terminal to get to Hong kong island. Ferries are cheap to all the different islands, prices go up a little Thus-Sun. Hotel very nice, staff helpful & friendly and you are spoilt for choice at breakfast a really nice selection of food.

Reviews.Title: “home away from home”
Reviews.Author: a_chuykov
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated within walking distance to Nathan Road (around 10 minutes), Night Market (10 minutes), Tsim Sha Tsui and Star Ferry (25-30 min). I was really surprised by the size of our room (Comfort room), I thought it would have been much smaller. The room was well equipped, clean. Our bed was big and comfortable, didn't have any problems with wireless internet. They have a very good buffet breakfast and a shuttle bus to Tsim Sha Tsui (the shuttle stops near the avenue of stars). The only one negative moment was when at check I was told to wait for a room for 2 hours (I arrived to hotel at 11.30 AM). Generally, this is a nice place to stay in Hong Kong. This is a fabulous city. I love it!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel - great staff”
Reviews.Author: snecksneck
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Metropark Kowloon last September and had was very impressed. We booked an executive room and upon arrival at the hotel our bags were taken for us and we were referred from the reception up to the executive floors for a private express check in. The whole process was very smooth and the staff were very friendly. We had found a great deal online from booking.com and decided to stay executive as it was the last week of a 6 week long holiday in china/thailand and hong kong. The room was very large and comfortable as was the bathroom. Breakfast had a large buffet selection - my boyfriend ate 3 courses for breakfast each day - there were chinese options, full cooked options and continental choices. Dinner could also be had here with a buffet option - while we were staying there was a seafood night where the food looked very good and for a reasonable price - i think it was around £20 per person. The executive room afforded us access to the executive lounge where we enjoyed several free drinks each evening. The servers were very prompt and the girls offered to get us more drinks when they saw that we were nearly finished. There were canapes provided - mini fruit tarts, spring rolls, chicken satay etc which went nicely with the drinks. The canapes however, do get snapped up quickly so it would be best to head down to the area whenever the refreshments start if you wish to get some. Good selection of spirits, wines and coffees. Free internet access was great! The hotel runs a bus service down to salisbury road - going via the main shopping streets which we found very useful. Hotel is also close to the subway system and right beside a few small shops for snacks and drinks. Although the hotel may seem a little far out - great value for money and great transport links to the harbor. While in Hong Kong the Peak provides a great view with lots of little cafes at the top to admire from. We booked the intercontinental on salisbury road for a buffet dinner in advance. Superb food - buffet with unlimited lobster, sharks fin soup and meats. Brunch buffet also offers unlimited champagne. Around £50 per person for dinner but expect pricey drinks though DEFINITELY worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Awesome”
Reviews.Author: sohnw
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th time in HK and Metropark Hotel Kowloon is simply the best hotel amongst all my different hotel stays there (4 stars range). Apart from the 15min walk frm the MTR, everything was just great. Service was excellent, hotel staff very polite, warm and friendly. Spacious rooms by HK standard in comfortable, cosy settings, free internet, cable TV and room was always done up neatly. I even got to watch my dose of World Cup from the comforts of the hotel room! The shuttle service was fantastic too. Will definitely come back to stay here again. :D Thank you metropark hotel kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “First Family Overseas Trip”
Reviews.Author: Aus75
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel from the net, it looked really nice. We didn't know where the location was from everything. When we got there the staff were excellent, we had our bags brought up to our room. Rooms were basic, you got what you paid for, but our thought was we were only going to sleep in them. After unpacking we decided to look around and when the hotel info said 8 min walk o everywhere that was so true. The ladies market was so close, MTR, everything. So location for us was excellent. The staff from house keeping to Venus for breakfast was awesome. Very professional and polite. Would recomend to anyone to stay there, and when we go back there we will be staying there again......

Reviews.Title: “Decent value for HK visit”
Reviews.Author: MA_Browne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights during a holiday to Hong Kong. The complimentary shuttle to Tsim Sha Tsui was very convenient. The staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were compact but clean and the bed was very comfortable. No view out of the window, but for a mid-range Hong Kong hotel this is par for the course. Buffet breakfast was a little expensive but had a decent variety. The downstairs bar was small but the staff were very attentive, and remembered what my wife and I had been drinking the previous evening and served us accordingly. In fact we received a round of compliemntary drinks on the house the night before we left, which was a warmly appreciated gesture. The hotel is about a 15 minute walk from the MTR.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service with great food and location.”
Reviews.Author: jfernand3z
Reviews.Content: We visited Hong Kong last November 2009 and stayed at Metropark Hotel (Kowloon). From the airport, we arrived at the Hotel through their Airport Shuttle service. Our room was very clean and their service was excellent. They have their free shuttle service that tours around Hong Kong and Mong Kok is very near (15-20 minutes by foot). Hotel's very accessible to MTR. There's a McDonald's nearby and a money changer as well. There are street foods nearby too! (You should try the restaurants at the hotel lobby because the food's awesome.) Their rate is the cheapest (for a hotel I think) for a Comfort Room WITH buffet breakfast. My family and I really loved the place!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, annoying porters”
Reviews.Author: bobbyladGuangzhou
Reviews.Content: Had a great time and not the first time I have stayed here. The rooms are excellent, the service not to mention great value. The only thing which irks me is the persistence of the hotel in porters in demanding tips. Tipping is very much not a Chinese custom, if anything it goes against it but it does not stop them here. "Sorry I have no change" certainly does not deter them either though after a good 5 minutes of standing in your room while you go about your business they will eventually give up. On the way out I did tip them, and made up for not being able to on check in only to find when he put our bags on the airport bus he came onto the bus seeming to demand a second tip. I just sat there until the bus driver asked him to leave. When I answered the door to room service I was nervous about letting them leave in case they wanted more money. I really can't stand this kind of behaviour especially when everything you pay for at the hotel, meals, drinks, final bill all includes a 15% service charge. The beggars on the streets of Shenzhen are less persistent than these guys!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: Auldbuff
Reviews.Content: When we arrived to book in we noticed you could upgrade for an extra £30 appx per night. As this was a holiday of a life time to Australia with 3 days in Hong Kong we decided to 'go for it'.Bigger room, english newspaper, exclusive breakfast room, happy hour cocktails and sandwiches and a 3pm check out......well worth it. We laso ate in the Hotel Restaurant , the food was excellent and not too pricy. The staff were charming and efficient....hope to revisit some day!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a few days in HK”
Reviews.Author: H0lidayBlues
Reviews.Content: The Metropark Causeway Bay is ideally located to access various transport links. There is a tram, MTR and bus stop within a two minute walk. In terms of travel from the airport I would jump in a taxi if there are 3+ in your group, this worked out at c350HKD whereas the MTR was 300 HKD, otherwise I would say MTR from airport to Hong Kong station and a taxi from there, saves you the steps with luggage. We were upgraded on arrival to a suite, whch had a seperate living room and a fantastic view of the harbour. It had everything you could need and more. Breakfast was varied and plentiful and drinks in the bar good, not the cheapest but to be expected. Would definately stay again if I go back to HK.

Reviews.Title: “YES IG Trip to HongKong”
Reviews.Author: SuccessorRay
Reviews.Content: Good for it's services, environment and afforable pricing

Reviews.Title: “Kowloon Oasis”
Reviews.Author: jeremiahLiverpoolUK
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at this hotel, winding down after our own 'hand knitted' tour of mainland China. I specifically chose this hotel because it had a rooftop swimming pool, 20 stories up. The rooms were well maintained and clean, The staff, smiling and obliging. The breakfast (part of the price deal) could leave nobody unsatisfied. There was something for every taste and culture. The pool was a godsend after leisurely days sightseeing in Hing Kong. Difficult to fault.

Reviews.Title: “OK for what it is but if you can afford somewhere else, go there!”
Reviews.Author: trinity2104
Reviews.Content: I'm going to try to be fair to this hotel because my thoughts and feelings about it is somewhat marred by my fantastic stay at the Park Lane on Hong Kong island last year (which incidentally, is absolutely fantastic and would highly recommend). However, the Park Lane is at least three times the price so you do really get what you pay for. Me and my husband stayed at this hotel for 4 nights, booked by our travel agent for a fantastic rate of circa £50 a night (minus buffet breakfast). Prior to visiting the hotel we were emailing the hotel to inform them of our plans including booking airport transfers etc - all emails were promptly answered. We had booked the airport transfer for HKD98 per person which I would recommend unless you are getting the airport bus and know your way round HK - a ticket on the airport express will set you back about HKD90 per person anyway, and even then you will have to work your way to the hotel itself. Better to be picked up and taken there. The transfer bus goes to other hotels in Kowloon as well (depending who has booked) but if you don't mind staying on the bus for a while whilst other people are dropped off, then this is really the best way to get to the hotel. Upon arrival we were told that check in is on the first floor - a bit strange but hey ho. Good points: 1. We were upgraded to the club room but to be honest, still felt it was cramped (can't imagine what the standard rooms are like) but this is HK and I know rooms are notoriously small due to the lack of space. 2. Room is clean and is cleaned every day. 3. Loved the shuttle bus which runs every 15 minutes in the morning and then every 30 minutes. Stops at Mong Kok station and then TST. Although, it operates on a first come first serve basis and I can see people having to wait for the next bus if it's full. Right, here are my gripes about this hotel: 1. Location - I frequent HK on average once a year and know my way round. The shuttle bus is fantastic, but the nearest tube stop is about 15 minutes walk away (not nice in 30 degree heat and 94% humidity). HOWEVER (a big however), the price reflects this and there are plenty of buses from TST/Nathan Road which stops right outside the hotel so if you do miss the shuttle, there are options (which are cheap - bus fare on the No.7 was about HKD4) 2. Staff - my main gripe is with the bellboys. The staff here are the nicest Cantonese staff I've come across (and that's saying a lot considering I'm Cantonese and know what the culture is like). However, I do not appreciate the bellboys immediate expectation of a tip. As a rule, I do not tip unless someone has gone above and beyond their job description - after all, a tip is an expression of gratitude for another person's service/help rather than their fee. When we arrived at the hotel, our luggage was whipped off the bus and we were given a ticket - very efficient. However, the bellboy which delivered our luggage, took the suitcases into the room and then stood IN THE ROOM with a grin on his face and then said "Thank you, miss". All he needed to do was to hold out his hand for a handout to complete the picture! I hated this! I hated feeling like I had to give him something just because he was standing half a metre away from me in a small cramped room just to get rid of him. Regardless of this, I stood my ground and said I didn't have anything for him, and at which time, he about turned and left (albeit still with a grin on this face!). Fortunately this was my only encounter of unpleasantness from the staff - everyone else was really helpful and didn't expect a tip. 3. Gym - Pool is nice (a bit small but you can swim in it - that's the only thing that's important) however the fitness room is rather limited. Two treadmills, one cross trainer and one bike - and I think I counted 2 weights at about 3 kg?! Could do with another cross trainer at least as me and my husband visited the gym when it opened at 7;30am and there was already someone in there on the treadmill. Overall - my husband thought this hotel was OK (especially for hte price). However, due to the location and the manner of some of the staff, I think I'm going to kick up a fuss with my other half for next year's trip and book the Park Lane (albeit at triple the price - says a lot about this hotel really.....).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely food, helpful staff, great pool”
Reviews.Author: MyfanwyBirmingham
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for an extended period in March/April and was really pleased with it. Free shuttle bus service into the heart of Kowloon, yummy cake shop in lobby, 2 for 1 happy hour (that actually lasts a few hours!) every night, both western and chinese cuisine, amazing breakfast buffet, fab pool on the rooftop, very helpful staff and comfortable rooms. We stayed in one of the standard rooms which was very nice, but I heard from other guests that the club rooms were fantastic so may be worth paying a bit extra if you are looking for something flashier!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: handsome2day
Reviews.Content: Was on a 5 day trips with gf. Overall service was ok. About 15-20 mins walk to the MTR, but they provided a first come first serve shuttle that bring u to several other places. Pleasant stay and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but far from main areas”
Reviews.Author: disillusion20
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights for business purposes, the staff were very helpful and friendly and made me feel quite at home. The room I got was of a good size though it was a bit old (had an 80s feel to it). The bathroom was clean and I especially loved that the hot water came on instantly (I have had to wait a bit in some other hotels) and that the air-conditioning wasn't blasting cold all the time. The bed was comfy (pushed two single beds together) and they offered a choice of pillows with different filling. A nice touch was that they left a card detailing the weather for the next day as well as complimentary fruits. Overall I had a good experience at this hotel, the only drawback being that it was a bit out of the way - had to do alot of walking from Mongkok or Yau Mai Tai MTRs. They do provide a shuttle bus to Tsim Sha Tsui area though.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: RecycledTeenager8
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and it did what it said on the tin, no more no less. We found the hotel very comfortable but basic. There were no frills but rooms were clean and relatively modern. Our room over looked the main road but we didn’t experience any traffic noise. We were given complementary water every day and rooms were also cleaned daily. We were staying on a room only basis so didn’t eat at the hotel but there was a nice cake shop attached to the reception area so we could purchase an early morning coffee and pastry before heading out. The location was dissapointing as it was not central but it was convenient for the ladies Market and some shopping areas. Taxis were cheap so we never went on the MTR but chose instead to use the Hotel’s shuttle bus to take us to the Star Ferry to get across to Hong Kong Island were we also found many bars, restaurants and designer shops. We travelled back by taxi one evening which was also very cheap. There were some scruffy areas near to the hotel but it adds to the colour of Hong Kong. This is not a cheap place to stay and even the hotel happy hour was expensive so be prepared to spend. Don’t forget to go up the peak for the best views (on a good day of course) and watch the laser show across the river held each evening.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is decent enough, but not great location”
Reviews.Author: room103
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here due to volcano disruption and needed to find somewhere fairly cheap fast. The staff here were actually the friendliest of the hotels we stayed in during our trip to HK. The hotel itself was fine, and clean, but quite dated (check out the 80s sports bar). Perhaps some of the floors had been updated but ours hadn't. I wouldn't really recommend staying here if you are a tourist though on a short trip due to location, as its a 10-15 minute walk though busy streets to Mong Kok MTR so you end up using the free shuttle bus (to Mong Kok and TsimShaTui - every half hour each way) mostly - its a bit out of the way.

Reviews.Title: “Good, tidy hotel.”
Reviews.Author: raykewl
Reviews.Content: Decided to book the hotel for a one-night stay in HK before going to Guang Zhou. Arrived pretty late, about 11PM, but no problem with check-in whatsoever. Staff are helpful and efficient. Although this hotel isn't particularly near from any MRT stations, a 5-10 minute walk will get you to the outskirts of Nathan Rd, which will give you a taste of Hong Kong's vibe at night. Room was neat and clean, and same goes to the bathroom as well. The only drawback: room size, already given a free upgrade by the staff, is a bit small compared to the hotels I've stayed before in HK. Overall, this is a fairly nice, clean hotel located not too far from Nathan Rd. I'd recommend this hotel if you don't mind about the room size. A good, solid 3.5* hotel IMO. Note: A taxi will cost you around HKD 250 from the airport. Definitely take this option for a party of 3 or more.

Reviews.Title: “The club room packages was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: australian_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Clubb rooms for 10 nights the rooms were cleaned to a high standard every day and the staff were happy in their service. The happy hours in the club lounge room were great, wonderful place to relax after a big day of sightseeing. The tour shop on the bottom floor was so handy and the staff only to pleased to help with any information on hong kong. The buffet breakfast was wonderful and varied there was something for everybody. The free shuttle bus stopped at two major stops and the frquent service was a credit to thehotel. I will always stay at this hotel in hong kong.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base”
Reviews.Author: AnnieM1
Reviews.Content: This is a well-equiped and comfortable hotel. Initally we were disappointed with the location - it's a long way to the harbour and used to take us about 45 mins if walking. However, the hotel does operate a courtesy bus which runs frequently. Once we became familiar with the bottom end of Nathan Road we tried to avoid it as it's very commercialised and we were constantly pestered with: 'copy bag?' - 'copy watch?' etc. Close to the hotel is Mongkok and a short walk away is Kowloon Walled City Park - both are interesting places to visit and would recommend. We would stay in this hotel again and would recommend Kowloon as a base rather than the island.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Trane&Trane
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as we wanted to spend some days in Mongkok and we did not expect a lot from it. However, we were pleasantly surprised by our Club Spacious room which was nicely furnished and with all amenities needed. The breakfast was okay but nothing special, the service level was very good and the bar was a nice and cosy place with happy hour from 4 to 9. We would recommend this hotel anytime if you want to stay in Mongkok which is not as touristy as Tsim Sha Tsui.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we could have asked for at that price!”
Reviews.Author: SparksyFamily
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the MetroPark Kowloon from April 5th for 6 nights with my wife and 2 children 8 and 11. We had 2 interconnecting rooms on the 16th floor one a double and one with twin beds. Whilst the rooms were small comparing to Bangkok standards they were refurbished and the price we paid was very reasonable for Hong Kong. My friend a travel agent had warned us of the location being a little out of the way, but really with the bus No8 being right across the road and the MTR being about a 10 min walk, it was really nice to be able to go out on the street and not be accousted by all the touts in Nathan road, and very easy to get to any part of HongKong that you wanted to visit. We are not a "tour" family and we do research and then do all our trips on public transport at our own pace, we can then decide to stay at one location longer or backtrack if we want, and it helps our kids get an education on travel that would be not available on organised battery hen type tours. One thing I would recommend though was Rick Shaws hop on hop off bus tour on HongKong island and for a few $AUD was great value. Overall a good experience at this hotel for the price we paid. One citicism is that the non smoking rooms do smell of smoke but this is typical across asia in most cities. This is an interesting part of Hongkong to explore with the markets and great shopping being so close. Also a 10 min walk to the East Rail line in Mongkok to catch the train to Shenzen which was again agreat experinece for all of us. Off course the highlights for the kids would be Ocean Park and Disneyland, with Ocean Park being my and my wifes favourite also.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly place to stay in Hong Kong.”
Reviews.Author: ProcomSioPao
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd stay at Metropark Kowloon. This time I brought the kids on their first trip. The hotel staff were very helpful as usual and the kids enjoyed their stay at Hong Kong. The most I enjoyed was for my request that our luggage stay even when we checked out early in the day which the front desk staff accommodated immediately. This gave us an extra day to show the kids how beautiful Hong Kong is and do more shopping. I also tried the shuttle this time to Tsim Sha Tsui and found it to be very convenient specially with the little kids in tow. The cleaning staff really did a good job everyday even with the mess that kids would make. Everyday we came home to a room that was pristinely clean with chocolate goodies left on the pillows which the children loved. Location is near enough for shopping but far enough from all the hustle, bustle and noise. While others would complain about the 3 blocks to the MTR station and the shopping area, I quite enjoyed exploring the different neighborhood streets. Oh Mcdonalds is just a block or two down the street making it a familiar site for the kids. I am recommending this fabulous hotel to friends, business associates and other travelers. It is our home in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “my favourite”
Reviews.Author: junjie-blog
Reviews.Content: Everytime I come in Hong Kong, i just go their. The swimming pool is new and outside it is really great ! The area is quiet and a shuttle can bring you directly to TST. If you prefer take the subway, it's not too far but not close too. In summer, it may be better to wait for the shuttle. if you want to eat, you have plenty of local food around. Their is also a mainland chinese restaurant not far. Definitely the best compare to the price. I paid around 70 Euros a day. By the way, Internet is free of charge !

Reviews.Title: “If you cannot sleep well here - it must be your guilty conscience”
Reviews.Author: Labra52
Reviews.Content: Quiet. Clean. Good location: easy to reach from the airport (the hotel couch will pick you up for HKD98 = US$14 and bring to the hotel doorstep in less than one hor - but prepare to wait in the airport as they leave twice an hour); 7-minute walk from a huge open-air market; and the free hotel shuttle (every 30 min) will bring you to the waterfront (harbor) in 15 minutes. Affordable (under US$100/night, no breakfast). Plenty places to eat around - from under US$10 to posh and expensive. The staff speaks good English with little accent, no need to make efforts to decipher their utterances (which is not always the case in Hong Kong - be ready to repeat your question and listen to the answer for 3-4 times before you figrue out what they say...). Efficient and unobtrusive service.

Reviews.Title: “I love to stay in Metropark Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: bienfel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights last March 25-27, 2010 in a comfort plus room with buffet breakfast....
