Very nice and clean hotel for a reasonable price, complimentary breakfast was also good and shuttle transfer from the airport was very efficient. The hotel also had a free shuttle going to Mongkok and Tsim Sha Tsui every 30 minutes and a short walking distance from Yau Ma Tei and MongKok MTR stations. They also had a free internet access in all their rooms. We'll definitely stay in this hotel again in my next visit in Hong Kong. :-) Mitzi from Philippines

Reviews.Title: “great value for money good location”
Reviews.Author: ronypiz
Reviews.Content: me and my wife , from Israel,staied in the Metropark for 6 nights from 22 March/. booked for Club room. we had great stay. the price was good. very good food. we got a very thing that is needed. breakfast, evning happy hour, free internt good and clean room (not small at all). excellent service. excellent hotel shuttle. we will recommened this hotel for our friends

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with 1st class staff and services”
Reviews.Author: carpetking5432
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel over Chinese New year. Staff were very friendly and professional throughout my 6 night stay. Booked a club room which were clean and a good size for Hong Kong. The cleaning staffwere overly efficient replacing half used bottles of shower gels and each room gets the standard shower gels etc but also toothbrushes combs shaving kits on a daily basis if needed. The chocolates with the turn down service were appreacited as was the weather card which allowed some element of planning for the following days events. The rooms were very quiet and very up to date each comes with a safe mini fridge and complimentary bottled water the only down was the lack of draw space. The club room comes with free breakfast (which at $128 is expensive) but it is of a high standard and covers all but the most difficult of persons wants. Also tried the other restaurant and found the food and service to be first class, especially like the set menu of allowing you to pick 2 main meals to mix and match. The club rooms also come with the added benefit of a private lounge for breakfast which later serves afternoon snacks and drinks but only between 17.30/19.30 hrs so its first come first served on the snaks as they don't get replaced. We were even allowed use of the lounge after we had checked out and were waiting for our transport to the airport. The sip sip bar happy hour lasts for 5 hours and whilst we ordered our first round during the happy hour we then went out for a meal and retuned well outside the happy hour only for the staff to give us are remaining drinks for free. The staff throughout were very professional and friendly even needed their services to help open the safe in the room. The location is good for the markets and if you use Yam Mai Tei MTR station its only 10 minutes from the hotel. Also if you use the Pitt St rather than the Waterloo exit you can save yourself a few minutes walk. If you are using the MTR I would recommend a Octopus ticket but if you want The hotel runs a bus service to the waterfront (New World Centre) however it does not wait so whilst it leaves the hotel on the hour and half past the hour the return journey is more flexible so despite it having fixed journey times expect to be there 15 to 20 minutes before its advertised time. The only down side both the pool and gym were closed for winter maintance so I cannot comment on them but I would happily stay at this hotel again and would happily recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good start”
Reviews.Author: archiebabs
Reviews.Content: First place we stayed on our month long family trip around the world. 2 parents 4 chilldren aged 12, 14, 16, 18. Good value for money and rooms were clean and comfortable. We were on the 19th Floor so had no problems with noise from the road as other guests had complained. Staff friendliness varied and the restaurant for breakfast was good but the restaurant in the evening wasn't good value for money and service was bad which let the hotel down. I would recommend the hotel but suggest evening meals to eat out.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Tidy hotel with market convenience”
Reviews.Author: patkoaus
Reviews.Content: We had a very good experience at the metropark. We had stayed at the Causeway Bay metropark previously. From our first contact with the hotel by email, we were impressed. E-mails were promptly answered. We were offered a good rate of $6090 HKD for a 7 night long stay package in a club room, which included return airport transfers, breakfast in the lounge or restaurant & evening drinks in the lounge. Check in at the lounge was quick and efficient. The rooms were small but spotlessly clean. We asked for non smoking and there was not a whiff of smoke or any other smell. Our cleaning lady did a great job. We had a twin room which was a little cramped and little space for hanging or drawers and only one bed side chest (the drawer didn't open). My friend had a double which gave her more room. The bathroom was spotless with a good range of amenities. I didn't like the shower over the bath and shower curtain but that is a personal thing. Free internet & 2 bottles of water each day. Nice touch of the chocolates & weather note each night. Slippers and robe. Electronic safe which held the laptop. Breakfast in the restaurant was great with good variety, eggs cooked to order & very fresh fruit. The range in the lounge was not as good. Drinks in the lounge 5.30-7.30 was good, baileys included! Snacks were very limited and not replaced if near the end of the time which was disappointing. We asked for a room with a nice view and unfortunately were allocated one at the back facing a block of flats, we rarely opened our curtains. There is a bank, wellcome supermarket, pharmacy, laundry & two good restaurants across the road. The buses leave here also, the number 7 stops right in front of the star ferry, the shuttle leaves you a fair walk. It stops right in front of the hotel on the return. A couple of doors down to the right is a great dumpling restaurant called overseas dragon, 8 dumplings $20HK. A couple of doors to the left a little restaurant does great BBQ meats, $56HK for a take away container of roast & BBQ pork. Across the road the restaurant NEXT DOOR to the Hoover restaurant has really nice meals, even at 10pm at night. We had laundry done across the road, 7lbs for $28HK. The hotel was within walking distance to ladies market which suited my daughter, we used the shuttle a couple of times. Get there early as it only seats so many. I would prefer to stay closer to the MTR next time, the buses are plentiful but do get caught up in the traffic. The staff at the hotel were pleasant, the lady at the restaurant even knew our room numbers by the last day! I would recommend the hotel to those on a budget, but the Causeway Bay hotel was far superior, but you do pay for it. It is an older hotel, do make sure you ask for a re-furbished room. It was surprisingly quiet seeing it is situated on a very busy road.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Three Star”
Reviews.Author: WillyDoug
Reviews.Content: This hotel represents good value in the 75 us range. For that price you get a older comfortable compact quiet room. The hotel lobby is modern and if you want a remodelled room you will pay about 30 percent more. The breakfast buffet is very good but the Chinese restaurant was overpriced for so-so food. Internet only works in the room if you have a phone jack on your portable which most netbooks lack. Wireless is only available in the lobby. The hotel shulttle to the waterfront and transit works well and is punctual. Good air con but we had to ask for a portable heater when the outside temperature dropped one nite. A good choice for a 3-4 nite stay. Note they close the pool and gym in Jan and Feb. Staff are efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: northerncharm81
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights, got upgraded on check in as was my b/day during stay which was a nice touch. Hotel is about a 40min walk from the main area of Kowloon - ave of stars/ferry ports etc but is easy to find as straight down waterloo road and nathan road - plenty to see on the way. Hotel runs a free shuttle to and from the harbour evey 30minutes until about 11pm which is perfect. Mongkok and the ladies market is about a 5-10min walk around the corner so a pretty good location. Hotel and rooms very clean and spacious, 2 restaurants - an informal buffet style and a formal chinese restaurant. There is also a cake shop, bar with happy hour 4-9pm buy one get one free on all drinks with decent bar snacks and a travel desk where trips/tickets can be booked. There are plenty of shops, 7/11 and banks around the hotel and a metro station round the corner. Buffet breakfast is plentiful with lots of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Just loved everything about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: virtup
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Metropark Kowloon 01 - 08 Jan 2010. The location suited us, we enjoyed the walk to markets, shops and MTR even though the hotel provided a complimentary bus. Our room was big by Hong Kong standards and the room service was quick and efficient, the room always presented with cleanliness and neatness. The complimentary bottles of water was a nice touch and welcomed as we did a lot of walking. Also enjoyed the fruit, the chocolates each evening, the weather forecast and the daily newspaper. The breakfast was as good as we experienced in Singapore, a very good selection, never a problem to get a table no matter what time we turned up. The staff were always cheerful, courteous and helpful. Would recommend a room with breakfast. We are very experienced travellers as I have worked in the airline industry for almost 30 years and a hotel has to be good to impress us and we were definitely impressed, so much so, that we will stay at this hotel again this year, this time with our daughter.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: tearxdropz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amongst the cheaper ones in Hong Kong. It's pretty much like a 3 star hotel in the US. The pool on the roof top was very small. They have a Wii room which was very new. There is just too much to do and see in Hong Kong so staying in a fancy hotel is unnecessary . If you are going there for business and can afford a five stare hotel, go ahead. If you are looking for budget and fun, this would do. The only complaints we have is that they have this annoying loud elevator music blasting in the halls of every floor 24/7. My husband is a deep sleeper and good for him. Unfortunately I'm a light sleeper and it took me quite some time to fall asleep. Oh yea the buffet is not too shabby . If you watch Anthony Bourdain or Andrew Zimmerman, the good food is of course on the streets and not in hotels! The taxi will take you to the airport for 240HKD, make sure you bargain for a lower price! HK is all about bargaining and it's an art that every visitor should learn to do. The hotel is a good 15 minute walk away from the closest rail/subway/tube.. whatever you call the underground train.

Reviews.Title: “Far East Cruise”
Reviews.Author: hannahLincolnshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before we went on cruise and when we came back. Excellent service. Very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ventoris
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in end December. Rooms were good, clean, relatively modern and reasonably sized (by HK standards). It appears to have been recently refurbished. Service was polite and good. Check-ins and out were accomplished very quickly, and the restaurant waitresses spoke decent English and were quite helpful. Breakfast was decent, nothing particularly stand-out, but nowhere near shabby either. You do have to order your eggs though as they do not have an omelet station and it isn't on the buffet bar either. All the essentials were there though the dimsum was certainly not a good example of HK dimsum. Location is a mixed bag. Its located very near Tung Choi St (Ladies Market) and aside from the night market, there are heaps of stores and shops in the area, including a mind-boggling array of restaurants. There is also a 7-11 convenience store like a stone's throw away. Fortunately all the hustle and bustle is within a short stroll, but not near enough to be intrusive in the wee hours of the morning. Public transport wise, it's served by quite a number of buses, but no MTR stations nearby. The nearest Mongkok is a 15 min walk away. To some extent this shortcoming is reduced by the hotel's shuttle bus that goes to the New World Centre in Tsim Sha Tsui where the MTR station is next door. All in, a pleasant stay, and deserves a thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “hotel amenities”
Reviews.Author: wg1Birmingham
Reviews.Content: we found the hotel to be a exellent hotel with close axcess to the city an a good bus sevice to the port the only draw back was the sip sip bar did not open early enough an the happy hours could have been longer.

Reviews.Title: “4-star it is not”
Reviews.Author: lkeats
Reviews.Content: Either someone messed up with the rating or I was duped by my agent! The only good thing about this hotel is its location, which is near to one of the most popular shopping area in Kowloon called Ladies Market. My take on this hotel: Interior decor: old, outdated Room cleanliness / amenities: smelly, dirty, and poorly maintained Employees: rude, unfriendly To Reliance Shipping and Travel Malaysia: Seriously guys, you have to buck up. My family have been traveling with you for the last twenty years and this trip is by far the worst. Everything from the tour manager, to the itenerary, to hotels, to the food, you name it, it is horrible. For a premium travel operator, you are losing your luster. Christopher Lee and KM Goh

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you have the right hotel for Mongkok”
Reviews.Author: 365ucr
Reviews.Content: I based my choice of hotel on location and tried to minimise walking during the evenings. Be aware that there are 2 Metroparks in the Mongkok area. I got it a bit wrong! The Metropark Mongkok is north of the main shopping area close the the Prince Edward MTR and the other one is the Metropark Kowloon with is on Waterloo Rd and quite a walk to the Mongkok MTR. So if you plan on using the MTR much in HK (it's a good idea) then be sure your hotel is close to a station. The hotel itself (Metropark, Kowloon) provided a shuttle service to the shopping area which helped a lot but there was not one back again because the bus was doing a tour all the way to the waterfront before going back to the hotel. Fine if you want to visit the waterfront and get a lift back but not for local shopping. The hotel was OK for a couple of nights but it struck us as a bit dated. The room was small, as we were warned, but was in need of a makeover. No breakfast included and the restaurant was expensive. Lovely diner 2 doors down called Teresa - very Chinesee but good for breakfast or evening meal if you're on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “A fine establishment”
Reviews.Author: nonagon
Reviews.Content: Our good experience with this hotel started a week before we arrived when I asked by e-mail for baby cot. I was replied promptly with a confirmation even though they did not yet received my booking, this is nice. The staff proceeded to be nice and helpful throughout our stay. I booked this hotel because of it's relatively large rooms (at 22sq metre its huge for HK) and bathtub, both crucial for my wife and I for traveling with a baby (1 year old) we were not disappointed - our room on the 8th floor was quiet and spacious enough for everyone to run about. It was actually so nice that things like the lack of storage options or outdated and squeeky furniture were irrelevant. They did offer an upgrade to a refurbished room which we declined, our basic room was just fine. Locationwise it may not be it TST but walking to the nearest MTR was a breeze and it is close to the Ladie's Market - by far our favourite HK market. To compensate for distance to the main drag the free TST shuttle meant you can be enywhere anytime (it also saves money) and in any case - when in HK prepare to walk. After much travelling, this was our first time with a baby, This hotel delivered for us and is a good option for anyone, it is basic well maintained and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “We've already booked again”
Reviews.Author: Sunray98
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful Hotel, the cleanliness was first class, the food was excellent and the staff could not do enough for you, there is a free bus down to the harbour and the last one returns at 11 pm. This hotel is within walking distance to the Lady's Market and Temple Street Markets We have already booked again for May, can't wait. If you have not been to Hong Kong you must go but stay on Kowloon and you can get the Star ferry across to the island. You must get a Octupus card they are cheap and it makes travelling on Trains and Buses simple, some trains run every 3 minutes and Taxis are very cheap and the cleanliness of the whole place would put UK to shame. You should go and if you do make sure you stay in the Metropark Hotel Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: rajiv7860
Reviews.Content: Hotel is conveniently located ,about 15 minutes Cab from Victoria and well connected by Hotel Bus form International airport and with local bus /taxi services at doorstep. Rooms are clean , room service and facilities were quite satisfactory. Hotel has shops and small restuarents / cafes located conveniently in the close vicinity and some ethnic market as well. Internet is of acceptable bandwidth ,while we could not try the Restuarents this time. TV had enough english channels though no Indian channels were available. Overall it was a good stay and value for the tariff.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location to MTR and markets with a great staff and excellent shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: 36Felix
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 days with my daughter and granddaughter and the staff were excellent. The room was a twin bed with an extra bed. The hotel runs a shuttle service to the waterfront via Mong Kok MTR which makes it a fantastic place to stay. Only about a 2 block was from the shuttle stop to the MTR which is great to use if you take advantage of the Octopus card. We ate in the Sip Sip Bar at the hotel and found it to be most reasonable. Staff are extrremely happy to help with any request. They have a small travel desk at the hotel which was of great help also.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad choice in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: helenakitt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is part of the Chinese Metropark group, and having stayed in the Metropark in Xiamen I was a bit disappointed with the size of the room here, but perhaps that's just the way things are in Hong Kong. Otherwise the hotel had been recently refurbished (you sank into the corridor carpet) and was generally a pleasant place to stay. The beds are soft by Chinese standards. Good choice of TV channels inc BBC world. The service was very helpful and friendly; breakfast was very extensive and a good mix of Chinese and Western. The hotel is not in the middle of things but it is in a Chinese residential area so there are plenty of places to eat and shop locally as well as plenty of laundries - I got 2 huge bags done for 36 HKD. There is a shuttle bus which takes you to Mong Kok and TST and runs at least every half an hour. It is walking distance to Mong Kok MTR and the Ladies Market too. The hotel can also arrange an airport shuttle bus for you which is about the same price as the Airport Express train (98HKD) and saves you the trouble of having to carry your luggage anywhere. Internet was available in the hotel - free if you had your own PC or 10HKD for 15 minutes if not - which I think is a bit steep. However Internet cafes were not easy to find although you can use internet free at MTR stations and Pacific Coffee Houses, but it's a bit restricted as to how long for in those places. There's a very nice (heated, if small) pool on the top floor along with a small gym. Make sure you ask for a no smoking floor if you want one because we did not check and ended up on a smoking floor and when someone was smoking next door the smell came into the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stop over venue”
Reviews.Author: Titch87
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel in a good location. Friendly staff, exceptionally clean, great breakfast & good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: curriedyak
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Metropark was great. The room was a little small but it was very clean, comfortable and probably the going size for Hong Kong. The buffet breakfast each morning was delicious with good choices to suit everyone's tastes. Although it is a bit off the main area, the hotel shuttle bus was excellent and frequent so we never felt stranded. Monkok shopping area and markets were within easy walking distance as was Monkok MTR station. All the staff were friendly and helpful and couldn't do enough when one of our companions was sick and needed a doctor. We would most definately stay there again if we go back to Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel and a reasonable price, but don't go for the Porridge at breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Georginal
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because it seemed to be good value at a reasonable price. I wasn't quite clear on quite where Kowloon was in relation to Hong Kong Island. Its a bus trip for most people, but the hotel operates a free bus service, so its no issue, and its quite close to Mong Kok. There is also a Tour Operator Day trips etc) thats based at the Hotel, so getting out and about is easy and safe. I asked for a quiet room, so I got one right at the top - 18th floor lift were working fine so again, no issue for me. Reasonable size rooms for a hotel anywhere in the world, probably better than average bearing in mind its Hong Kong, athough the walls are paper thin and I was right next door to the lifts, so i did hear all my neighbours coming and going. Food choices are fine, altough my choice for breakfast was Porridge- not a good decision as was thin and watery, not at all how you're supposed to make Porridge, but there was a god choice on what was provided and there were other options nearby. Overall I had a pleasant stay, good staff and a clean room (I was getting worried about some of the cockroach stories in some of the cheaper accommodation here), so I think I got my monies worth.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful !!”
Reviews.Author: NutzA
Reviews.Content: The hotel just does not look impressive from the outside....but the minute you step in and into the rooms, u really begin to like it. Had a good Inter-continental breakfast. Try coming in a little early for it or come in around 9.40 to avoid the crowd (Gltich is, the breakfast counter closes at 10). The hotel is well connected and is really a good choice, if you are out for sight seeing, exploring the city, meeting people etc

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel,Fantastic Value and we are going back again.”
Reviews.Author: JimThom
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Metropark for two weeks in November 2008, with another couple who having stayed there in Nov.2007, recommended it to us. Our stay here,in a Club Room, helped to make our visit a truly memorable occasion. We found all the staff members we came into contact with during our stay to be very friendly and extremely helpful. Our breakfasts in the Club Lounge were first class and pleasantly varied.We particularly enjoyed the Congee. Our only other meals taken frequently in the hotel were in the SipSip bar and we both enjoyed all our meals there especially the Fish and Chips ( to die for ) and the Nasi Goreng!! The shuttle bus was a real bonus as was the Airport transfer. Locally we used the Wellcome supermarket ( across the street ) the 7/11 just to your right on leaving the hotel and carrying on a bit further the first laundry on the corner gave an excellent service at a bargain price.The staff in the nearby Watsons Chemist ( to the right ) were very helpful. We found that getting and using the Octupus card was a great tip and we would recomend using the MTR as often as possible { much easier and more friendly than the London Underground } and with stops near every place you are likely to go. I should also mention that we used Theresa's cafe ( Chinese with English menus and food and service that belies the external looks! ) I will say that we are going back to Hong Kong and the Metropark for 28 days,later this year. Our Niece stayed here for 4 days in June 2009 on her way to Australia and as a single female traveller thoroughly enjoyed her stay here. We would really like to thank all the staff of the Metropole for making us so welcome but especially Anita Hung, Raymond ( Catering Manager ) and all the girls in the SipSip Bar particularly Win Win ( Bar Captain ) and Mirra and also our Room Keeper.

Reviews.Title: “No added frills experience. Simple, clean, efficient and accommodative.”
Reviews.Author: TheWindflower
Reviews.Content: From the outside, the Metropark Kowloon doesn't harbour anything interesting. It sinks into the background of Kowloon with the rest of the terraced buildings that seem to mirror each other throughout the area. I found the location to be perfectly adequate for what our purpose of staying in Hong Kong was. I was on a sightseeing holiday and wanted to see as much grain of HK culture as possible and therefore did not mind finding my way around the often perplexing streets of Yau Ma Tei and Kowloon as a whole. Hong Kong Island is easier to find your way around, but if you do not mind referring to your map in the initial stages, the location of the hotel was apt to my preferences. You are close to Mong Kok, and various market streets such as Temple Street, Ladies Market and Jade Street. The groundfloor entrance encompases a simple longue area, and an information desk; staff who will help you out with simple directions and hotel procedures but offers very little else. The interior is modern but inglorified; it will never be a palace but it has a comfortable clean ambience. Attached onto the groundfloor is a bar and further on; a cake shop. On the upper levels, there is an overpriced and rather unfulfilling restaurant (with a very low choice of food), banquet area for functions, and swimming pool and fitness area combined on the 19th floor. Free Wifi is available on the groundfloor only, so do not expect to be able to connect wirelessly to the internet in your room. You have to make your way up a level to the 1st floor to find the check-in/out desk. There are usually a maximum of 4 staff at any one time so being dealt with is pretty zip-zap. Aside from checking in and out, there is a dedicated money exchange point. Whilst using this area to exchange HK$ into smaller denominations is fine, a bank across the road may offer you a better exchange rate for travellers cheques. You may want to take the time to see if you can get a better deal. Staff are helpful enough within reason, but sometimes come across like they are not very interested. I myself know the monotonous repetitive nature of the workplace, but upon recieving help you felt you where interupting their "sighing" time. It was far more stated in the male staff than the female. No real rudeness was emphasized though and anything I queried was resolved painlessly. Upon check-in, I was asked to pay a HK$500 deposit incase we incurred any charges for services whilst in the hotel (eg: room service, adult films, etc) We had been placed in a Standard Room on the 18th floor. The room was very no thrills and lacked any amenities so to speak of. The room consisted of on suite bathroom & twin single beds. There was a small walk in cupboard for a reasonable amount of clothing but only very few clothes hangers. The room consisted of a fridge, television set with a fairly limited amount of channels, alarm clock, and radio (which featured the music currently playing throughout the hotel). There is an ethernet port for wired access to the internet and to my knowledge was free uncapped usage however I had not brought my laptop on the trip so I could not test to see if this was true. Other simple additions were a kettle, a small unimpressive hairdryer and cheap tea and coffee products. Towels in the bathroom are changed upon your request. If you wish to have clean towels, you should place your used towels in the bath and the cleaners will give you some new clean ones. Giving you the choice on whether to have new towels or not is an effort to reduce pollution to the Hong Kong coastline which has partly been a result of the clothing deturgents dumped into the surrounding waters and harbor of Hong Kong. Placed in the room were some very small bottles of alcoholic beverages such as Whiskey, Scotch and several soft drinks placed in the fridge. I am teetotal but we were unsure whether to even touch these as we did not believe that they would be complimentary and would probably eat into our service deposit. Whether this was true or not, we did not find out and at the end of our stay recieved our HK$500 back in full. The hotel staff did provide us with two free bottles of water everday after the staff had cleaned our room. We were in a room at the back end of the hotel so our view was little to behold. It led onto a dainty backstreet overlooking flat accommodation. The beds were not the most comfortable in the world but I have slept in far worse in the past. They are firm but I would imagine for anybody but the most discerning person, are tolerable and you will get a good nights sleep. A little perk is that you can have a choice of pillow made out of different material upon request. This may be useful for anybody who has an intolerance to certain synthetics but I did not have much use for it as my pillow was very comfortable. Inside on the groundfloor and to the left, you will find the Sip Sip Bar which does seem to be quite popular with many of the hotel customers dispite the location of the hotel being in the epicentre of an area with a vast amount of tastes and smells. The hotel doesn't seem enchanting enough personally to warrant spending much time in the bar. There are far cheaper and more atmospheric places to be, none of which are a million miles away. Even on a rainy day I would not give the bar much heed. The bar stayed open till around 11pm The cake shop which is also open to non-hotel customers gives a standard choice of pastries that follow a similar fashion to the abudance of bakeries in the city. Everything I tried in here was delicious but suprisingly given the time of year, there were no mooncakes to be found. (We visited during the Mid-Autumn Festival) I suggest to look around the city if you have a taste for desserts, the selection is vast. The cake shop was open to 8pm. The hotel runs a free shuttle bus that service begins at 8am, and lasts till 10:30pm. We used this service once or twice at the start of our trip to get to the star ferry quickly. It only stops twice; in the centre of Mong Kok and beside the Avenue of Stars at Tsim Sha Tsui. The shuttle bus is convient on an evening also if you fancy an enjoyable evening of dining. There are an infinite amount of good places to eat in Tsim Sha Tsui. If you want to get over to Hong Kong Island quickly and you've already had the joy of using the Star Ferry, opt for using your Octopus Card and using the MTR instead. The location of the hotel is situated on Waterloo Road. This makes it fairly easy to get to places like the central hub of Mong Kok, and is about a 15 minute walk to Nathan Road. Yau Ma Tei station is the closest MTR station to the hotel and will take you the same amount of time to get to as Nathan Road as it is adjacent to it. Along Waterloo Road, there are several Seven Eleven stores (about 2 minutes in between each other) and one or two very cheap diner-esque eateries that cater to quick Cantonese Cuisine. If you just want something quick to eat in the morning for breakfast or a late night bite before you go to bed, then it's a fairly decent area. A little further down you can also find McDonalds for anyone needing an american fast-food fix and is also open 24 hours a day. This is not a luxary hotel and those seeking a relaxing holiday should maybe even bypass Hong Kong all together, it is not a sit back and relax sort of place. This hotel was perfect for it's intention. Hong Kong is not a place to spend your days drindling in the service of hotel staff and for any doing so - I can't help but feel you are wasting your money. This hotel is for sleeping and waking up, and that is pretty much the jist. For those wanting anything else, you will not find it in this hotel. Try the Penninsula if you want to be lavishly waited on, but if you can afford the Pennisula I don't think you'd be considering the Metropark Hotel Kowloon in the first place. Enjoy your time in Hong Kong!

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: arkitekt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of nights en-route to Perth WA. All in all good service but the breakfast buffet was a bit crowded and they were slow to top up items that were missing from the buffet. The in house bar was was pricey so use the seven/eleven down the road to the right if you want bottled water etc. Room was clean, a bit small but had all the usual things you would expect, iron, hair dryer etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good value accomodation.”
Reviews.Author: Uteman50
Reviews.Content: Take the upgrade to the Metropark Club Floor. Bigger room, personalised service, specialised check-in, turn down service, breakfast included and more. Great value hotel for Hong Kong. MTR less than 10 mins walk, (Mongkok, Mongkok East), giving access to Kowloon, Hong Kong Island, and more. Close to the Mongkok Markets, (Goldfish, Ladies, Computer Market etc), and Nathan Road. Good offers in the 'house' restaurants. Would recommend to friends, and will use again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good HongKong Hotel”
Reviews.Author: johnjoewood
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed at the Metro Park Hotel on Waterloo Rd, the service and cleanliness of the hotel was worth its money. Its is cetainly worth while upgrading when you arrive. A courtsy bus is porvided and makes geting about a lot easier. 5Star

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD STAY”
Reviews.Author: MANUQUINE
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights and although the room was small it was clean and all we really needed. The Hotel ran a shuttle bus which we used on numerous occasions and found it very good as would have been a fortune in taxis to and from the harbour front.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: eiko-chan
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my trip in HK. I stayed here during my last 3 nights, and despite the location, i must say i don't regret my stay here at all! Location and transport: It's located at Waterloo Road. The nearest MTR is around 10-15 minutes walk away (according to my friend). But i haven't tried, because the hotel provides free shuttle bus for hotel guests which leaves every half hour to "Fa Yun Road" in Mongkok near Ladies Market, and also to "New World Center" in Tsim Sa Tsui, which makes it really convenient. You can also take a ride back to the hotel from those places. The bus leaves ON THE DOT, so you should not be late even for a minute. I think this is really good because we never have to wait for the bus unless if *we* are late. There are same HK cafes ("char chan teng") nearby. There's one two doors away from the hotel which serves amazing food (I think the name is "Gwong Dong Char Chan Teng"). I love the "Char Siu Egg Sandwich"! Just heavenly! It opens till 12am, so it's ok even if you are hungry at night. There's a 7-11 down the road from the hotel, and opposite is a supermarket ("Well come"). "Mannings" ("Guardian" to Malaysians - a pharmacy) is also within walking distance. There are bus stops in front of the hotel. And i believe there's a free shuttle which takes you to Kowloon station for the "Airport Express". I'm not sure how you can get to the hotel from the airport, as i moved here from another hotel instead. But anyways, the hotel provides shuttle services to and from the airport. It leaves every hour to the airport at HKD98 per person. Reservation is required. Room: The hotel provides two free bottles of water everyday. The room i had is bright, clean and spacious. Good enough for two girls who had done tons of shopping anyways! The toilet is clean (my room has no tub, but i'm ok with it. The shower is strong, and it's easy to control the temperature) with sufficient space. When i say "bright", i meant the windows are large enough that sufficient sunshine can enter and brighten the room without needing artificial lights during the day There's no stuffy "claustrophobic" feeling (since the room is kinda spacious too anyways). At night, i like how the room lights are really bright, which really makes a huge difference from other hotels i've stayed in. If you don't like it, you can always opt to switch off some. My favourite part of the hotel is how you can choose your preferred type of pillow! There is a card by the bed which asks you to call the housekeeping should you want to change them. There's four different types to choose from. I prefer contour pillows, while my friend prefers down-feather pillows, so we requested for them. I had a good night sleep EVERY NIGHT because the bed and pillow (and also the duvet not forgetting) are so comfortable! If not because we had to wake up early, i wouldn't mind sleeping in! Room service is good. We do not have to wait too long whenever we request for the pillows, or weighing machine... etc. As for the staffs, they are really friendly and helpful. I wouldn't mind staying at this hotel again the next time i visit HK. I really enjoyed my stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value,good free bus service.”
Reviews.Author: Merryberry15
Reviews.Content: This was a very good value for money hotel.The breakfast was especially good.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap hotel but nothing else really! Bad location”
Reviews.Author: robertocusato
Reviews.Content: I and my lovely wife stayed at this property for only one night after having tried a hostel in the world-(in)famous Chongking Mansion (a must, really! :D). We were looking for something cheap, and this hotel was quite cheap by HK standards. But that's all. It gave us a US-motel feeling, nothing much. At the time it seemed a big change from the place we stayed at at the "Mansion", but now, thinking about it carefully, well... it wasn't that good at all! The room was big enough for being a standard twin (no doubles available), but it looked very dated and the carpet old. No bad smell or anything else though, and coffee/tea kettle available in room. Also, you get free cable, quite a nice change as well. Bathroom was old and dated, but generally clean. Toiletries and towels were basically non-existent. Internet was quite expensive, as was the spanish (and main) restaurat of the hotel. They offered a free shuttle bus to the Star Ferry, that was nice. Staff in general was nice and helpful, even though not really smiling... The hotel also has a swimming pool on the roof, but it's not big nor particularly attractive. In general, a ok hotel that will fit perfectly for those on a thight budget. In this category, it certainly stands out as a good option, especially given the lack of good value-for-money places in town.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for visiting hong kong”
Reviews.Author: Gilliemay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Metropark for 3 nights en-route to Australia. The hotel is situated in kowloon and is in the middle of the built up area so no real views of any note from the hotel. We were two adults and a child (11years) booked into a standard room. the room had one double bed and although they brought a put up bed by the time this was in the room there wasn't much space to move around. The room was fine for 2 adults but a word of caution if you are travelling with a child. I did complain about this and they showed us another room but it was exactly the same size. I would have paid more to have a bigger room or an upgrade but that didn't seem to be an option. Having said that the hotel was fine the staff were very friendly particularly in the Palm Court Western. We had breakfast each day which was a buffet with lots of choice. The hotel is close to Ladies Market and not far from Mong Kok station which give easy and cheap travel around Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel should be a 4* not a 3*.”
Reviews.Author: RichardWiggett
Reviews.Content: What a nice hotel. staff where really friendly and helpful. The room was a bit small but very very nice. Was more like a 4* hotel than just a 3. They need to re * this. Lol restaurant was stunning. Pool was clean and same as the gym. Free shuttle to the town / harbour area as well as back to the airport. Was a truly great end to our round the world trip.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on for what we wanted!”
Reviews.Author: JHall50
Reviews.Content: Arrived here at the beginning of our honeymoon and wasn't sure what to expect. I knew we wouldn't be getting panoramic views of the harbour, but then we didn't want to be stuck in our room just looking out of the window! What can i say??? Some of the old reviews, people just LOVE to have a moan... stop moaning and enjoy where you are and appreciate it!! Our room was quite small but perfect for a stop over before going onto Bali. We had 3 night in the Metropark and the choices of pillows they give you meant we had brilliant sleep! Ok the staff on the reception desk could have smiled a bit more, but they were polite and helpful as well as efficient! The shuttle bus was a godsend! It was so punctual and took you right down to the harbour where the views will blow you away! We loved Hong Kong and wished we had spent longer there. The Metro park was a brilliant base though as it meant you had to walk a bit further and that meant you explored different things each time you walked back. If you hate walking, go elsewhere, but if you enjoy seeing all the sights that might not be in the guide book, this is the place for you! The hotel also has a FANTASTIC pool on the top floor. It is heated at night time and stays open till 10pm. It is brilliant! Nobody uses it!! We were there in a level 8 typhoon and sadly the pool was closed, but the hotel loaned us some umbrellas and off we went. It is still so warm despite the rain, my husband couldn't understand why I was so upbeat, when normally the slightest hint of rain on my holiday sends me over the edge!! Go to the Metropark for a really great stay, good breakfasts, good location and ENJOY!!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price - interesting location.”
Reviews.Author: KennyM83
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. The hotel is located in a more traditional area of Hong Kong, so don't go expecting it to be too western. However, close proximity to metro lines and taxis were easy to get hold of. The hotel was clean with reasonable facilities and the staff were friendly and helpful where they could be. We paid approximately £30 per night for a standard room and I think this was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Metropark Kowloon formally Metropole Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: michaelquinn4
Reviews.Content: Thankyou Metropark hotel, for a lovely stay in your hotel, this is my forth stay in your hotel over the past 4 year. Your rooms are clean and tidy, the swimming pool attendant lady is very contientious with testing the pool regularly and to attending to the guests needs. Your front desk are very helpfully and knowledgeable regarding Hong Kong. But my most gratitude must go to Eric the deputy manager, who was the perfect host. Once again thankyou Eric and staff at the Metropark for making my stay in your hotel so enjoyable PS As a grumpy middle aged guy, who finds fault everywhere, it was such a surprise in this hotel to be satisfied with all aspects of the hotel. It isnt 5 star, but that reflects on the price. Most inportant thing about a hotel is location, location location. This is perfect for the real Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: dnkholiday
Reviews.Content: Hotel looks impressive on entry and the location isn't too bad with two MTR stations nearby plus free use of a shuttle bus. The room we had was in need of refurbishment and had a whiff of stale smoke about it but was clean and looked after. Had one incident where noise from the next room resulted in a largely sleepless night. Staff were generally helpful. Hotel redeemed to "recommended" only because of free, unlimited internet access in the room otherwise I would suggest to look elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “good hotel shame about the service”
Reviews.Author: nicquie
Reviews.Content: i stayed here from 1st-5th Aug 09! the location is ok not very touristy but all signs and directions are in english and mcdonalds is a 5min walk and MTR is 10-15mins away!!! the hotel is nice clean and modern with free adsl internet in every room with lead provided for laptops!! the staff are rude and unhelpfull do not look happy to be there ha ha ha and the restaurant for the dinner i had was very poor and expensive for what you got not sure i would stay here again because of location and hotel staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gives you a feel of the REAL Hong Kong!”
Reviews.Author: JackNLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my brother in September 2008 for 5 nights and we enjoyed our stay at the Metropark Hotel Kowloon. For the record we did NOT stay on the Club-floor (but in a standard room). Cleanliness: The hotel in general was kept very clean from the entrance to the lobby to the room. Location: Although the hotel is not located centrally on the waterfront, it is a nice 10-15 minute walk to Mong Kok MTR station. On this walk you can see locals of all ages going about their daily lives - something you don't get to see if you stay in a more commercialised, central location. From Mong Kok MTR you can get to all main tourist attractions quickly and cheaply. The hotel is also located very near Nathan Road and the Lady's market. Rooms: The room was a standard size for Hong Kong. The room had enough wardrobe space and enough space to store 2 suitcases and still have some space to move. The bathroom was pretty standard. There were some complimentary toiletries in the bathroom and some tea/coffee sachets in the room. The air-conditioning was fine and easy to control. Service: The reception were pretty polite and very efficient. Value: For a bit more money you can probably get a more central hotel but your room size will be smaller and you certainly won't experience the REAL Hong Kong which millions of people live everyday. General tips: As a tourist be sure to pick-up free leaflets and maps from the HongKongTourismBoard desk in the arrivals part of the airport. You should also purchase a return AirportExpressRailway journey with 3 days unlimited travel on the MTR. This is a special package for tourists. You can load your Octopus card with money when the 3 unlimited days run out so you can use it like the London Oyster Card. The Octopus card can also be used to pay in certain shops like 7-11s and McDonald's etc. Also, when you disembark the AirportExpressRailway you can get the free bus which takes you directly to your hotel (if your hotel is one of the ones listed on the MTR website). For Metropark Hotel Kowloon the K6 picks you up from Kowloon station and drops you at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ticked all the boxes, would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: PhilNorthHertsUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed just as swine flu was gathering pace and all staff were wearing masks. At check in we had our temperature taken! One of the sister hotels had been quaranteed. Hotel was quiet and our room though not over large was adequate with good clean bathroom and large walk in shower, bed was comfortable and air conditioning worked well. We only had the buffet breakfast which was good value and kept us going until the evening. Plenty of restaurants around so we did'nt use that in the hotel. A big plus was the shuttle bus which went every half hour to Tsimshatsui near the star ferry although not that far to walk to Kowloon's shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great value & Good location”
Reviews.Author: DJ_Mizit
Reviews.Content: Comfort Room Great value for money with this room, stayed 2 nights only as stopover going to China. Room was clean and presentable, good for short term stay. I have previously stayed at this hotel with family before and loved it, especially the free shuttle bus that runs every 15 mins, very convenient. Staff Checking in was ok, actually getting out luggage upstairs was another matter. We asked the concierge to bring the luggage straight up the room. After checking in and waiting for 15 mins for the luggage we called the reception desk and they said they will send up immediately. After another 15 mins we decided to go down and get it ourselves. We found the luggage where we had left it, at the concierges desk. Not happy! Location is ok, but with a free shuttle bus running it doesn't matter. Overall very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DebfromCanberraAust
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Metropark Kowloon and I highly recommend it. The rooms are not huge but are well laid oot. Yes yes I thought they were small until I saw a friends room at a hotel on the harbour that was twice as much in cost and 30% smaller!! Space is expensive in Hong Kong - get used to it!! The hotel is close to transport - bus's in particular are great and the MTR station isnt that far away. Close enough to Nathan road to enjoy the sites and shopping and far enough away to avoid the noise. The supermarket across the street was a great bonus (buy up on soft drinks, snacks and water) as were all the laundries along Waterloo road. We could have all of our laundry done for about $6AUS. WHo needs to take home dirty clothes? This alone made packing for our second visit super easy as we didnt take as much - so there was more room for purchases on the way home!! Service in the hotel is friendly and fast. Room rates are cheap by comparison to hotels on the harbour and with heaps more features in the end! The pool was great for 13yo son as was the gym with Wii...sometimes you just want to chill!! Highly recomended.

Reviews.Title: “Got a great deal and was incredibly pleased--clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: whought
Reviews.Content: I managed to get a great deal (kayak.com) and this place was great. The subway system in HK is so amazing that the location doesn't really matter--even though it's not in the middle of the action, it's a 10 min walk to a good area and then a 15 min ride to the heart of the action and it's really cheap, safe, and comfortable transit (the hotel also has free transfers to downtown kowloon). The hotel was very clean and the rooftop pool is a total gem. The staff doesn't know anything so rely on your guide book, not the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the tour operator and do it your own way- cheaper and enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: busylizzy79
Reviews.Content: we recently stayed at this hotel for 5days whilst visting bangkok, australia and fiji and the staff here were unbelieveably rude! we tried to book a number of trips as to make the most out of our trip and found them over priced and the hotel tour operator rude and abrupt. we requested the tours we wished to go on and she told us they were rubbish and to go on the ones that she wanted us to and the couple in front to go on etc etc . Also she would not tell us the method of transport to the tours - dangerous? you had to pay before she told you and it was one way so you had to first your own way back to the hotel!! Also if you buy an OCTOPUS card from the train station and top it up you can use it at restaurant and on public transport- loads cheaper then taxi. it makes it a safer and cheaper way to carry money as you get the deposit back when you have finished your trip!!! Public transpport is safe and easy to follow in this city as its incredibly efficent!!! Makes it more fun doing it on your own, to your own itinerary and choosing where to stay the longest each day!! The hotel is dead at night, one bar is open but the atmosphere is dull and boring!

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: ancient_mariner96
Reviews.Content: The staff were very helpful and the complimentary breakfasts for the period we were there were an unexpected bonus. The Internet connection wasa free as was the excellent 30 minute mini-bus service. We did not eat at the hotel except for breakfast prefering to take in the local eateries. We found that Langham Place in Mong Kok was quite good and was only a pleasant walk from the hotel although the hotel bus route took us close. The Ladies Market is in the same location as Langham Place and made for some happy bargaining. All in all, we enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Consider upgrading to avoid disapointment”
Reviews.Author: KIWICANFLY
Reviews.Content: Many reviews lead me to believe that this hotel was a good option for our short stay in Hong Kong. We selected a standard room and it definetly needed refurbishing! There are better options available with location and room quality. I agree with the review that the hotel is out of the way and in hindsight should have selected a hotel in the heart of Kowloon and sucked up the price difference. Our stay was at the end of a long holiday and we did not have the heart to find the local transport options to get into the shopping areas.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for a few days stay”
Reviews.Author: Westsouth
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. Location - Well away from the main attractions eg the peak, star ferry and harbour. It is quite close to the main markets but it is still involves a good walk and in the heat of the night and day it can seem a long way. Rooms - We stayed in a basic room on the six floor. View from the room is a block of flats and washing hanging out of flat windows. The rooms are clean and enough for a short stay. New tooth brush and tooth paste provided everyday. Food - Would not recommend the breakfast not much choice and not well cooked. I would get breakfast from the many bakeries on the same street as the hotel. Not the bakery in the hotel the bakery further down the street is much cheaper and more selection. Also the Welcome supermarket across the road is good value. Free shuttle is very usefull.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Bombshelle
Reviews.Content: The first disappointment is the actual location of this hotel. Its name suggests it is in the centre of Kowloon however it is not and is much further north . Do not be misled by Kowloon being in its name. I stayed in one of the lower price rooms but was very disappointed. The bathroom was very dated and was not very clena. The room itself was small and the decor was extremely dated. Despite requesting a non smoking room it was clear the room had been used by smokers as all furniture and the curtains smelt of tobacco smoke. Will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for a Hong Kong stopover”
Reviews.Author: ADTHEMAG
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in central Kowloon, the rooms though a little small are well equipped and maintained, all areas are spotlessly clean. The Metropark is only a few minutes walk from the shopping district an markets of Monkok, the markets are quite an experience, espicially at night , with all the neon blazing. I reccomend the crispy fried squid legs at the corner of Dundas St and the " electrical goods" street. The hotel provides a complimentary shuttle bus to/from the Kowloon waterfront every 30 minutes, and will provide transport to / from the airport for 98 HK dollars each way. There are numerous restaurants in the area of the hotel, though if you want western food you may have some difficulty.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: shreevie
Reviews.Content: When booking this hotel, I didn`t realise how big Hong Kong actually is! The hotel isn`t located right in centre of Hong Kong. To get anywhere you had to walk 15 minutes to the nearest MTR station, which for us was Mong Kok. This wasn`t a problem as we started to enjoy our daily walks seeing some interesting sights of Hong Kong along the way. The hotel does has a shuttle bus which drops you off at two locations within Kowloon and this runs every half and hour. The hotel service itself was good. The rooms were a good size and all the staff were helpful. The hotel has a roof top pool which I used when it was raining and also what looked like a mini gym. We were booked in as room only, but the hotel has its own bakery to stock up on breakfast and snacks. The travel agent located in the hotel was very helpful and we organised our day trip to China through them. Overall a good stay and I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: ShashiMumbai
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is Worth the Money Spent and the room are also big enough to Hongkong standard. The Staff is helpful. and Dont forget to use the shettle bus to Mong Kok and Tim Sa Tusi

Reviews.Title: “GOOD QUALITY HOTEL...GOOD SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: JMatthewsWales
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Metropark Kowloon, May this Year [2009] . The hotel is only a 10 min walk from ladies market, which is a must for bargain hunters. The free shuttle bus to the Promenade of Stars and the ferry area is a big bonus. Its reliable and frequent...every 30 mins or so. The food in the hotel was excellent...buffet breakfast, with everything you could wish for. The evening meals were quality food, with an excellent seafood buffet a few times a week for about £20 per head. The bar was expensive at £6 a pint for San Miguel....but at least there was a happy hour [actually four hours] with 2 for the price of one. The lifts were not a problem, reception was good, and the luggage room for late departures was secure . It cost us £30 to retain the room for a late departure.The room itself was on the small side, just big enough for two. Everything was clean and modern.The only problem we had was nothing to do with the hotel itself. We had problems finding a restaurant with menus written in English. Now I know that HK is now in China, but because of the British influence over the years, I expected to encounter more bars and restaurants catering to British tourists...well that was not the case in Kowloon. This proved a problem. The Chinese influence in Kowloon is now almost total. Every menu in Chinese...and not much English spoken either. If this could be a problem to you...you will be better off staying nearer to the sea front, at the bottom area of Nathan road.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: DomingosLao
Reviews.Content: We go there because it is very near to the exam center, the price is fair, because it is in a high season, and they upgrade our room into suit. Very big and clean, the bed is extremely comfortable. Good value!! Location to exam center is perfect, even we can walk to there. There have a bakery shop just next to hotel, 2~3minutes to 7-11, there have free-hotel-shuttle to the heart of mong-kok & Tsim Sha Tsui. But if you take MTR to the hotel, you may need to walk for around 15~20minutes, but if you could walk, it will be fine, it is easy to find the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: PeteD1975
Reviews.Content: Good value hotel in Hong Kong, away from the main sights 10 mins walk from MTR station and local markets. Small rooms but clean and comfortable. When we extended our stay they gave us the rate we had originally paid with an agent rather than the walk i rate.

Reviews.Title: “there are better hotels”
Reviews.Author: F100
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel 6 months before going partly because a friend was staying there and partly for the facilities. The pool and fitness centre was undergoing renovation so was unavailable. I would never have gone there if i'd known this. The location was a problem too, even using the free minibus to tsim tsa tsui left a 15 minute walk to the star ferry. Going out to dinner in HK meant an hour each way minimum. Rooms on club floor were surprisingly small and had no bathtub, decor rather hideous. the club 'lounge' was small and had 10 tables, no sofas. The staff were helpful and pleasant and the snacks/drinks during happy hour were nice. The best thing about the location were the markets and the area of mong kok around the langham place hotel. Very atmospheric at night with plenty of reasonably priced shopping. HK island seemed to be one overpriced shopping mall with top end international brands, There are much nicer hotels with better locations at similar prices. If I go again i will probably stay at the Eaton in Nathan road for the location or possibly at the langham place even though its a bit far out.

Reviews.Title: “its nice”
Reviews.Author: kim0404
Reviews.Content: we stayed here last march 21-24.. the location was nice. friendly adn helpful staff... we bodked for a double bed but wen we got there we got a twin bed instead... though we were transfered the next day to another room with double bed... i wasnt sooo crazy about the hotel.. its so-so.. mmm average.. but i enjoeyd my stay much coz my hubby and i really needed a break.. food was nice..(i hate the ham and cheese sandwich!!!!!) but other than that the breakfast buffet was excellent. laods ot choose from and very delicious(i destroyed my diet!)... room was clean.. the bath room was ok.. the tub was small though hehhehe... but yeha,. staff are friendly and helpful...

Reviews.Title: “Experienced bad customer service here”
Reviews.Author: NXN
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few nights with friends. Close to markets and electronics and sneaker shops (about 10-15 mins walking distance). Free shuttle to and from Tsim Sha Tsui; handy if you want to see the nighly light show by the water front. Shuttle to and from airport is available at a cost of HK$98 although this really should be complimentary. Front desk receptionist was extremely rude even though all we wanted to do was check-out and to know where to go to store our luggage after checking out. Concierge not very helpful as what he told us was misleding and made us think we had missed our shuttle to the airport. Even though we were discussing our alternative options of getting to the aiport right in front of him, he did not correct us to say that we had not missed our shuttle at all. Curtains in our room were dirty with mould spots, really didn't want to touch them. Teacup was also dirty with an old coffee stain where the last person had drank from. Room was spacious enough and rollaway bed was comfy enough to sleep on.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice hotel for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Batangueno
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel based on the number of good reviews it got from fellow travellers - it truly did not disappoint, considering the fact that HK hotels are known to scrimp on space. Booking was a breeze. Even when we initially had problems using our credit card, the reservations officers were courteous enough to communicate on a regular basis to ensure that the reservation will hold. Transport from the airport to the hotel was easily facilitated via a hotel shuttle. The rooms were surprisingly spacious, complete with a small ref, complimentary fruit basket, tea, coffee, sugar, electric kettle, and standard hotel amenities. 2 bottles of water are provided on a daily basis, and chocolates are laid on the table with a good night card. A very refreshing add-on is a choice of pillow, requested from housekeeping. The area is also a welcome change from the chaotic streets of Mongkok, being in a zone with very few shops, few tourists - almost serene in ambiance as compared to the bustling night market areas. Several convenience stores ( Including a 7-11 on every block!), a McDonalds store, bakeshops and nice restaurants surround the hotel- impossible to starve in this place! There are bus stops in front and across the street, and the Mongkok MTR is a few blocks away. A foreign currency exchange shop is located just beside the hotel. I would definitely stay in this very nice hotel again on my next HK trip..truly it made my stay in HK a more pleasant experience, a quiet respite at the end of a full day of chaos in the streets of HK.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for real Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: lofty1943
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights and arrived at abour 8.15 am expecting problems but staff were very good and had the room ready by 9.30 which was really helpful. This hotel is really in the middle of what I would call the real HK, not the glass and concete of Hong Hong Island. You will be in the midst of ordinary folk going about their normal business, and not surrounded by a million other tourists. The hotel is surrouded by what seems hundreds of little shops and cafes with English being a rarity.Our room was good, adequate standard facilities which even included a phone in the bathroom! The view was nothing spectacular as we were on the back of the hotel and overlooked local appartments. Two free bottles of water supplied every day, tea, coffee etc. Useful having a fridge in the room. Handy coffee/sandwich/cake shop attached to the hotel and there is a small gift/tour shop. There is a fantastic free shuttle service from the hotel every half hour down to the harbour/waterfront. We used this several times as it did save about 45min walking if you are prepared to miss out on the sights and sounds of the local area. Hotel pool was closed during our stay but this was made clear before booking. We used the restauant once for self-service breakfast-huge choice and as much as you could ever wish for.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, shame about Mong Kok location.”
Reviews.Author: AliWatford
Reviews.Content: When we initially arrived there was some confusion regarding room allocation. 2 of our party were given smoking rooms and 1 couple were given a twin - not the best start! However, the reception staff sorted it out for us and were very helpful. The hotel was clean and comfortable and the buffet seafood restaurant was nice. The swimming pool and gym area were closed for refurbishment so we couldn't use them, but we were offered a very good deal when booking to compensate. The hotel is the Mong Kok area of Kowloon. I would stay on the Hong Kong Island side next time as it is VERY different.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant enough place to stay”
Reviews.Author: unclejames
Reviews.Content: This is a pleasant enough hotel. My room viewed towards the back of the hotel, so it was nice and quiet; and once I'd worked out how to turn off the air conditioning and stop shivering, it was rather a pleasant place. I used the hotel as literally a bed. Indeed, I didn't see reception, excepting on checking in and checking out. But the (wired) internet worked well; the telly worked (which got BBC World News as the token English-language news channel); and the hotel gave me a few bottles of free water a day, as is fairly standard for this type of thing. The bathroom was nice, if not super-sumptuous, and the bed was comfortable, if not great. The decor is beige and brown - not too modern, not too old. While they'd warned me that the hotel was undergoing renovation - the swimming pool's shut, and two floors up was getting renovated - I didn't notice any noise or dust. And that was the only real experience I had with the staff. You've probably guessed by now that this hotel room was an average experience. It's not a hotel I'd write home about; but it was pleasant enough for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: Jasmine02
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel a couple years ago now, but we loved it so much, I just had to comment on how fantastic this hotel is. Beautiful decor, very friendly staff and great service provided. I will be staying here again on our next trip back to HK. This hotel is located fairly close to the Temple St Night Markets and we walked around Kowloon easily from our hotel. The Sip Sip Bar is awesome. Very friendly staff here, especially a waitress called "Agather".(not sure if I spelt her name right, but either way, she's the best!). We had alot of help from the friendly concierge, and the lady that works at the tourist desk. In a nutshell: The best quality hotel for a great price. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, nice staffs with reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: bangkokpeople
Reviews.Content: I just visited Hong Kong for 3 nights during 6-9 March 2009. I had read many good reviews about this hotel before so I decided to Stay at Metropark Kowloon. Booking through online travel agent, the price is reasonable around 580HKD per night for cheapest room without breakfast. Pro - Room is very clean and spotless. It all look very very new to me. Bed is very comfy, not too hard(according to Hong Kong standard). Extra pillows always there in the wardrobe. There is no bathtub in my room but shower is excellent. -Everything you need is in the room Eg, tooth brush set, shower cap, comb, Coffee and tea set, kettles and jug for hot water. 2 Bottles of water is provide every morning. Towel is clean and new, it will be change everyday but the mate will not take away the used one which I have no idea why. -Staffs on the ground floor are very helpful, they know all info about bus train or places u want to go. Umbrellas is provide for hotel guests when it's raining. Shuttle bus always there in front of hotel, it will leave every 30 mins to Mongkok and Tsim sha Tsui. -Room service is good. When I needed Travel Adapter, I called and asked from room service. Staff brought it within 5 mins -Hotel surrounding with Supermarket and convenient store. Such as wellcome supermarket is opposite, 7-11, K-circle and Manning store is 300 meters from hotel Con -There is no sound prove on the wall, I woke up in the middle of the night because someone nearby close the door too loud. Sometimes I could hear someone next door talking. -Hotel Location is not so close to MTR station. 15 mins by walking to Mongkok MTR. Bus stop is near by but it doesn't go to tourist places. Only 1 bus I saw go to Star ferry. -Food at the Hotel is a bit expensive. Bread at the bakery shop look boring for me. I didn't try any of them. There is Chinese restaurant next to hotel on the left side, I ate roasted duck there. Not very good and too expensive. Over all I really like the hotel. Will definitely choose to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “wished we had more than three nights here”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyer011
Reviews.Content: excellent value, spacious room, friendly staff, a great hotel for Aussie travellers of all ages. staff even prepared a breakfast box on checkout as we had an early flight to london.breakfasts are lovely, catering for all tastes.

Reviews.Title: “Best holiday ever!”
Reviews.Author: nonaglenn
Reviews.Content: 4 of us travelling - first time in HK. Stayed one week. No problems arranging for adjoining/smoking rooms on arrival. Reception staff efficient, friendly and helpful. Rooms spacious and very clean, we wanted for nothing and we were not in 'top of the range' rooms. Swimming pool unavailable/under renovation - Hotel advised us prior to our visit and we could have changed to another hotel but didn't feel we would be desperate for swimming in HK during February. Had breakfast most mornings - tremendous range of food, beautifully presented, no tummy upsets and staff superb! Free Shuttle Bus was brilliant. We really could not fault this hotel and staying here really made for a wonderful Hong Kong holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel at an Affordable Price”
Reviews.Author: SF-Coast-Traveler
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Metropark Kowloon. This was my second stay. The hotel is located in a more residential area of East Mong Kok, but is convenient to Nathan Road, the Ladies Market, and a variety of public transportation that includes numerous buses (with service to Tsim Sha Tsui, Hong Kong Island and beyond, the Star Ferry Terminal (both Tsim Sha Tsui and Hung Hom), and the Hung Hom Railway Station on the East Rail Line), two MTR Stations (Yau Ma Tei and and Mong Kok), and the East Rail Line East Mong Kok Station*. Schedules and locations of bus routes are posted in English and Chinese at each of the bus stops. The East Rail Line goes to the mainland border. In the direction of Tsim Sha Tsui the train stops at the Hung Hom Railway Station where you can take direct trains to Guangzhou, Shanghai, and Beijing. The hotel offers half hourly shuttle bus service to a location near the Mong Kok MTR Station and then continues to the New World Hotel, across from the Peninsula Hotel, which is within 10 minutes walk to the Star Ferry Terminal. The Mong Kok MTR station is closer to the hotel (10-15 minute walk) but the Yau Ma Tei MTR station is much less crowded and is only an additional five minutes walk. To get there, once outside the hotel (and facing the street), walk to your right on Waterloo Road and continue all the way to Nathan Road. Cross to your left and the Yau Ma Tei MTR station is right on the corner. This hotel was previously the Metropol Hotel. I had read that the hotel was recently renovated, including the furnishings in the room. During this most recent stay there was indeed renovation occurring, much to my dismay. Between 11AM and 6PM there was constant jack hammering that could be heard throughout the 19 story hotel which made use of my room during these hours unbearable. That said, hopefully the construction will be very temporary. Check-in by front office staff was quick and efficient, but not necessarily “welcoming”. I didn’t see any smiles on the faces of any of the staff, and not just during check-in but at various times I had contact with front office staff. The staff understood and spoke English without problem. It was a different story with the housekeeping and Palm Court Restaurant staff whom I found all smiles, cordial, and willing to provide whatever service the guest needed. The room was large by Hong Kong standards (closer to the room size you would typically find at a comparable hotel in the U.S.) and was very clean, although the carpet could use a cleaning. The bathroom was also clean and included the typical standard bathroom amenities. The linens were clean and crisp. My room had a mini-bar, mini-refrigerator, and small in-room safe. My room rate included the buffet breakfast offered in the Palm Court Restaurant. The buffet included Asian and Western hot and cold entrees, various cereals, breads, and pastries, salad, fruit, and juices and tea. I found the food to be of good quality and as I mentioned above the staff were quite accommodating and service oriented. Overall, this is a good hotel that offers clean, spacious rooms at an affordable price (typically US$90-130 per night). Even though it is not located in the heart of Kowloon or Hong Kong Island, you can get to these locations within 20-25 minutes (walking + public transit) or even less if you take a taxi which is cheap and dependable. There are neighborhood restaurants in the immediate area along with three laundry businesses (they charge for cleaning by weight – very inexpensive), convenience stores, bakeries, and places to buy toiletries etc. The Langham Place Shopping Center is near the Mong Kok MTR station (on the other side of Nathan Road) and offers a variety of nice shopping, a food court, and upscale restaurants on the top floor. * Directions to the East Mong Kok Station: Exit the hotel, turn right, go to the first street (Soares Ave), turn right and walk to Argyle Street, turn left and walk a few blocks to the overpass (the East Line Railway tracks). Walk up the stairs on the other side of the overpass (immediately to your left) and follow the walkway through the office building and to the station. To get to the Mong Kok MTR, just keep walking past the overpass and continue for five more blocks. You’ll see the MTR entrances on both sides of the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern clean hotel with great friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: happley8may
Reviews.Content: The hotel appearance is very modern and clean, very much like a 5-star hotel. The rooms are great, mid-size with very clean and modern bathrooms (which are a great plus). Most hotels have rooms that are clean and modern and the bathrooms are usually a bit old. But metropark was fabulous. It was truly a very comfortable stay. The location was good for us as it was about a 5minute walk to all the night markets and very good eateries were around the area. It's a bit of a hustle and bustle outside but we prefered this much more so than in the CBD area. We paid 2-3star rates for a 5star hotel! Swimming pool is currently out of service due to renovations. A+

Reviews.Title: “loved my stay”
Reviews.Author: owen083175
Reviews.Content: we are a group of eight (6 adults and 2 kids) and i personally picked the place because it's not a too crowded area for the kids. i booked through agoda and i have no problems with regards to my booking. they have a shuttle bus that runs every 30 mins to Mongkok MTR station and TST. there are many restaurants within the area. Ladies market is just walking distance from the hotel. or you can catch the shuttle bus in going to MOngkok and afterwards walk your way to the hotel (10-15 mins). hotel staff are very accomodating especially when it comes to directions to attractions in hongkong.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: who_me0000
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel for the money. Very nice room and good service. The breakfast buffet is very good, with plenty of asian and western choices. And for some reason, every morning they would give me a coupon for my breakfast. Don't know if you can expect this or not! :) The only warning that I would give is that the hotel is about a ten minute walk from the subway. Not bad once in a while, but when you are doing it several times a day, you start to have to factor it into your plans. They have a free shuttle to the subway station, but it only leaves every half hour. There are buses that stop right in front of the hotel, so if you can figure them out, they help a lot.

Reviews.Title: “excellent rooms. would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: mikool
Reviews.Content: We were initially given a twin room, which was a bit of an annoyance. no apologies-which seemed to be the attitude of the staff in general. that twin room was nice, quite spacious for a hongkong hotel really. interesting thing was it contained a bath and a universal adapter power board with 3 empty slots, lan cable for free internet usage. Next day we changed to the double room. the bed was very large, king i think, and the room obviously had had a renovation-on the third floor. the carpet/paint was all fresh. the tv was a flat screen compared to the previous night's old ray tube tv. reception was better on it too. mood of this room was much nicer and still spacious-more romantic. unfortunately, no bath in this room and no multi power adapter as in the other room. Gym was a couple of aerobic machines with your classic treadmill, interesting thing was the inclusion of the wii fit! and pool was quite large. there's a lifeguard on constant duty there too.
