On arrival to the hotel, first imressions were good. puzzled at the role of the bell boys who watched me lug our bags past them chatting...maybe they were tired! overall the hotel is great. would stay there again. only complaint is the attitude of some staff, except the maids, they were always so nice even with no tips.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Mandapanz
Reviews.Content: Was very impressed by this hotel. It was only a short walk from the centre and main street, but far enough away that it made for pleasant stay. Did not eat in the hotel, but that was only because there were so many eateries to choose from. Great wee supermarket across the road for any basics you want and launderette and chemist also. Did not really know what to expect as have never been to China before but would definately go back again, and stay here. Only complaint was they web-site said the pool would be closed for maintenance and it wasn't, but it did look nice when we went up for a look.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel if your in non smoking!”
Reviews.Author: imlivid
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Metropark on 26th and 27th December. The hotel is in a good location about a 5-10 minute walk to the MTR station and there are plenty of markets within walking distance. I booked a non smoking room but was given a smoking room. They did not have a non smoking room until the 2nd night. The difference in the room was incredible. Not only the smell!! Much nicer decoration and ambiance. That was the only reason I give this review a 3 and not a 4. Bear in mind to be sure you have a non smoking room (if your not a smoker of course!)

Reviews.Title: “Very good service, good location”
Reviews.Author: canaryCanada
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days and 3 nights in HongKong at Metropark, Kowloon hotel. The location of hotel is very convenient, about 10 minutes walk to Mongkok MTR, and lady market. The service was very good, staff were very helpful. We had large and heavy luggage, but they brought to our room and to shuttle bus with please. Even we called the service desk around 4:00 am for the plug to charge our camcorder, the staff brought it to our room in just a minute. The hotel provided excellent shuttle bus service to various closed by MTRs and shopping centers. My flight to was 8:40 PM, even we check out at 1:30, the hotel provided luggage storage free of charge from the time we checked out to the time we were ready to go to airport for our flight. It was a relief for us, otherwise we had to be at the airport with our heavy luggage and doing nothing. Definitely, I would come back if I visit HK again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: rajivgupta
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our family holiday staying in Metropark Kowloon from 27-12-2008 to 02-01-2009. Our stay was great and got the best hospitality by the hotel which we booked after reading the various reviews about the Hotels in HK through Tripadvisor. Our got quick checkin at 1 AM. Mr. Kimmy Kwok the reservation mananger & Ms. Cathy Tin helped me providing 1 day more stay, than our booking as my daughter got ill in our trip, even they inquire by visiting us. They arranged a great New Year party at the Lobby. We got our spacious plus room @ 750 HKD which I feel a great bargain price for such a nice located hotel in this peak season. One can exchage their money to HKD from a dealer loacted just under the hotel to have a better rate. Hotel's local shuttle is great to be used. I love to visit this hotel in my next trip to HK.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vitz6
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Our reservation was upgraded when we told them we were on our honeymoon so result! Hotel has excellent airport transfer service making that part of your trip stress-free. Room was great and well maintained. Breakfast was heavy! (incl dim sums, fried rice etc!) Hotel has fantastic regular shuttle service that'll take you to the city centre and other stops as you wish. Hotel also offers good tours of Hong Kong. Would stay there again if we did return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel good price”
Reviews.Author: frankcurious
Reviews.Content: A lot of good reviews about the hotel here. And I agree with most. It is clean, good service and reasonably sized for Asia. The location is pretty good. The fact that it is a 10 min walk to the MTR is mitigated by the free shuttle to New World Centre at Tsim Sha Tsui. From there you can walk to the ferry for HK, or just check out TST. Also note the 113 bus stops on the same block as the hotel, and takes you to Hong Kong. It is cheaper than the MTR but might take longer during rush hour. Also when you are walking along the HK side, check out the bus stops for 113, because it takes you right to the hotel. Sometimes it takes a lot of walking to get to the MTR. Some of this info is provided by the back of the hotel's shuttle schedule. Read it. The shuttle from the airport is great. Though the HK transportation system is very good, the shuttle is just less hassles. When you are on the HK side, you can take the 6, 6A, 66, 120, or 6X bus to Stanley Market. It is worth going. Besides some better quality cheap goods, you can see a more natural side of HK. The main bus station is located outside the IFC Mall under a building called the Forum Exchange. Finally,visit the tourist areas like the Buddha, Ocean Park, Disneyland and Stanley Market for the weekday. The locals also visit these areas during the weekend, and unless you like endless lineup (in sweltering heat in the summer), then you should be in the stores on the weekends. At least it is air conditioned. And yes, I would go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You'd feel that they are doing their best to satisfy, they're great!”
Reviews.Author: smarttravellerhere
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on price and location. At the front desk I was attended by Alex, he is good and attended to all of my requests. I was surprised that he upgraded me to the Club floor which I later found out only when I got out of the elevator. Club floor cost more but I didnt pay any more than what I booked for. Thanks Alex! This hotel is great, it may be quite a walk from Nathan Road but there are interesting shops to see on the way. When I booked on-line, i got a good deal for a minimum of 3 days stay. On-line, I was hesitant to get the room with breakfast included so I finished the booking without the breakfast, however when I finally got there and saw what they offered on the breakfast buffet at the palm restaurant for only HK$90 per person (with the discount coupon given upon getting the room number at the reception) I got hooked and ate there with the rest of the family. One thing I noticed about the breakfast though is that the taste is very fitting for the asian taste, I would understand if an american or european wouldnt appreciate it that much. Although, it offered breads, pastries, yoghurts, fruits and cereals. It also has the staple local breakfast which is the congee (porridge). I suggest that you check it out first and do not automatically include on your on-line room booking. Everyday, they would give a weather card informing you of the condition tomorrow with 2 mini Andes chocolate bars with it (attached picture). Upon checking in at the room, the housekeeping personnel gave us a welcome fruit platter (orange, 2 pears, and apple). The bathroom is quite big for the HK standard and is complete with toothbrush, toothpaste, comb, sewing kit, cotton balls, ear cotton buds, shampoo, soap, foam bath, shave, sanitary bag, shower cap, hair dryer (attached picture) The room has a wide flat screen TV, 2 free bottled water everyday, electric boiling kettle, ref, and they give newspaper daily. The carpet's design is off for my taste but that didnt bother me that much really. You could change your pillows from a range of choices for free (attached picture) If you need to buy any groceries (water, cola, etc) there is a Wellcome convenient store (like a 7-11) just in front of the hotel. At Wellcome, you could buy a lot, it even has a sushi section and chinese food section to go at grocery prices. Here is where I also load up for my Octupus card. I noticed that Wellcome has same items which are cheaper than 7-11's. There is also a 7-11 store one and two blocks away. Both are accepting Octupus card payments. The hotel offers free shuttle bus to Mongkok, Tsim Sha Tsui and back to hotel which is very convenient. If you want to eat chinese, outside the hotel there are restaurants offering inexpensive authentic chinese food. With just minutes of walking from the hotel, you are already at the famous ladies market Lounging at the pool is great while the kids play at the Nintendo Wii for free. Oh bytheway, never forget to get an octupus card at the airport if you want to take the MTR, tram, ferry, and buses, load up high since you could redeem what's left when you return the card at the airport anyway (although they deduct HK$7 from what is left) My tips to your trip to HK: a) get an octupus card and never forget to return back for you to receive your deposit. b) consider not taking the peak tram on a holiday/special day as the line may be very long. What is appalling is that the long single line diverge to a wider line which makes people get unruly in converging again to a narrow line. Pushing and shoving happened while I was carrying my infant daughter. An alternative is to just take the bus # 15 which goes directly up to the peak (terminus of bus #15 is located beside the bus #15C at the Central Ferry Terminus ) c) just take a taxi to and from the airport if you are a group of four, it is cheaper and more convenient. Although if you are really on a tight budget, from the airport, take citybus A21 and get off at mongkok at nathan road, then take a cab to the hotel. d) At the airport, if your gate is 40 and above, it takes about 15++minutes from the immigration, e) when you go to the victoria bay where you see the walk of the stars, stay away from those fortune tellers that will try to fool you for money. On the last day, I wanted to book thier hotel shuttle bus with our now huge bags to the airport for convenience. The manager who attended to me advised me that the price of HK$110 is the same rate for both adults and children and proceed in advising me that as an alternative, I could just opt for a taxi which actually costed me for only HK$230 (for the 4 of us on the taxi, that is equal to HK$57.50 for each) He even managed to call a taxi for us upon seeing us go down upon cheching out. Overall one would feel that the staff really does their best effort to provide the best service. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CheshireHolidaymaker
Reviews.Content: We recently staayed at the metropark and found it to be excellent in all areas,Staff very helpful very user friendly rooms immaculate and food in the restaurantts of a very high order. Curtesy bus was used on a number of occasions and always left on time and driver was most helpful.All in all an excellent stay and i would cetrtauinly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: housepartymusic
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my family comprising my wife and 2 children for 5 days and 4 nights in Hong Kong. I decided to book this hotel after doing some researches on the internet. I booked through the hotel website which gave a good package for staying 3 nights and above. The location of the hotel is very convenient. When i arrived at the airport, we took the Airport Express to the Kowloon station. There was a free shuttle bus provided by the Airport Express to the hotel. We took the same shuttle bus and train for our departure as well. Daily there are half hourly free shuttle buses provided by the hotel to Kowloon and the harbour areas. We took some of those for our trips. Mostly we travelled by MTR of which the nearest is the Mongkok East station which is about 10 minutes walk away from the hotel. We had no problem walking to the station even late at night. My children did not have problem walking that distance. We found some decent eateries nearby the hotel which open till quite late. We had some breakfasts and suppers there. The room we had was of decent size. We took a spacious comfort room for our 4 night package and added an extra bed for no extra cost. The beds were firm and nice. We were given a newly renovated room on the 4th floor and everything was new. This is a good value for money hotel located in a convenient area. There are of course better located and nicer hotel but the cost is higher. I think I will stay there again if I travel to Hong Kong for holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back”
Reviews.Author: elleteeVictoria
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at the Metropark Kowloon Hotel in 12months. Mong Kok is a great area to stay in and the hotel is within 10 minutes of the markets and Nathan Road. Shuttle bus takes you to the mtr and tst. We have been to Hong Kong 14 times in the last 20 years and have always stayed at different hotels. The Metropark is the first that we have stayed at more than once. Already planning our next trip and we will come back to the Metropark. The staff were lovely and checkin and checkout only took 5minutes both times.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Mongkok”
Reviews.Author: honeybee28Perth
Reviews.Content: Booked Metropark Kowloon through expedia and got a club room at 50% off. The room was really nice. Quite spacious for Hongkong. The only negative was the bed. It was rock hard!! We didnt ask about changing rooms as thought all the beds would be the same, however when speaking to some other guests they said the bed they had was very comfortable? The location was great - Absolutely loved all the hussel and bussel of Mongkok. The hotel also provides a free shuttle service to other areas, which leaves every 10-15mins. Breakfast was included in our deal - and it was a buffet which had everything you could possibly imagine. Overall this was a nice, clean hotel and I couldnt have asked for more (well except for a different bed).

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Electricean
Reviews.Content: Used this hotel as my base for a 10 day stay. Very clean and comfortable. All staff encountered were polite and efficient. Free shuttle busses available to the MTR and shopping areas, I decided to walk, and only 10mins to Yau Mai Tai station, and approx 30 mins to Star Ferry. Breakfast buffet good with wide selection, hotels own chinese bakery very enticing too. All in all pleased with the service and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “face lift looks great, i'll be back”
Reviews.Author: diggergeorge
Reviews.Content: Stayed here whilst on a business trip to Hong Kong and China. During october 2008. Stayed here years ago and it was all a bit run down. Now it really does represent good value for money with many rooms now being refurbished. The rooms aren't large but the n again none are in HK. I actually checked out whilst I visited China and the conciege were good enough to look after my large suitcase until I checked back in 6 days later. No charge for the internet either. The location on Waterloo road is handy for shopping in Mong Kok with the ladies market and Fa Yuen St just round the corner. There are a couple of banks just across the road so dead easy to change money. Exchange rates are always better in HK and the banks have the best. There are many bus routes running past the hotel and the MTR is just a 15 minute walk down Waterloo road towards Nathan road @ Yau Mei Tei. Don't forget to get your Octopus card at the airport (Airport Express) it will save you messing around with money for fares and you can surrender it on your way out and get unused money back!. Didn't bother with the hotel breakfast as I prefer to visit the Chinese bakeries. There are couple in the area and they have the most amazing buns both sweet and savoury. Teresa's coffee shop is just next door and thats also very good, its full of locals so thats a good testament.

Reviews.Title: “Kowloon Hotel ideal location .”
Reviews.Author: galileex
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was ideal for a break in Hong Kong. Its plus points were the Shuttle bus which goes back and forward to the harbour and is every 30 mins or so. If there were not a lot people at the stop the driver would give a bit extra time to allow for others to come. It has a rooftop pool which was spotless and staffed by very helpfull people. The hotel bar was ideal and had a happy hour. The bedrooms were a very good size, clean and well layed out. The breakfast was plentiful with a lot of choice. All in all we had no problems with our stay and the friendly staff were pleased to be of assistance when asked. Furthermore a great stay for the money.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK.”
Reviews.Author: SW-ENGLAND
Reviews.Content: Hotel was OK, nothing special. Staff are really efficient, helpful & friendly. Rooms were average and clean. The hotel was quite a way into Kowloon on a busy road. There were no restaurants nearby, although we did try one of the local cafe type place and had a really nice and very cheap meal. We found the MTR station was about 10mins walk away. The hotel did provide a courtesey bus which would drop off at the MTR station and then go down to the waterfront where most of the restaurants were. We cannot comment on the restaurant as we did not try it, but we did spend time in the bar in the evening and did have a meal which was good. The bar was quite small and could only seat about 50 people. If I was to go back to Hong Kong I would choose a different hotel, probably on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Well priced hotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Oofie46
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, not the best location but 5 mins walk to Mong Kok train station. Cant complain about anything about it.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value”
Reviews.Author: jcmt
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights out and return from Oz. For the money £43 pn it was pretty good. Recently refurbished room, smallish (maybe v small for Americans) but adequate room well equipped and helpful staff, especially the concierge. The buffet breakfast was ample and the main restaurant not bad. As for location, it is obviously not as convenient as those down by the ferry, but was in a residential district which gave a one an idea of real HK. The shuttle bus is Ok but sometimes full and drops you off 5-10 mins walk from the ferry. Better take the No 7 bus from the stop bang opposite the hotel for about 35 pence which goes right to the ferry. With taxis so cheap and plentiful, it is not a problem being a little way from the Metro/markets/airport bus etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: tayser
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights here - I splurged and got a club floor room, which would have been just slightly more than a regular room in TST or Central. The location was great for my purposes. I don't necessarily like being right in the centre of it all, as I like a morning walk to start my day, especially in another city. The Mong Kok East MTR (former KCR) line is very close by, a plus since I was coming from and returning to Shenzhen, it is a bit of a walk to Argyle or Mong Kok MTR metro stations and Nathan Road, but a night market is in between. Frequent buses to Star Ferry (and the fare is cheap) are available, as I just got an Octopus card and didn't bother with the hotel shuttle. The hotel staff were very friendly, and the service was great (I was able to check in early, and check out late without penalty, and they came around with a fruit plate almost as soon as I settled in after arrival), while I was there for three nights, I had breakfast only twice, and afternoon cocktail once, as I was so busy seeing the city. The afternoon drinks were a nice touch, and the included breakfast is a step up from the common continental breakfast, with some traditional Cantonese-style breakfast foods as well. The rooms (I had a standard club floor room) were comfortable and newly renovated, the view, facing onto Waterloo, decent. The bed was reasonably firm, but not hard, unlike the hotel I stayed at in Dalian. Just watch the taxes, and be mindful of the 10% service charge that comes with the rooms in HK, and that made the bill a little higher than I though. Otherwise, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “You can find better”
Reviews.Author: transit_tales
Reviews.Content: It's very small, even by HK standards. You can do better. The view is depressing. Location has two advantages - airport bus stops at the hotel BUT it is a 15mins walk to the bus-stop to get to the airport. It is close to the markets and the train station. I think Eaton Hotel is better for the price, but a longer walk to the train station. It's cleaner, brighter. Keep looking. Metropark is just not good enough for the price. All the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good Location, Great Free Transportation Options!”
Reviews.Author: coraclara
Reviews.Content: I Finished an extensive adventure through Mainland China as a single Mom traveller with my 7 year old daughter by staying at this hotel and flying back to Canada from Hong Kong! It was certainly one of the BIG highlights of our journey, and a great finish to our time in Asia! I had originally booked only 4 days in Hong Kong, but after having enough of mainland China, I tagged on an extra 2 days (so arriving 2 days sooner than expected). I was worried because I had booked the other 4 days months in advance, but just booked the extra two days on the beginning the night before when were making our decision to leave China. I didn't want to have to change rooms two days into our time in Hong Kong, or have any hassles. This is where the excellent customer service came in. We arrived at the hotel, approached the concierege, and were greeted pleasantly and found out that they had merged my two reservations and put us in a great room for our 6/7 days with them on the 18th floor (room 1828 was great). One floor down from the swimming pool which I knew my daughter would want to use often to soothe her legs from all of the walking. The room was a good size, with plasma TV, queensize bed (and VERY comfortable at that), table and 2 chairs, clean bathroom, good air-conditioning. Really good accomodation for the price. I heard NO noise day or night when in our room. The hotel provided free shuttles on the half hour to Monkok or The New World Shopping Centre at Victoria Harbour - which was within walking distance to The Hong Kong Space Museum, Hong Kong Art Gallery, Star Ferry Terminal at Victoria Harbour, Hard Rock Cafe, etc. Location of this hotel was also within walking distance to Monkok Subway station (10-15 minutes), Goldfish Market, Flower Street, Bird Market, Ladies Market (all very interesting places to see). Also, the hotel was a block from a 7-11 convenience store for stocking up on beer, coolers, milk, juice, snacks, etc. Although, we do not do fixed " tours", this hotel did have quite an option of tours to choose from, and if you are interested, you could also buy your Ocean Park or Disneyland tickets from the hotel. We didn't eat at the restaurants in the hotel, we are more for going out and eating local food. But they looked okay. If you leave the hotel, turn right, there was a great local restaurant with really good, food (I had a vegetarian stirfry with noodles to die for!!) Also lots of bakeries and fruit stands within a couple of blocks. Lastly, there is a free Wi-Fi area in the ground floor, and 1st floor if you have a wireless device that you need to use. All in all, a very friendly, and efficient hotel with a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: newbietraveller03
Reviews.Content: The place was betten than my expectations... the check in and the check out was really fast... the rooms are clean and big compare to other hotels. We stayed in the renew floor and it was very comfortable, there is not in safe in the renew floor but they offered us a safety box downstair. The only bad thing is that it is a bit far away from MTR station, about 15 minutes walk, but you can always take the taxi, which is cheap and safety. I would definetely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stuffedolives
Reviews.Content: 2 adults and a teenger stayed Aug 08. Booked a triple room which had 3 single beds which was ok for 3 days (Any longer and it would have been a bit cramped). We were on 19th floor which was great for the pool and had a view out onto the main street. The main road was quite noisy but it did not affect my sleep. The pool was fairly small but big enough to have a decent swim in and there was a small gym with running machines and a nintendo wii that were free to use. (You cannot smoke by the pool which meant you had to get dressed and go back to your room if you wanted a cigarette) Towels were provided for you. There were plenty of sunloungers and they were never all occupied while we were there. There was piped music everywhere, in the lifts, corridors and by the pool but it was easy to tune it out. Breakfast was good with plenty of choices an as it was buffet style you could eat as much as you wanted. The hotel was a good central base, plenty of taxis and airport express bus to train station stopped outside. Not far from Ladies Market or Mogkok East MTR station. Small resturant next door (Tereas) served fab food at cheap prices but closes at 10pm so we only got there on our last night. Plenty to see and do in HK and travel is so cheap and easy. Would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Hammering noise”
Reviews.Author: Blackcuilin
Reviews.Content: We returned yesterday from 2 weeks stay at the Metropark Kowloon. I feel I must share our experience to keep everyone fully informed of the current status at this hotel. We booked our holday via Thomson holidays here in the UK. Just before we left on holiday Thomson sent a second class letter to us telling us to expect "construction noise". I phoned Thomson however, they said no power tools would be used - I also E mailed the hotel direct , they told me to expect "Hammering noise" between 1100am and 6pm and that power toold would be used!. Thomson really did not want to help and comunication with them so close to our departure was extremly difficult. Thomson offered me no change of hotel or cancelation option without significant cost to ourselves. Finally, I was moved to a higher floor number 16, but only after hours on the phone and sending a registered letter of travel under protest. Furthermore when our family arrived at the hotel before we checked in, the guy ahead of us at reception, was complaining about noise and wantng a different room ! Anybody travelling to this hotel should be aware to expect pneumatic drilling noise from 0900am till after 8pm in the evening - forget about the times the hotel say work will happen between. WE DID REGISTER SEVERAL COMLAINTS WITH THE HOTEL, BUT THE SAME NOISE PROBLEMS KEPT RE-OCCURING, THIS NOISE CAN BE HEARD THROUGHOUT THE WHOLE HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dudleythecat
Reviews.Content: We booked our stopover stay to between UK and New Zealand 2 nights both ways. I booked direct with the hotel which was very straightforward with quick responses when organising airport transport and additional kids bed. Compared to other hotels this hotel is very very good value. OK it''s a little away from Star Ferry etc but this is easily overcome with either the free shuttle bus, MTR or taxi which cost about £2 each way (we never experienced any taxi rips offs at all). Yes, the decor is a little tired, but it's really clean and ALL the staff were friendly and efficient. I'm struggling to see any fault in any of the staff attitute. Room service was good with decent food off the limited menu. Breakfast was a real mixture of all sorts to cater for the variety of cultures that stay. The rooftop swimming pool was just great. Always a member of staff on duty with towels and a great place to cool down after a day plodding around the City. We loved Hong Kong and would certainly stay here again. This is a great good value hotel that puts many UK hotels to shame. We will stay again. Some advice. Don't bother with the airport shuttle buses, they cost a fortune and take ages to get to the hotels. Better to just buy a 2 way Airport Express ticket at the airport. This is a great service which is clean, quick ,cheap.and safe with helpful members of staff everywhere. A taxi to the hotel with cost under £5. We did this when returning home and wished we'd done it each time. A piece of cake even with a grumpy 6 year old!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Inspection”
Reviews.Author: meowmel
Reviews.Content: Location Mongkok area The hotel operates a free shuttle to the shopping are in Mongkok (specialize in sport shoes) that leaves every half hour Rooms All rooms have complimentary bottled water and free internet Superior: very basic, dated décor, shower over bath Spacious Comfort: slightly bigger than the superior Club rooms: Modern décor, still quite small. Club lounge was renovated Oct 07 free breakfast and evening drinks 6 Disabled Rooms available Comments/Recommendations This hotel was a looking a bit dated in the rooms but had a very grand lobby and entrance way. A unique feature was a Wii centre in the gym/pool area which we did not see anywhere else The Sip Sip Bar has a great special buy 1 drink get 1 free between 4-9pm which we Kiwi’s were quite impressed with They have a Chinese restaurant that was refurbished in Oct 2007 and the Palm Court Restaurant which serves a rang of food and has an all day buffet

Reviews.Title: “Awful stay - with bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: BJP_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Was booked in here by a travel agent after previous stays in the Causeway Bay branch had been fine. The stay was terrible - internet access was dodgy, I was put in a smoking room despite being a non-smoker, the food was average (stay way from the omelettes) and the room shabby. It was a 15 minute walk from the MTR which is not fun in summer and local restaurants were non-existent. Day four I found bed-bugs in my bed. I would never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy construction, rude staff, bad food”
Reviews.Author: KristinCarlson
Reviews.Content: This was booked by our client for a 3-week business stay in Kowloon. The location was nice for us, being more a a neighborhood area but still walkable to Mongkok Station. There was also free internet in the rooms, which was very nice. The rooftop pool was nice as well, although fairly full of noisy overweight foreign tourists. The staff we came into contact with over the entire 3 weeks (bellboy, front desk, room service, swimming pool, bakery, etc) were all extremely rude, with the exception of one female lifeguard who was very friendly. The first room we were given was a standard room, which had 50's-esque old carpeting, bedspread, and bathroom. It felt like a roadside motel, not in a good way. Additionally, construction noise of jackhammers, saws, etc, permeated the entire hotel beginning at 9am sharp every single day including weekends. This was at a deafening level. Our work hours outside the hotel were noon to 9pm, so being there in the morning trying to rest or shower or take care of emails and phone calls was not at all pleasant or even tolerable. Our client was not informed of the construction when she booked the hotel, so they moved us to a "club" room to make up for the noise. The club room was a few floors higher, but we could still hear the construction noise quite a lot. However, the bathroom was a lot nicer, and the other amenities were quite a bit nicer as well than in the standard room. The club floor rooms are supposed to come with breakfast, but upon attending the breakfast we were asked our room number, then refused and told that since we were a longterm stay we would not get breakfast. The client called about this issue as well, and we were granted breakfast afterall. This was still a bit of a misfortune as the food was less than desirable, and reminded me of the chewy/mealy/day-old or more breakfast items at touristy London hotels. As compensation for all this, the hotel offered us $30 USD in laundry. We were able to get about 5 pairs of underwear and one pair of pants cleaned for this price. Down the street, we dropped off 28 pounds of laundry at Good Luck Laundry and had everything back and folded and delivered that night for $14. One night, I brushed my teeth and got ready for bed. My husband went into the bathroom 5 minutes later to do the same only to find there was no water. A few minutes after that, a note was slid under our door telling us that there was no water in the hotel until further notice. The next morning, there was another note saying that breakfast would not be held on the club floor and that the internet room and happy hour room would be closed as well until further notice. Then, my room key also stopped working. I took it to the front desk, who were rude and put-out about remagnetizing it. The key still did not work. I took it back, they remagnetized again, I went back up to the 16th floor again, it still did not work. I took it back to the front desk and still had to spend several minutes insisting on being given a new key while they tried to remagnetize it yet a third time. We had to leave a card in the light switch in order to turn the lights on- a good way to remember to turn the lights off. We started leaving a business card in the light switch instead, and pulling it out to lay on top of the controller when we left the room. Housekeeping left the lights on almost all day every day we had them come in once the card was placed there. You must also have housekeeping come any day you want to receive your 2 bottles of free water per day since the water at the hotel is undrinkable. A few nights, we didn't get off work until well after most restaurants close at 11pm and were exhausted. Room service. The person answering the phone generally had trouble understanding our order and was unfriendly about this, even though the menu was in English and most of the other staff were very capable with English. It seems a bit wrong that this poor staff member was the one assigned to phone duty for what were likely to be English-speaking room service customers. It would take about 45 minutes to receive a grilled cheese or spaghetti. The food was very processed and not fresh tasting. Bread seemed stale, like at the breakfast. It reminded us of lower end airplane food. I do suspect the root of the problem is with management rather than the staff, as the staff all seemed pretty unhappy with their lot. I'm sure the decisions about noise, etc, were also being made by that same management. We left the hotel for a few nights to go out of Hong Kong and came back one night before our final leaving to the airport. Again, the front desk was quite rude and short with us upon checkin. However, when we got to the room, there was a basket containing a semi-old orange, banana, and apple with a letter asking us to join their frequent travelers' club. We did not choose to join, and hope to either meet a friendlier new staff and management, a new cook, and be told ahead of time if there will be construction noise... or stay elsewhere our next time in Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “good experience”
Reviews.Author: chalkyEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights. The Staff were helpful and the room was very clean and comfortable, upgraded at no extra cost and not requested. The free mini bus service was very useful and punctual. Breakfast was good and the only disappointment was the meal we had 1 evening in the resturant. We would certainly be happy to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Londonstevo
Reviews.Content: Although we booked through a travel agent, when we arrived we were give the opportunity to upgrade to the Exec floor for £80 for the week. This entiltes you to free breakfast in the club room on the 17th floor, free cocktail hour and free internet access as well as an Exec bedroom. Well worth the extra. Excellent location just outside mongkok but quiet enough as well. ground floor bar has happy hour from 6pm-9pm which makes the drinks ok, otherwise the hotel bar is quite expensive. Roof top pool is well worth a visit especially in thirty five degree heat!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: Natesta
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, I can't say this enough, I highly recommend this place. Previous to arrival we were told of an excellent service, if you buy an octopus card from the airport you can take the Airport Express to the Kowloon station, then hop on the free K6 bus that takes you right to the front of the hotel, excellent service and very easy. We arrived on an early flight 5am and feared that we would be in for a long wait as the usualy check in time for most hotels is 2pm. We walked up to the counter and were told that there was not a room ready, but there could be in 2 hours. Not bad at all, we left our bags in a secure location then headed across the street to the Royal restaraunt and had a really, really good Dim Sum. When we returned, our room was ready and we went right up stairs (we had a club room, which includes a good free buffet breakfast, free drinks/food from 5:30pm-730pm and free use of the computers for internet.) The bed is... firm, but I'm under the impression that most places in Hong Kong have that problem. You get used to it. I'm a bit mystified at people complaining that the rooms are cold, there is a climate control switch right in the room which lets you put the temprature to anything you like. Just use that! The location of the hotel is great, close to the Ladies market (5 minute walk) and the Mong Kok station (10 minute walk) There is a free shuttle service that takes you there as well, but come on... it's a short walk, and you get to experience the city. It's an easy walk too! The staff have been great, strange that they've been beat up upon previously. I've had lots of help, and they have been more than happy to provide it. Seriously, for the cost and the fact that Kowloon is a really cool area to have as your base, you cannot go wrong with this hotel. Clean, great service and a good location.

Reviews.Title: “The upgraded room”
Reviews.Author: susi08
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel room in January but when I came to stay in July 2008 they were renovating levels 3-7. So they gave me an upgraded room on level 15. It was a nicer room. The buffet breakfast (Asian and Western food) was great. The people in the restaurant, the concierge, and the assistant manager were nice and helpful. The free shuttle bus to Mongkok and Tsim Sha Tsui (and back to the hotel) was great. It was every half hour, from 8am to 11pm.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the Metropark Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: teelee
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Hong Kong & after lots of reading on this sight we settled on this hotel. We booked it through our travel agent, but then we e-mailed the hotel direct to get an upgrade to the club floor. I'm so glad we did- the price was reasonable for the upgrade andd the room, breakfast included and the happy hour in the afternoon made it totally worth it. The breakfast was great- had all the things an American buffet breakfast should have, I love watermelon! But the staff were quite surly. The happy hour was great too- it included hot and cold snacks as well as beer and wine, and we got to socialise with some great people. Also internet was free in a room off the club lounge. The room itself was large with plenty of toiletries in the bathroom and was very clean. Only complaint I had was the bed was as hard as they say! But I never got a sore back or anything from it so maybe hard beds are really good for you! The shuttle solved the problems of being away from the central shopping/nightlife, but we didn't mind the short walk to Mongkok each day to the ladies market and shopping etc. And we once walked back from TST back to the hotel which wasn't too bad as we were exploring anyway. The bakery down stairs had lovely curry buns which my Husband kept buying for snacks. Overall we loved staying here, and if we go back to Hong Kong again, we'll book in here.

Reviews.Title: “value but unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: daytrippa07
Reviews.Content: A large hotel in run down part of city. We found like other reviewers that the room was cold with very firm beds, desk staff unfriendly, restaurant overpriced with poor service, and outlook shabby. On plus side: rates were better than many, the pool was great, shuttle bus was very useful, and overall efficiency was good.

Reviews.Title: “nice staff”
Reviews.Author: ronny2x4
Reviews.Content: Metropark kowloon is a clean business hotel with friendly staff. We booked a club room on the 16th floor. The package included breakfast and an afternoon drink in the clublounge. We can recommend this for all future travelers. The outside noice is zero and we had quite a nice view. But who cares the view, Hong Kong is a city waiting to be explored. We took breakfast in the reastaurant on the first floor and it was great. Enough choice and the friendly staff again. We advise the hotel shuttleservice from and to the airport. We took from the airport to the hotel bus 21A and stepped off on Nathan Road. From here it's quite a walk to the hotel with your heavy suitcases. The hotelbus drives you all day to the centre of Monkok and Tsim Tsa Tsui for free. These locations are great startingpoints for shopping, dining. From the Pier you can take the starferry or the metro (do not follow the signs "Subway") to hongkong island.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money- Loved the Executive Room”
Reviews.Author: Nyc_1977
Reviews.Content: I booked and stayed in an executive room after reading the various reviews posted by previous traveller...and quite frankly i was quite satisfied with the room allocated...( on the 17th floor )...room was quite large - though the storage was quite limited- room was very clean. Executive club lounge was very good : complimentary buffet breakfast and complimentary evenings snacks. The executive lounge has also an internet corner which you can use free of charge...Each morning daily South china paper is delivered to your door... We used many times the hotel shuttle service which is quite handy - although the hotel is located less than 15mns walk to Mongkok MTR station where you can find the Langham Place huge shopping centre, Fa Yuen street (= sports shops) and the famous Lady's market.... The staff in executive lounge and the hotel were polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “BETTER than expected...!”
Reviews.Author: fazzy63
Reviews.Content: my friend and I stayed here for 9 nights after booking through a student based travel agency. for the price we paid, we really wern't sure wat to expect, and the mixed reviews on the site didnt help either. we were both surprised by the hotel, the interior, the helpful staff, and our room, as well as the bathroom and overall cleanliness. the hotel's location is perfect, as it isn't on nathan road, but only a 10 minute walk. the hotel offers a first come first served shuttle bus every 3omins, which drops you off outside one of the mtr entrances (which you could walk to in 10minutes) and about a 10 minute walk from the avenue of the stars, and the pier, where you get the boat over to causeway bay. the hotel has switches for "do no disturb" to put on at night, and a "make our room" switch for when we went out. the hotel offers free wifi and an ethernet cable is provided in every room in the pull out drawer underneath the mirror. if you havent got your laptop or wifi device with you, the hotel will offer 15 minutes of internet usage for $15 and then a dollar per minute thereafter. however, it is fair to say that the staff arent overly picky and we only ever paid $15 despite using the internet foralmost 30-40 minutes at a time. our room on the 6th floor did not have a safe, which was slighlty inconvenient but it really wasn't that big of a problem. there is a small closet with about 10 or so hangers provided along with the usual slippers and cleaning mits etc. the fridge/minibar is for personal use also, so we just used to put drinking water and milk from the welcome opposite or the 7eleven just on the corner. (just a quick heads up, you need to put youre used towels in the bath tub if you need them replacing with fresh ones) the top floor is dedicated to a small gym (two treadmills and a cross trainer and some freeweights) and the best bit of all, the nintendo wii, WITH TWO CONTROLLERS :) i was quie surprised to see no one hogging the wii although May is supposed to be a quiet time according to the locals. either way we wernt complaining. the pool is also alot bgger than we thought, it is true that you can do lengths. overall, the hotel is deffinitley worth staying in and i would recommend it to sudents aswell as couples, who we saw a lot of whilst hanging out near the roof top pool. planning on going back in september and i have no reason not to want to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: moonrakerSwindon
Reviews.Content: Just back from Metropark Kowloon. We had a room on the club floors which meant we had a few extras included in the price. These included free drinks in the Club lounge, a selection of hot and cold snacks ( sandwiches, samosas, spring rolls, cakes, nuts), free use of the internet, complimentary newspaper. The location was a 10 minute walk from the MTR but there was also a free shuttle bus to Mong Kok station and down to Tsim Sha Tsui. Chocolates and a weather forecast for the next day left by your bedside. Given that the cost was extremely reasonable compared to other hotels I was very impressed with the service. The room was a decent size, large flat screen TV with some English channels. Some great local eateries where we could not believe the prices. Range of dishes with rice and noodles and a few beers bill for four people around £15. To the dismay of two of our party there were no tablecloths or wine but they made up for this in other restaurants before we came home. Hong Kong brilliant, Metropark, Kowloon , Great.

Reviews.Title: “Only for sleep overs !!”
Reviews.Author: suntop80
Reviews.Content: Location: a bit of distance to the nearest MTR station, around 10-15 minutes walk, in summer it would be too much for me. Clean: the hall ways to the rooms were dirty and smelly and you would give a double digit number to the age of the walls and carpits, on the other hand the rooms are much more taken care of, no smell, clean bed sheets, good bathroom. size of room: the smallest i ever experianced in HK over all, it did it for me since i was only there for 6 hour sleep, but for sure i will not go there if i am staying in HK for more than 1 day.

Reviews.Title: “Poor atitude of duty manager”
Reviews.Author: Froggggie
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for two separate 4 night periods. Had booked my stay via their own company email months ago. We had no problems with first stay period, however on return from trip to Bangkok, found our triple occupancy room had been given away to others by duty manager "Eric", who himself needs a refresher course in customer service. Felt his atitude was very poor. His overiding aim was to do his job fast but with no consideration for customers. Finally allocated a room with 2 beds and had to wait 20 minutes for a rollaway bed. This arrived but the mattress was so uncomfortable that it needed to be changed. The next rollaway had a blood stained mattress protector which if we hadn't complained, they would have laid sheets on and tried to pass its stain away. Management tried to pass over this problem by giving us free breakfast, however this was not worth the money. By enlarge the worst food I've seen for a long time. The room was much smaller than that of first stay and not worth the money especially for the money I paid expecting a slightly bigger room which we needed as it was for 3 adults. The hotel itself is about 15 minutes walk from mongkok, the shuttle was very punctual and takes about 45min cycle through hotel, mongkok , tsim tsai tsui and then hotel. The airport express shuttle "K6" was a excellent way to get to the hotel and airport and the stop is right outside the hotel. Allowed us to check in at Kowloon airport express station and reduce lugging luggage ourselves to the airport. Hong Kong is full of great places to visit and great food, so forget paying for breakfast, take the shuttle to mongkok where food is cheaper, tastier and very varied.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: MagicianManchesterUK
Reviews.Content: What a great find ! Hong Kong hotels are expensive and have small rooms so when we arrived at The Metropark Kowloon and checked into our Club Room we were pleasantly surprised. The room was large by Hong Kong standards with a double bed, 2 bedside tables, desk, fridge, large flat screen TV armchair and there was still enough room for 2 big suitcases to lie opne on the floor. The room wasn't giant but plenty big enough, and I guess you could say that it was massive by Hong Kong standards. The bathroom was large but with no bath, however, the shower cubicle was more than double size and if you prefer showers as we do then it could be condisered a bonus. The room was newly decorated and looked great with all expected amenties. The hotel website was the cheapest site I could find on the net for the Metropark with rooms only costing £50 GBP /night for a standard room so we upgraded to a Club Room for £25 GBP extra per night. This gave us a high room floor, complimentary breakfast and free drinks and snacks in the Club lounge between 5-7pm. The snacks consisted of sandwishes etc, but the bar was fully stocked with premium brands all free!! Breakfast was great. An extensive buffet that all tasted great. The location of the hotel was OK, but not fantastic. About 5 min walk from Nathan Rd, but once on Nathan Rd you found yourself quite far along away from the Harbour. The MTR train station was about 7min walk , with The Peninsula Hotel/ Avenue of The Stars/ Water front a brisk 30min walk. Don't let these walking times put you off though as taxis pull in to the hotel pick up zone and are very cheap - about £5 GBP to the water front. When you compare the price of this hotel and find that it was easily half that of its competitors and then rate the service and comfort provided you would be hard pushed to beat it for overall performance. If you are coming to Hong Kong and don't have an endless budget you have got to try this great Hotel - I can't recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Gypsey_7
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel after a long journey (Cape Town, Jhb and then Hong Kong) so we were pretty exhausted when we checked in. Upon checking in we were told that our room was not ready but that it would be ready within an hour. We accepted that and decided to walk around for that hr to pass the time. We came back to be told that the room was still not ready. We then told them that they said it would be ready, and to this they said that they had found a room to give to us. Our luggage was taken to the room to be found that two very single beds was given to us. I asked the staff member that why had we been given two single beds when we had booked a double. He said that this was one of the better rooms. I then took this up with Erik Mak (the Manager on duty) at the time to be told that it had not been booked as a double. I didnt want to argue at the time as I didnt have the paperwork in front of me. I then went to the room and found all the correspondence that proved that a double had been booked. He then said that the hotel was fully booked. I told him that this hotel had been booked long in advance and we should have been told that this was not available. He also told me that the communication that he received via the international agents did not say anything about a double room. I asked him to show me this email to which he did. It definately did not state a double room but the confirmation from Thompsons Travel definately stated a double room. I then said that he should have checked upon us checking in, whether we wanted single beds seeing that we were a couple. We only go away once a year and this to us is like another honeymoon. Under no circumstances could two people sleep in that single beds. They were genuinely single beds and nothing more. I received a letter of apology from the hotel once getting back to SA but that did not alter the fact that our holiday was spoiled by this arrangement. The hotel itself was clean, breakfast was OKAY. Enough fruit to eat if you didnt want anything else, but the lack of English by the staff was bad. If you wanted them to bring you a fried egg, you had to FIND a staff member that actually understood you. The room could do with a bit more dolling up. At least a duvet to pretty the bed up. The hotel as other people have stated is very cold - the airconditioning seems to be set at a very cold temperature. Tours via the agent at the Hotel was very expensive so we actually got an itinerary and did all of the tours on our own. Worked out cheaper and we could stay at the places for whatever time period we wanted to. My boyfriend used the gym but two of the equipment was not working. Would I stay at this hotel again - no (due to the fact in which the complaint was handled). We took no photos of the hotel, as what you see from the travellers it is no different.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we had found this hotel years ago!”
Reviews.Author: cat666
Reviews.Content: We are frequent travelers to Hong Kong and have been there at least 12 times before. This time we were in Hong Kong for three nights on a stopover. We usually stay at the YMCA Salisbury, but wanted a slightly bigger room for a comparable price. The Metropark Kowloon has much larger rooms than the average hotel in Kowloon (and for this price). We stayed on the 18th floor, and although the furnishings were a bit on the tired side, everything was clean and comfortable. We liked that the hotel was not right in the centre of TST, where all the tourists usually like to hang. I don't understand all the comments about the hotel being out of the way, with the MTR and buses being so quick, efficient, and air-conditioned, it really wasn't all that difficult getting around. We never took the complimentary hotel shuttle. Instead, we took the 7 and 271 bus to TST whenever we wanted to get the ferry to the Island. We were quite happy to eat and explore around the neighbourhood as well. You get a copy of the South China Morning Post every morning. I cannot comment on the restaurants, gym, nor swimming pool, as we didn't use them. All the staff were professional and pleasant. The only niggle was that on the last night, we could hear our neighbours talking quite loudly. I don't know if this is because the walls are thin, or the people next door were extra shouty. Still, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Metropark ------------ Its OK!”
Reviews.Author: CelticFire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Metropark for 2 days at the beginning of April and 2 Days at the end. Got to say that the room for the first stay was infinately better than the second (4th Floor as opposed to 6th). Having said that the Hotel is rather grander in interior decor than I expected. Check in-out was very efficient and most staff were very pleasant. Didn't use the Restaurants or bars. Teresa's cafe gets lots of accolades, but gotta say - not too my taste, very grubby. Nearby in Langham Place Mall there are eateries in the top floor which have a great selection of foods- much preferred that. Alternatively get the shuttle and eat in Tsim Sha Tsui. Shuttle (free) goes every 30 mins via Mongkok and drops you off at the New World Centre (TST East) This is a boon as without it it is a bit of a distance out. TV in room good selection. Good Price and definately value for money. The 2nd room was a bit shabbier, but even that didin't bother us. Overall would stay here again but dont book this if you think you're going to be in the centre of the action or overlooking the Harbour.

Reviews.Title: “What a hotel”
Reviews.Author: cbetterton
Reviews.Content: Its difficult..Especially for people who are looking for a hotel in hong kong. After all the mixed views of the metropark it confuses people, as it did for me before i went. was very skeptical before arriving at the metropark becuase of the different opinions and the terrible images of the hotel on many websites that just give a totally false impression of this hotel and make it look like faulty towers. This hotel is clean, Tidy, Professional. When you arrive, there is a bellboy who takes your cases up to your room for you, which is a nice touch. The rooms themselves, are very big for hong kong, considering alot of hotels are known for their cramped rooms. The room included free broadband internet access which was unlimited. This means that staying in touch with family and friends was a piece of cake. They even had a pillow menu, where you could choose the type of pillow that you prefered. The showers in this room were also so lovely, it was like having a back massage every morning for free! The Metropark catered very well as far as food goes. There was a continental buffet breakfast every morning which proved good value and excellent choice. For evenings there was again, the buffet or for a more formal evening, a traditional chinese restaurant called House of tang. The Metropark also had a great gym with a Nintendo Wii and a very deep swimming pool with sun loungers round it so you could at least get a bit of a tan whilst on top of the roof!! All in all, a must, for great value for money, and an unforgettable experience at the Metropark Kowloon As far as location goes...It may be away from the center of kowloon (tsim tsa tsu) but was no problem. A 2 minute taxi drive to the Yau MA Tei MTR station costing only 15HKG was easy and only a few stops on the MTR and you were in the heart of it all!

Reviews.Title: “Neat Budget Hotel in Great Shopping Area”
Reviews.Author: cheekysydney
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I holidayed in Hong Kong last february 2007 , we had the most fantastic time . This hotel is located a bit of walk from Nathan Road probably 10mins or so but theres a lot of little local shops that you can look at on the way to the main shops. You never know you might just pick up a bargain. My daughter has a shoe fettish so everytime we went shopping she bought heaps of shoes and the staff at the hotel would even line them up neatly for her in the morning. Mong Kok is close by with tonnes of malls with hundreds of bargains especially for women. Reception staff were very curteous and helpful with directions etc Perfect hotel if you dont want to be near the noise but still close to the action!

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints!”
Reviews.Author: hklover
Reviews.Content: I am very satisfied with this hotel. The people were professional and courteous, even the bell boys spokesome English. It's easily reached by no. 7 bus, which stops right in front of the hotel from Tsim Sha Tsui, Star Ferry . Yau Ma Tei metro is 15 mins away by walking. Hotel shuttle bus takes you to Mong Kok metro stop, which takes you all the way across the harbor to Central. Its near the Ladies Market, Jade Market and the Night Market. I received free South China Morning Post every morning. The room has a small frig; although it has some drinks which you have to pay for ( if you used them) it has some room for drinks that you purchased yourself. The hotel is near many eateries..bakeries, noodle shops, 711, McDonald is five mins away on the right. No need to buy their buffet breakfast. My room was on the eight floor. It was clean, spacious and quiet. The bed and the pillows were comfortable. The only thingt that bordered me was the room was cold, and you were supposed to keep the AC on at all times (which I turn off, anyway). If you take the hotel shuffle bus from the airport , be sure to email the hotel first and ask for the price of the trip and take a copy with you....the guy at the airport hotel bus shuffle counter wants HKD 130 one way per passenger . Luckily, I had the hotel email that says it's HKD 95! After I showed the email, he gave my daughter and I HKD 180 for two persons! A great hotel...I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: kate21London
Reviews.Content: We stayed here between 28th March and 4th Apri, for the price I paid I was very impressed with the room. We had a normal comfort room and it was a reasonable size (although the bed was a bit short and my 6ft boyfriend had his feet sticking out the end of the end). The shower was one of the best we've had in a hotel. The room was clean and conceirge was very helpful. I reccomend getting the shuttle bus from the airport to the hotel. Wa sno hassle you just go to the stand at the airport and it only cost $95hk each. Which for the ease of it was great value. We used the free shuttle bus at least once a day and we always got on. All in all very impressed and would definatly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Espada
Reviews.Content: OK so last year I said to myself that I have seen all that I need to see in Hong Kong, so thats why I went there again this year. My 1st choice of hotel had to be for the forth time, the Metropark in Kowloon. Located on Waterloo road, excellently located for the majority of my stay as I prefer Kowloon. If you feel that Tsimshatsui is a little too far to walk they provide a free shuttle service from 8am to 11pm from the hotel, to the New World Centre, Salisbury rd, via Mongkok. A short walk to the Star ferry. After a 12 hour flight + the regular delays in th UK I am confident that I will be greated by polite and helpful staff and again they did not disappoint. The room, I cannot expand on the photographs that are on the hotels and this web site. Size wise more than adequate, comfortable and clean. More importantly the shower was clean with no scale, the air conditioning vents dust free and the bathroom area had a slight chemical / cleaner scent, all indicating they are maintained. Trust me these are more important to your enjoyment of Hong Kong than the wrong decor. They provide an excellent balance of location, services and cost not equalled in the UK. I would not hesitate to recommend. Thank you to all of the staff at the Metropark Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: mrsweston2b
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights as part of our honeymoon in Asia. The hotel was booked through our travel agent and it was the only 3 star hotel we booked for our holiday - all others were 4 or 5 star so I supose my inital reaction was dissapointment but I only had myself to blame and this was in comparison to the other hotels we stayed at which would be unfair to compare. The hotel was in a good location and we used the shuttle quite a lot which was really useful. The rooms were really spacious for Hong Kong standards and very comfortable. The staff weren't exactly friendly but very efficient. The breakfast was very basic and not really to my liking. The pool was quite small but we spent most of our time exploring the city so had no need for it. We loved the Nintendo Wii in the gym though! All in all I thought this was a very good base in Hong Kong and we would stay here again as it was very good value for money. Hong Kong was an amazing city and a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good City Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Drschrebling
Reviews.Content: A good functional hotel, with decent enough rooms and facilities. Good Points: - Location is actually in the Mong-kok part of Kowloon, which is a bit of a distance to the tip of the pennisula / Hong Kong island. However the hotel offer a free twice hourly bus to the tip and taxis are cheap. However this does mean you are actually in real Hong Kong, near all the street markets, local restaurants and shops, which is great for the nightlife. - All the facilities are ok and there is a roof-top pool, which is a bit of a hidden gem, with a great view. - Rooms are a good size and are well kitted out Negatives: - Restaurants in the hotel are expensive, and not that exciting - much better to travel around for food - As I mentioned earlier, there is little to love about the hotel, no character, but to some people that's not too important - The bus to the centre of Hong Kong can become full, meaning you have to wait quite a while for transport (much better to walk into the centre!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough! Be prepared to walk...”
Reviews.Author: foodgalore
Reviews.Content: large hotel with 2 restaurants, rooftop pool and a fitness room. Room was a good size, clean and comfortable. You can change your pillow( 4 types to choose from) definitely helped improve my sleep. Bed was a little on the hard side. Room was cold - staff sent up a heater promptly when asked and we had to have the heater on all the time to keep the room tempaerature on the warmer side. Complimentary tea/coffe and water which was replinished everyday. Generally staff were courteous ( had one experience when one staff member brough us extra towels whilst chatting on his mobile phone; concierge services were hit & miss.) All requests were promptly responded to. wake up calls were on time. The hotel is in mongkok...walkable distance to temple's market and the shopping district. The hotel is about 15 minutes walk from the nearest MTR ( underground). There is a shuttle bus (about half hourly) that drops you off both at mongkok and to near the harbour. The time it takes depend on the traffic and in the morning, I found walking to the MTR quicker. The walk is interesting...lots of shops/food places around.... The hotel buffet- on the pricey side but large choice and tasty. Also had dinner at the hotel once - hotel prices (still good value compared to UK prices) and again nice food. Hotel bakery- not impressed.Try the local bakery just near the hotel. Rooftop pool - small but pretty..though views are pretty much of buildings. Chose this hotel as it was the best deal and all considering, it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Trvlor
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week while on a business trip. Main reason for booking this hotel was its close proximity to my office. But, I was really impressed with just about everything here....the price, level of service, room comfort, etc. If available, spend a bit extra for a Club Level room--extra amenities and very quiet floors. The only reason I would not stay here again is just to experience other hotels in Hong Kong---this is simply a GREAT hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ozJOHNau
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a week, was nice place . very comfy and nice rooms. Its location compared to other hotels in Hong Kong is a bit far away ( its 10 min walk to Nathan Road) All tours operate from here so it doesnt matter!. Great Hotel and good Price!! Local Bus accross the road as well as a Welcome Supermarket. There is a 7-11 and Circle K with in a short walk A good Pick! John

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: MeandmyBoysVancouver
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, with our 2 kids, aged 3 years, and 8 months, stayed for 10 days over Christmas 2007. We stayed on the Kowoon side to be closer to my husband's family, but I really enjoyed staying away from the tourist traps and being able to get a feel for how people live here. I did a lot of research and found that this hotel was about half the price of comparable 3 star hotels in the area. Ultimately, that was the clincher (along with the good reviews I read here). My thoughts about the hotel: Hotel was off the beaten path, but the walk to Mong Kok was only 15 minutes (even with 2 small children), and there was a lot of interesting stuff to see along the way. We did that walk at least twice a day. The free shuttle to Mong Kok and Tsim Sha Tsui is nice too but it does take a little while. We would usually just walk. The staff was very helpful, including providing a crib for us. The room was OK-sized. The beds were a little small, but we managed, and I think it's pretty much the norm in HK. I booked with the hotel directly by email (they were very helpful), and our price included 2 free trips to & from the airport. Nice bonus! Also, the rooms have fridges. If you decide to stay here, here are some tips: If you have to do laundry, do not use the hotel laundry! It is very expensive. There is a laundry just across the street that will do a big bag of laundry for about HK$50 or so. Cheap! And they will deliver it to the concierge at the hotel when it's finished. There is a grocery store across the street. And a great little restaurant less than a block towards Mong Kok (on the same side) where you can get a full Chinese breakfast (noodles in soup, eggs, ham, and toast) for about HK$22. The staff were all very nice (just don't use the toilet). And some general things: Buy an Octopus card (you can do this at the airport). I only speak english and found no trouble getting around HK. If you are traveling with small children, HK is not the most stroller-friendly place. But we took a small umbrella stroller with us, and apart from carrying the stroller up and down stairs and over the turnsdials, we got around all right. I would take the stroller again. This was my first time to HK and I would return, for sure! I would stay at this hotel again too.

Reviews.Title: “Our Hotel of Choice”
Reviews.Author: chubby_chummy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Metropark Kowloon for just over 2 weeks. Was there with a group of friends and we occupied 4 rooms. While not everything was perfect...our wardrobe holder actually fell off...but after 2 weeks at the hotel, we were not any worse than when we checked in. In fact, we went home feeling good and our stay was an extremely pleasant one. We liked the size of room which compared to even some 4-5 stars hotel was spacious. While the rooms we had were old, but it is definitely not as run down as some other reviewers have put it. The hotel actually has newly renovated rooms but they are reserved for those staying at Metro Club..wich was fine with us since they pay a pricer rate. For a 3-4 star hotel...i have no complains at all. If I would really want to state any disatisfaction...i would say only 2 things: 1) Reception upon check-in, not once but twice made the mistake of not knowing our room rates and calculated wrongly. Despite trying to explain to the gentleman on duty on the day my friends checked-in, he refused to believe it and the tone of voice suggested that we didn't know how to count the number of nights we were staying. Finally convinced him to count together and when he realised he was in the wrong, it would have helped with a tiny apology but none was forthcoming 2) Concierge service was not exactly helpful. They were friendly and always had a smile, but somehow it did not register to them that when they see hotel guests carrying multiple items, they should offer hlep. We would have been most happy to give them tips But let me reiterate that the above were minor misgivings and the experience that we had far overides the above One last thing..it was a cold winter in HK but we slept comfortably every night coz we had a heater in the room. Yup, just give housekeeping a call and you'll have the heater in your room in no time....

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: nicko1London
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel,couldn't ask for anymore..efficent service,rooms clean and decent size. Location great as its close to all the markets that we may otherwise not have been seen.. A great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Old and small”
Reviews.Author: humuhumupukapuka
Reviews.Content: Booked with HRS.com and when I arrived they could not find my reservation. I showed them my printed confirmation and after 20 minutes of looking through the computer and going to the back office, they said they still said they could do nothing for me. I raised my voice a bit in front of some other guests and finally they gave me the room that I reserved. When I got to my room, I wished I had kept quiet and went to another hotel. The rooms are TINY and OLD. The space between furnishings are like two feet apart and it seems like everything is crammed in there. The TV is old and started to make a humming noise after a few minutes which was annoying. The air vents were DUSTY. The lighting in the room made it feel dark. The bathroom was kinda moldy. The only pro is the location to Mongkok. Being about 5 minutes walking distance to the popular shopping place (sporting goods, electronics, ladies market) . But then again it is also far away from Hong Kong Harbor, Island, and TST. I wish I stayed at the YMCA.

Reviews.Title: “Good price!”
Reviews.Author: verena_amber
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel via the hotel's reservations web-page for a double room from Jan 26-30, 2008. For the rates that we paid, I felt it was pretty reasonable (approximately HKD2,700 for 4 nights, inclusive of taxes). The hotel can arrange for airport transfer too, priced at HKD190 per person per way, which was quite helpful as it takes approximately 10-15 minutes to walk from the nearest MTR station (either Yau Ma Tei or Mong Kok station). For HK hotels, I feel that the room size was generally ok, and the bed was comfortable with clean bed sheets. The good thing about this hotel is that there are different types of pillows available so we requested for down pillows to keep warm. The bad point was that as it was winter in HK and temperatures could dip below 10 at night, there was no heater in the room, therefore the room was too cold at night. The room and toilet were clean, with basic amenities like tea & coffee, hot water flask, etc. However, I found that the front desk receptionist was not too friendly. Although he responded to questions we had to find out more information on travelling to Macau, we had to keep prompting for the information required, and the staff seemed too eager to get rid of us and wore a hostile look on his face. A tip for hotel guests: learn to take the bus instead, as Bus No. 271 (and other services) takes one from Tsim Sha Tsui right to the hotel's doorstep. It's definitely a much more convenient way to reach the hotel instead of MTR after a tired day of shopping.

Reviews.Title: “a pleasant stay at a very fair price”
Reviews.Author: icklesmeg
Reviews.Content: i stayed at metropark during christmas 2007 and booked it early to get a good price. one thing i did before I booked was check thoroughly and researched as much as i can about this hotel and i came across tripadvisor. I got my answer here and people gave it good reviews. I was worried about it being in mongkok which is... sort of... well known for being quite dodgy. but worry not because metropark is a very pleasant hotel in a good location on a very very safe and normal street. I was greeted by the doorman and the bell boy offered to carry my luggage. The rooms were tidy and the bathroom was clean. I found my room too cold due to the automatic airconditioning system on exiting the room (pulling the card-key out), so i phoned for assistance. within 10 minutes someone came to my room to provide me with a heater fan. They even put my beds together to make it easier for 3 people to sleep. there are some people who talk about the "sars" incident. but don't let that be a deterrent because it's unfair and unlucky that sars struck so randomly in this hotel. Metropark and Hong Kong has been revamped and are very hygiene conscious because of it. Sars hasn't appeared in hk again so fear not. The pool area was lovely and they even had a wii console in the gym. The gym was small but people don't go to hk to exercise in thier hotels they travel around to soak in the culture. Location-wise it was a bit far from main attractions but that is what I was looking for anyway cos it was nice a quiet to sleep. Whereas hotels on main streets tend to be so noisy and frustrating. There is a free bus shuttle service from the entrance which takes you round Mongkok down to tsim tsa tsui but i warn you it does take a long time to board and to make it's way round. there are local convenience stores and ATM machines opposite the hotel and a good cantonese restaurant is also opposite the hotel which serves nice dim sum in the mornings. Overall i was very pleased with my stay and i would definately stay in Metropark again.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints!”
Reviews.Author: markcanz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Metropark Kowloon for 2 nights between xmas and New Year. The room was very clean, though due to our late arrival all the double rooms had been taken and we had to have a twin instead. After hearing reports that HK hotel rooms are small, was surprised to find the room was about the same size as a typical hotel in the UK. It is a good 10 minute walk to the nearest MTR stations (Yau Ma Tei or Mongkok). The hotel shuttle will drop you near the Mongkok MTR or near the Avenue of the Stars in Tsim Sha Shui. The pool is small but was never busy. The fitness room is also small, but it does contain a Nintendo Wii! Hotel bakery was excellent and very cheap. Buffet breakfast was also great. Staff were more than happy to store our bags for the day due to late departing flight.

Reviews.Title: “nice friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: LynzGlasgow
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very comfortable and clean. The staff were friendly and very helpful. Its location is good, as easy walking distance to Mongkok MTR and also Nathan Road. We didnt use the pool, so cant comment on that. We stayed in Kowloon as the hotels are much cheaper than Hong Kong Island, and away from the hustle and bustle, but within walking distance. The hotel has a free shuttle bus that take s you to Star Ferry terminal, and they run all day until 10pm, so we used this quite a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lock_yan
Reviews.Content: Was a good hotel and well priced when compared to some others. Is not as close to Lady's Market or the MTR station as we thought, but not excessively far. has been renovated so everything is relatively nice and new. Will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “a little expensive but okay”
Reviews.Author: northeastvillafan
Reviews.Content: we ended up staying at this hotel due to the fact we booked our flights to nz via hk and wanted to stay at metropark causewaybay only to find out a few weeks later that it was full,and so was everywhere else in dec as its conference season.as afamily of 2 adults and 2 children aged 5&3 we had to have 2 connecting rooms which was expensive.only reason i mention this is the hotel will not allow 4 in a room however on our way back the hotel again was fulland we could not have connect room so they put single bed in room for my kids. hotel is about 30 mins from airport in a red taxi cost about 20pounds.hotel is ok have stayed at worse. pay a little extra for club i thought it was worth it.only real gripe was the air con which was freezing.can turn it off in room at switch but it makes no diff as i got houskeeping in the end to assist but the main hotel aircon still comes into the room.staff are helpful and friendly and the little bus to the market and harbour is useful.taxis are cheap.
