Reviews.Title: “An average hotel but great location at busy shopping area”
Reviews.Author: zoukee888
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at Mongkok which is near to Ladies Market, Goldfish market, Flower market, Temple Street, etc. It's in the centre of shopping area and many good local food. But it's very expensive for a 3 star hotel. The hotel lobby is small but the reception staff is friendly & helpful. However, the bellboy think that our HKD5 tip is small and waited at our room door for more. He did not say anything but we realized that he's waiting for more tips as he stood quietly at the door looking at us. So, I gave him another HKD5 and he gladly thanked us and went away. The rooms & toilet were very small. There isn't much room for us to move about. I guess that how people in Hong Kong lives with limited land. Everything in the room & toilet are not so new, but still usable. Overall, it's a standard 3 star hotel and nothing much to brag about.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad”
Reviews.Author: kaneda
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel by price. It was in a reasonable area of uptown Kowloon with Prince Edward MRT station a few minutes walk away as well as numerous bus services. Check-in always seemed to be busy but the staff were friendly. I had asked for a room as high as possible and got the sixth floor (of thirteen). The room seemed to have everything you expected, with courtesy soap, shampoo, foam bath, toothbrush and toothpaste. It had the inevitable over priced minibar fridge but there was a 7-11 convenience store across the road. Now for the bad stuff. I have a fairly soft mattress at home. The mattresses in the room (2 single beds) were hard as rock (I've walked on softer floors). The walls are very thin and if you have some horrible people next door as I did, banging and clattering about and talking till midnight, you are not going to get to sleep. I complained about it and they said they'd send the housekeeper up. No one came. I complained next morning and without any trouble (other than having to come back at 11:30 AM to get my stuff to change rooms), I got a room on the 12th floor. Rooms to the front (west) have a view of the street. Rooms at the back, a view of old buildings at the back of the hotel. I was disappointed that the TV did not have STAR channels (satellite). There was a pay movie channel at a "mere" HK$90 a movie. A number of channels did have English language programmes on at times but it was a matter of looking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HarryYork
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Metropark as asingle traveller for 2 weeks. located outside the main tourist area but with all main attrations within easy reach by bus,minibus,taxi mtr train or kcr train.T IP buy an octopus card at any mtr station,this gives you cheap travel on most public transport and saves using small change! The hotel is clean and the staff all very helpful. Only gripe is that the buffet breakfast tends to serve lukewarm food and at $108 HK is a bit overpriced. Go 20 yards out of the front door to Teresas cafe and enjoy afull English and coffee for $21 HK

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a taste of real Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: aurelax2000
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was great. After an 13 Hours flight from london, we check in at this hotel and find out they had upgrate us to a deluxe because we were on honey moon. The Staff was really friendly. When we called out the reception because our safe was not working a maintenance guy was knocking at our door 5 minutes later. We stayed 4 nights. Had 2 free breakfast from the reception for no reason. Even so the breakfast is not fantastic its good enough to attack a long day of sightseeing. The location is a bit out of tourist place but not far at all walking distance. Which is great when you want a taste of Real Hong Kong. Also free shuttle bus (10 Minutes) to the south of kownloon where you can get a 10 minutes ferry to Hong Kong Island. And Finally a small swiming pool on the roof which is fantastic after a long day sight seeing. I also read in different review about the backery downstair and I am sorry to say that it was not great. Overall This Hotel is a great place to visit hong kong

Reviews.Title: “Good value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bakermob
Reviews.Content: We spent 12 nights at the Metropark Kowloon with our 3 teenagers and found the accomodation quite adequate. Considering how little we paid (approx $55Aus per room per night) we certainly cant complain. The rooms are a little tired but still great value. We emailed the Hotel the day before we were due to arrive to confirm our booking and request for adjoining rooms with a roller away and everything was in order when we arrived. Didnt use the shuttle bus much but used the no 7 bus across the road as it took us directly to the Star Ferry. The beds were hard but housekeeping brought up a foam overlay for my bed which helped. The kids loved the pool and WII.Theresa's cafe a couple of doors down was great, fed 5 of us for dinner for $30 Aus. Not too far to walk to MTR &KCR. Ladies markets are not far if you dont get lost! Welcomemart straight across the road was very handy and laundry across the road was efficient and cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Basic, good hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: 5akura
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nights from November 23-30, 2007. Hotel shuttle bus/van runs every 30 minutes to Fa Yuen Street in Mong Kok (Shoes and electronics shops) and New World Centre which is walking distance to Harbour view at Tsim Sha Tsui. Walking to nearest MTR Mong Kok is not so bed either, only about 10 minutes walk. The AC is quite cold, but I guess I'd like it better during summer months in HK. Room is basically clean with daily service with clean towels. Rooftop swimming pool and gym with a few workout machines. I directly reserved the stay under my name and party (without specific name listed). My friend (party) arrived in HK first and they let her check-in. I feel that it's not safe for hotel letting anyone check in like that. What if someone else happened to have my reservation paper, and told the hotel staff that he/she is the "party", then they can check in like that. That's SCARY! So I ended up moving down to the room my friend check in instead of staying the club room on 18th floor that they gave me. Metropark Kowloon should only allow the main person on reservation paper to check in, not "party". Some staff are friendly and courteous and some aren't. Two good free water bottles everyday and included broadband internet are great ! I like the switches for "Do not Disturb" and "room service required" (or something like that). Photos from previous reviewers are very real and candid, so I just added front view photos.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: xxxmagicxxx
Reviews.Content: flew from wales to hong kong direct and stayed in this hotel for one week, clean rooms, good friendly staff, the bar stays open until 12 and has a big screen tv that some how only plays fashion tv. but there is a great bar just around the corner from the hotel and that has live music and open until 4am. the hotel is a long walk to the star ferry but the hotel runs a free mini bus from the hotel to the star ferry every 30 mins for hotel guest only. there are lots and lots of shops near the hotel with and many food places.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and exceptional service.”
Reviews.Author: MarshBird
Reviews.Content: We were concerned about finding a hotel in Hong Kong: would it meet western standards, is it accessible, how's the service personnel, etc??? We were so pleasantly surprised. Likes: Shuttle to/from airport at very reasonable rates. Exceptional check in and check out efficiency. Location to Mongkok street markets, MTR station and KCR station. Shuttle bus to Mongkok and TsimShaTsui every half hour. Rooftop pool. Seems like all Taxi drivers knew where this hotel was. We never tried in-house restaurants because there were so many good little local diners around for much better prices. Minor dislikes: somewhat old, one light was burnt out, the TV remote didn't work. The beds were small (but that's the way it is in most hotels in HK except the very expensive ones). Highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Cold Room but Good Overall”
Reviews.Author: SFB43
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Metropark for 5 nights. Efficient check in and got twin non smoking room as requested. The only down side that the Air Con in the room could not be switched off and myself and friend found we were too cold. Housekeeping brought us blankets and a heater which we had to use on getting up in a morning. Someone else may be glad of a cold room and probably in the hot humid season we would have been too. Otherwise the room was clean, of average size with decent bathroom and maid service daily. There was a light that showed outside the door to either request making up the room or do not disturb which was handy as with door hangers they either fall or somone removes it. Staff overall were friendly. Location of hotel was fine. Some of the earlier reviews commented that it was too far out but they obviously don't like walking! We didn't use the hotels free shuttle as it was only a 10 min walk to an MTR station. Walking is the best way to see a city and we got to know several different ways back to the hotel. To get to this hotel from the airport get the airport express to Kowloon station and then go to the free transfer bus that runs every 24 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Metropark Hotel Kowloon is very good”
Reviews.Author: JasAustralia
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights at the Metropark Hotel on Waterloo Rd from October 15. i booked an executive suite as the hotels website says that they were being renovated. Check In - Brilliant. Really quick was in my room within 5 minutes. I checked in at the lub lounge. room - really nice. Nicely renovated and very comfortable. A little small but as not a small as most Hong Kong Hotels. The view i had from the room was ordinary however it is in a residential area. Location - 10 minute walk at most to ladies market and Mongkok MTR. If you can handle the nice easy walk then stay. I didn't mind this. They also have a free shuttle to Mongkok MTR and ohter parts of Kowloon. Service - Again very good. In fact exceptional. This really stood out to me. The front door guys, the service in the club lounge and all staff were very good. They look like they like working there. Price - about $150 aussie per night for an executive room which gives you 2 hours free drinks from 5.30-7.30pm (very good service as well) and free breakfast either in the club lounge or main restaraunt. I will be back next year for sure.

Reviews.Title: “loved the metropark”
Reviews.Author: goonerbgood
Reviews.Content: just returned from 10 days at this great hotel. booked their executive package directly with the hotel which included free breakfasts, free drinks in the executive lounge each day for two hours!! plus many other extras - well worth the money. Buses opposite the hotel take you directly to the Star Ferry or you have a 10 minute walk to the metro station or the ladies market for shopping! Very friendly staff and hotel room was great. will definitely be going back again in another 2 years

Reviews.Title: “Slightly dated hotel, but good enough value for money”
Reviews.Author: dantaylor123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Metropark Kowloon for 6 nights in July ’07 as part of our trip-around-the-world, and chose this hotel as our base to explore Hong Kong. The hotels reception/lobby area looks very grand, yet the rooms are in much need of decoration and look and smell quite dated. Having said that, the hotel has begun a renovation programme which is due to go on until end of October (we only found this out when we was awoken to drilling every morning!). There is complimentary internet access in the rooms, along with refrigerator, satellite TV etc. The hotel also has a pool located on the rooftop which was quite refreshing after a long day in the Hong Kong humidity. The hotel offers a complimentary bus service to near the Star Ferry terminal, and near to all the shops and a great viewpoint to watch the symphony of lights show. However, the bus is almost always full as many people wait 15 minutes before the bus is due to leave to ensure their seats. The only grumbles I had with this hotel is that we requested a non-smoking room, which they ignored, and when I asked to move, then tried to put us in a twin bedded room. Apart from that, based on the money we paid for this hotel (£22 per night), we was fairly satisfied with the hotel, just disappointed by the lack of notice to the building work and having been allocated a smoking room.

Reviews.Title: “First stay in HK, I would return to this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: isiaVienna
Reviews.Content: At first I was not happy with this hotel because it seemed to be far from everything, but to Nathan Road is approx. 15 min. walk, and 10 min to Ladys Market, the hotel has own shuttle to Ladys Market and Star Ferry, so it was ok. So you will be not forced to walk if you don't like it ;) Room was big, bigger than in other hotels in HK ;) Swimming pool and fitness room were on the roof - nice view! Breakfast was copious, you have european and asian dishes - joghurts, fruits, cheese (!!!), rise, noodles, sausages, bred etc etc etc - everything you need;) Restaurant was not interesting for us because of italian week ;) We prefere and looked for asian cuisine. It is perhaps not a hotel for romantic stay and honey moon, but good value, quiet, nice service, none problem, no complaints. I would recommend this hotel and I would be back. There are better hotels certainly, but not for this price. Good value!

Reviews.Title: “Metropark Hotel Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Denise07012
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice at this hotel. First time the room was more recently renovated. Twin beds. Mattress quite hard. Flatscreen TV on wall emitted a bright blue light on its control panel which made it hard to sleep at night as the whole room seemed illuminated. Couldnt switch it off. Second time the room (double) was older style furnishings, but the bed was very comfortable and no annoying light from television. Internet room off Lobby. I paid HK10 cash at reception ,supposed to be first 15minutes, but I was able to sit there using it for over an hour for that price. Good value. Printer available too on one computer. Hotels free shuttle bus service to Mongkok Station and New World Centre was useful. Service every half hour suited me. Hotel has a bakery, but there are 2 cheaper bakery shops down the block, & a Park N Shop supermarket nearby. Would recommend this hotel for those wanting comfortable place with good transport links, but it isnt 5star luxury. Probably 3.5 star. I got good price on room so was happy.

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel”
Reviews.Author: oscarEssex
Reviews.Content: Good place to stay if you need a central location. Room comfortable. Good free shuttle bus that takes you to the two major shopping places. We stayed here to break up our journey to Sydney. Staff friendly. Nice bar attached to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Inconvient locataion with the bare minimum to offer- not recommended”
Reviews.Author: NayKat
Reviews.Content: Travelled to HK with my husband (then fiance)(I am FROM Hong Kong) and stayed there for 5 days. Not recommended at all. The hotel is "far" from MTR (subway) and all sites. (FAR=> have to walk for more than 15 minutes is considered Far in Hong Kong) There is no bus, nor minivan that goes to the MTR station either. Hotel does provide shuttle but we never took it -since they run at a certain schedule. Hotel room itself is more like a "motel". Paid around 550HKD for 1 night. There are alot more far better and more convienent choices in HK. Will NOT go back (though they have now changed to "Metropark" - even if they upgrade all the rooms to 5star quality, the location is NOT going to change).

Reviews.Title: “Not the best for young children”
Reviews.Author: bronwynMidlands
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Metropark for 3 nights in May booked through our travel agent. OUr first problem was on arrival- we had flown in from New Zealandso were very jetlagged and arrived to be told we would have to wait for our room and not only that that the double plus cot we had booked was now going to be 2 singles! When we came back later to get the keys the receptionist said he had managed to get us a double room but we would have to do without a cot as they were all booked out- he didn't seem to care that we had pre-booked just looked at me blankly. Despite going back the next morning we were told there were still no cots available so for the 3 nights our 22 month old had to sleep in with us- had she been any younger this simply would have been unsafe. There were a few other young children staying in the hotel but this is something they need to plan for, especially as I imagine most people staying there had pre-booked. Otherwise the hotel was ok, food was a bit bland but ok for feeding kids but shuttle bus into Kowloon was good/ service was ok, but don't expect any help if you are struggling with a pushchair/ luggage etc! Hotel runs an airport transfer bus from 6am in morning which includes a breakfast and isn't too expensive- probably worthwhile (we got duped into getting a private transfer by our travel agent so were annoyed when we discovered there was a bus for half the price).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: TheSallyone
Reviews.Content: Metro park hotel was excellent, we really enjoyed our stay at this hotel, it was clean ,the staff were polite. We had an executive room on the 17th floor which entitled us to a quick check in and check out,breakfast, plus the happy hour, believe me pay the extra, it's well worth it The view from our room was not so good, but I didn't go to stand and look out of the hotel window .We took the free shuttle bus down to the ferry terminal and a ferry across to Hong Kong Island,then onto the bus for a ride up the Peak. This was a ride with a difference and a view to match. There are a good few restaurants and shops, we had lunch at the Peak cafe looking out over the bay. The train ride back down is not to be missed.Also the one thing you just have to do is afternoon tea at the Penninsula hotel, Expensive, yes, worth it, of couse. There are lots of different markets and a night market not far from the hotel.We would recommend the Metro Park Hotel on the basis of excellent value,good service and cleanliness

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good”
Reviews.Author: SingBiz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not our first choice but our preferred hotel was fully booked. So my partner and I stayed at this hotel for 8 nights, from August 14 to 22. If not for their business development manager, Anita, we wouldn’t have been able to stay 8 consecutive nights – and at a really great rate too! (We only confirmed our Hong Kong trip a day or 2 before checking in – during the busy HK Food Expo. We were one of the exhibitors. Last minute decision.) Quick and efficient service. Whether it was for extra towels, iron & ironing board or tissue paper, their housekeeping staff was at our door within 10 minutes or less. Every single time! Yes, every nice thing I read about this hotel here was true. For a 3-star hotel, they offer great value (HK$500+ a night with breakfast that normally costs HK$118) and lots of space for HK standards! And although our room was facing a busy main road with double-decker buses passing and all, we could hardly hear any traffic noise! (I always ask for and need a quiet room.) From the bathroom/shower to the pillows to the staff, we have no complaint whatsoever except for their hair dryer, it was way, way too weak, we had to buy a new one from an electrical shop. But a supermarket right across the street made up for this little problem – as I love to drink lots of good quality water and the 2 small complimentary bottles of water provided by the hotel are not only insufficient, they have a VERY strong, unpleasant taste and smell! In fact, I would have given this hotel 4 stars if not for the “rip-off” experience at their Chinese restaurant. Each room gets a coupon good for 2 free trial dishes at the restaurant, it turned out the 2 dishes were on 2 VERY SMALL plates, to add insult to injury, one of their free dishes was a plate of tasteless, cold and tough chicken. The other plate was beef and veg., not bad but not great either, but my REAL BEEF with them are 1) the service was very slow, 2) they charge HK$10 for a small bowl of white steamed rice and 3) they charge HK$18 for a tiny plate of sauce! Yes! Sauce. If we knew about these traps, we would never have set foot at their Chinese restaurant. Maybe such rip-off tricks are common at most hotel Chinese restaurants in Hong Kong, like taxis in Malaysia, if you don’t get ripped off by them, you are one VERY lucky person! Unless money is not a problem, I’d suggest dining at those small “coffee shop” restaurants, most of them serve pretty tasty stuff at a very affordable price, and no tips required too! It is not uncommon to find a BIG bowl of really tasty beef noodle for under HK$20! (If we really wanted to spend a few hundred HK$ on a single meal, we would have gone to only highly recommended places. By the way, their buffet breakfast is ok but absolutely not anywhere worth near HK$118 per head.) Their free shuttle may be reliable but it makes 2 stops, so if you want to get back to the hotel directly from the first stop, you either have to walk about 10 minutes, take a taxi or take the free shuttle to the 2nd stop, wait about 10 minutes – wasting a total of about 40 minutes or so of your time before you can get back to the hotel. Plus their shuttle drivers talk frequently and LOUDLY their cell phone while waiting & driving, if you understand Cantonese, you get to hear tons of swear words, it makes the journey very UNpleasant to say the least. If you decide to stay at this hotel, cross the road, take bus number 7B (from the entrance of Wellcome supermarket) to the end of the line and you will reach a waterfront town called Hung Hom, about a 20-minute or so ride away. Then take a short walk (under 10 minutes) from that bus terminal towards a huge mock ship and you’ll find lots of value shops selling branded stuff. There are also many small and cheap coffee shops there. We stumbled onto one that serves one mean meal… beef noodles + super tasty chicken wings + soya drink… all for HK$19 net! Yes, I would stay at this hotel again if my budget remains at around HK$500 to HK$600 per night, otherwise, I would prefer a 5-star hotel for about HK$1,500/night – that is nearer a train station, with more shops & restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “A great convenient place”
Reviews.Author: eehc_iliep
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week stay in HOng Kong. We stayed in Metropark Kowloon, a great hotel with easy excess to Hong Kong major shopping centres. The hotel also provided shuttle bus to the major shopping areas in Kowloon. Metropark Kowloon is located slightly off the busy area in Mong kok but you can easily walk back to the hotel. It takes about 10 mins to walk from the MRT station back to the hotel. We didn't have much trouble as the map provided by the hotel is easy to follow. We found the hotel clean and convenient. It' s cheaper to stay here(Kowloon) compared to Hong Kong island. You can easily explore the other parts of Hong Kong with MRT train or buses. While staying in HOng Kong we made a day trip to Shen Zhen, CHina another popular destination to go to while in Hong Kong. From Metropark, you can easily walked to the Train Station and hop on the train which goes right to Lo Wu (the last stop). Lo Wu is a border town to Shen Zhen. We were also very pleased with the services in Metropark too. The staffs are friendly and helpful. They also provided airport shuttle bus for only HK89 which brings you straight to the airport. Overall, a wonderful stay in Metropark Kowloon.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ottisriley
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very inexpensive and to be honest I did not expect it to be anything great when I booked it through my travel agent.It was everything you could ask for and more.It was central to everything and the room was absolutely perfect and spotless.All the staff were very friendly and they could not do enough for you.Very friendly-very kind-always with a lovely smile and nothing was ever a bother.They all made my stay in Hong Kong a very memorable time and if hopefully in the future I return to this lovely country I will DEFINATELY be staying at the Metropark in Kowloon.I have rated this hotel as EXCELLENT and it is truely well deserved.Thankyou very very much all at the Metropark .Mrs E Riley & my 9 year old nephew Sam.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for markets”
Reviews.Author: blackfruitbat
Reviews.Content: Looked up Hongkong hotels on a website for last minute bookings and the Metropark was listed. Looked up reviews and description in Tripadvisor. It had good reviews so booked with the cheapest link that gives you a price and the price was just what I was looking for. The airport has a shuttle to the hotel for $89 HKD which was $14 AU. Nice room, reception staff very helpful. Easy walk or complementary shuttle to nearby Ladies Markets. Really nice restaurant in hotel. Included buffet breakfast was excellent. Booked an airport shuttle and got dropped at the correct entrance for the airline I was taking. Even though I was travelling by myself, really enjoyed my Hongkong experience. Best idea in room - power points were a set of outlets for any countries electrical devices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: davefare
Reviews.Content: Everything you need from a hotel and more Clean, great restaurants Helpful staff Shuttle buses to Town and airport Nice open air pool

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for HKG”
Reviews.Author: CV5
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the airport we waited for the hotel link bus which was great, my only gripe was that we were the last drop off so after numerous hotel drops and over 1hr 20m later we arrived (after a 12 hour flight it was even more exhausting). After 9 nights at the Metrropark hotel I can tell you that our stay was adequate for what we wanted. The hotel is clean and tidy; the staff are friendly and helpful. The location for us was perfect in so far that it was far enough from the crowds but not too far to get around (MTR, shopping etc). Using the breakfast buffet was great for the two days that we knew we would be out all day, however a local canteen about 10 doors down was better value. We didn’t use the pool facility but went up to have a look, the area was clean and inviting albeit a little on the small side. I dismissed the previous posts about the hardness of the beds, but have to admit they are pretty solid even for me. Not the comfiest but not the worst as the extra pillows helped.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: 2CanadianTravellers
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at Metropark Hotel Kowloon on Waterloo Road in Hong Kong in May as the last stop of our 21 days China and Hong Kong tour from Alberta, Canada. We love this hotel for the location, which is very close to many excellent shopping areas in Mongkok district. We paid $89.00 Canadian per room, which was a good bargain. The hotel has free transportation to the Mongkok subway station and the famous Tsimshatsui waterfront. Hong Kong has a very efficient subway system that takes you everywhere you want to go. The hotel airport shuttle bus is only HK$89.00 per person, which is less than $13.00 Canadian. The hotel has a good Chinese bakery on the ground floor, a good place to buy Chinese buns for breakfast. The Hong Kong Bank is right beside the hotel. The hotel room is small, which is typical of hotel facility in Hong Kong. This hotel has met our travel expectations: clean room, clean bathroom, hot shower, and working air conditioning. If you are looking for good seafood meals in Hong Kong, visit Lei Yue Mun, a former fishing village on the East side of Kowloon. Take the MTR subway to Yau Tong Station, walk into the village, buy fresh seafood from the fish market, and have Sea King Garden Restaurant on (--) cook it fresh for you. If you are looking for very good local Cantonese food, visit the tiny Lin & Chuen Kitchen, (--), Shau Kei Wan, a famous street for small family owned restaurants. Take the subway to Shau Kei Wan Station and Main Street East is close by the Station. Right beside Lin & Chuen Kitchen on (--) is a famous restaurant for fish balls and noodles frequent by Hong Kong TV stars. Across Lin & Chuen Kitchen is Okonomi, a very good sushi place. Hong Kong is a very clean, safe, and beautiful city with many attractions. The Peak Tram up to Victoria Hill multi-level shops, restaurants, and observation decks overlooking the city and the harbour is a must see, especially at night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Julie-AnnFrost
Reviews.Content: We got a fantastic rate on this hotel and were a little bit aprehensive, but there was no need. The room was quite large and no more dated than other hotels we had stayed in. It was clean and had everything we needed, the staff were friendly and helpful all the time. The hotel is a little far out but the shuttle bus was reliable and punctual, taxi's also waited outside on the road and were plentiful. A walk to the MTR, Ladies Market, KCR railway did only take around 10 minutes. The swimming pool was nice and on a clear day there are views of Hong Kong island, again staff were friendly and helpfull. I would certainly recomend this hotel, it was fantastic value for money.

Reviews.Title: “A well placed hotel in Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: Happy2Travel2
Reviews.Content: The Metropark Kowloon is well placed for MTR and Ladies Market. The hotel is spotless and the staff friendly and helpful. Non smoking rooms are available if requested in advance. Rather than taking the shuttle bus from the airport and even quicker way of getting away from HKIA is to first buy an Octopus card and then take the train to Kowloon station. From there it is a quick and inexpensive taxi ride to the hotel. Would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone whose budget does not stretch to the Peninsula! (though you must take a look at the Peninsula Hotel!)

Reviews.Title: “Well priced Hotel Kowloon”
Reviews.Author: tricky220866
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay in the Metropark hotel. A bit grubby in places but you cannot fault the cleaness of the rooms. We had breakfast each morning which i must say caters for all taste. Get in early tho as they serve till 11.30 am but most things will have gone by 10.30am. The free bus to the YMCA near the star ferry runs every 1/2 hour. which we found useful although taxi's are extremley cheap.In the hotel lobby there is a travel office which can sort out many trips around Hong Kong. They were very informative Iris who served us was really professional in her job even calling us in our room 10 mins before our bus was to arrive. If your first time in the area take advantage of these tours, believe me its the best way to see Hong Kong and the other islands.All in all a good and inexpensive hotel if i was to visit Hong Kong , i would without question stay here again. Richard Robinson Morecambe United Kingdom

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MorningsideMinkel
Reviews.Content: A nice place, and relatively inexpensive, considering how expensive Hong Kong is. Good location, a nice walk to the sights and train station. A little disappointed that the pool wasn't open at this time of year, and the restaurants weren't great. But all in all a pleasant enough place for a stopover.

Reviews.Title: “glad I picked this one!!”
Reviews.Author: scotchmistDundee
Reviews.Content: After reading lots of reviews on different hotels in Hong Kong, we finally took a chance on this one. It was our first time in Hong Kong, so it was difficult knowing exactly where we wanted to be. We wanted a reasonably priced hotel for our 8 night stay, from 9/5/2007, with decent sized rooms, reasonably close to all areas of interest. Well we were delighted with our choice!! the hotel room was spotlessly clean, the bed was firm but very comfortable, and we slept like logs every night. ( from reviewers reports on beds in Hong Kong we were worried how they were going to be!!!). also, the hotel gives you the option of choosing from several different kinds of pillows, ( foam, cotton, feather down etc), so you're bound to get what you like. We chose a spacious comfort room, and we had a table and chairs to sit at with our tea and coffee, plenty of room I would say. Bedding changed as often as you like. The bathroom was also spotlessly clean and decent size. The staff were all very friendly, polite and always smiling. The hotel is in the Mongok area, about 5/10 minutes walk from Ladies market area and subway. Temple street is a 5 minute bus or subway ride. The whole area of Monkok is a shoppers paradise. Getting around was very easy , we used an Octopus card for buses and subway, and found the hotel perfectly situated for this. Though you can use the hotel shuttle service to get to the main area of Nathan Road, Kowloon, and tha Ladies Market. Later at night , Waterloo Road, where the hotel is, is nice and quiet, so we got a perfectly quiet nights sleep each night. Because this was our first time in Hong Kong, we were out and around every day and night, so we didnt eat at the hotel, so cannot comment, however the whole hotel is beautifully kept inside , all marble areas, and the restaurants looked lovely. The rooftop pool area is also perfect. Overall I'd say this hotel is excellent value for money, and I would definitely come back here !!

Reviews.Title: “Great to stop over”
Reviews.Author: emablair
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to New Zealand with a stop over in Kowloon Hong Kong. The hotel was nice we had interconnecting rooms as we were staying with our 3 children, the rooms were clean and quite a nice size . We only had two nights there but managed to fit quite alot in, the staff were helpful and gave us a map to show us how to get to the harbour, but the free shuttle is a great service that takes you into the shopping district. View from window was not so nice, right into the apartments opp! But net curtains made sure they could not see us!! ( I think!) Pool nice too if weather good as it is outside! Buffet breakfast had a good selection enough to cover the tastes of all my family which is important and the resturant served MASSIVE portions which they kindly boxed up for us to takeaway! Would stay again for stop over.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!”
Reviews.Author: PugLover80
Reviews.Content: Extremely pleased with this Hotel! The rates are very reasonable, and the staff are fantastic! They really go out of their way to make your stay more comfortable and to make sure you have everything you need! The roof top pool and fitness room are wonderful! The staff overseeing this area where such a pleasure! I wish we could have stayed longer just to hang out with them! The free shuttle services to downtown Hong Kong as well as the night markets were always on time and such a convenience! The front desk staff are always helpful no matter what you need them to do for you! If I make it back to Hong Kong, I wouldn't stay anywhere else! Extremely pleased!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Idec44Hampton
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 10 day stay at the Metropark Kowloon. Overall a good experience and quite reasonable in a high cost destination. We were given an upgrade to a "Spacious Comfort room" and although looking a little tired, it compared favourably with 3* plus. Beds were very hard, but the sheets high quality and there was a choice of 4 types of pillow. (including down!) Ample hot water in shower / bath. Broadband in rooms might have a problem if you are running Vista. Breakfast plentiful and varied, fitting both asian and european taste, although ingredients used are not absolutely top quality. Position is good, although I would advise a room on the higher floors to avoid vehicular noise. Free shuttle bus runs frequently and is a definite plus. Staff are helpful and prompt in responding to any problem (we had problems with Broadband accesss using Vista and an additional HK$100 on 3 nights of our stay!. Both problems dealt with quickly and politely) Swimming pool is on top floor, bit small but OK. Gym not worth bothering with.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: hallomainz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Metropark for three nights in April. I chose the hotel based on room rate and reviews, and to say it upfront. Metropark is good value for the money. I found out later, the hotel recently changed its name from Metropole to Metropark. As I was told, it had something to do with the SARS crisis. And looking for the room service menu in the drawer, I found some old Metropole brochures. About the experience....the Metropark is situated on Waterloo Road.. ..not an ideal location for a hotel in Kowloon. Mong Kok MTR is a 10 minute walk away and so are the Mong Kok markets. The hotel offers a free shuttle bus to the popular Tsim Sha Tsui shopping area, which makes it easier to get around. The room was on the 7th floor facing the back-alley, so it was very quiet. It was small and definitely lacked storage space. I had to move furniture to be able to open my suitcase. But room and bathroom were well maintained and clean. Bed was very comfortable. Television had a wide variety of international channels. Free internet was available given you brought your own laptop and ethernet-cable. The minibar was reasonably priced, but convenience-strores were around the corner from the hotel. Breakfast buffet was plenty and satisfying. Metropark has a nice pool on the 20th floor rooftop with a great view. Gym looked good, but I did not use it. Staff was very attentive and friendly, though a bit inefficient. As I was waiting at check-in, there were seven people swarming behind the counter, acting incredibly busy, but only two guests were being helped. Over all...it was a pleasant experience. If I had the choice, I would come again.

Reviews.Title: “Good time at Metropark,”
Reviews.Author: lindylouLancashire
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Metropark Kowloon for 4 nights and enjoyed every minute of my stay. The hotel is in a good location for the ladies market and lots of local atmosphere, especially at night. We stayed on the executive floor which included an excellent buffet breakfast and free drinks and snacks between 5.30pm and 7.30pm, just right for winding down after a busy day shopping. We used the hotel shuttle for the star ferry and shops at Nathan Road but taxis were plentiful and very cheap. The rooms are small and not luxurious but were always cleaned to a high standard by very pleasant staff. If I am ever lucky enough to return to Hong Kong, I will certainly consider the Metropark Kowloon when booking my hotel. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied with Metropark Kowloon Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zandro614
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed the Metropark Hotel has served their guests. In the beginning we got lost as we went to the wrong Metropark Hotel Address (Mongkok, supposed to be in Kowloon), but they are so accomodating that I didnt worried about transferring. When I reached the room, it was very clean, and didnt expect this ambience considering it is 3 star, I feel like im on a 4 star accomodation. Travelling without a adaptor is also not a problem as hotel provides in each room converter, and internet also is free of charge. Plus they have available transport to the City, and you can even leave your luggage with them even if you are already checked out. I like very much their service. No worries. Highly recommended for frequent travellers. -frederick (Morocco-Dubai-HK-Philippines)

Reviews.Title: “Cheap option for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Gracie_Pug
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about a ten minute walk from Mong Kok subway station in northern Kowloon and about 20 minutes walk from the main night market at Temple street. The local area is fantastic, especially at night as some of the little roads crammed with shops are pedestrianised and it's easy to wander around. It's also near some of the best day markets. As the subway is nearby it's easy to get to and from Hong Kong Island and only takes around 15-20 mins.The hotel does offer a free shuttle bus to Mong Kok station and then down to the harbour, but it's best to get off at Mong Kok and get the subway as the traffic means the bus journey can take up to an hour. Room was great, clean and quite large for a short stay. And we got the room for about £48 a night which isn't bad at all by Hong Kong standards. One word of warning - our flight home wasn't until 1am so we wanted a late check out. You have to pay extra for this and each time we asked the price seemed to change depending on who was on the front desk. Basically call for the manager and ask for the best rate and get it in writing there and then!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good value and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: chris.lalor
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 nights here. Hotel a little older than most, more than made up for by the excellent service of the hotel staff. Swimming pool and fitness room both work. The Australian buffet dinner is just wonderful, at $28 a go you don't find better value for money. The free shuttle bus runs every 30 minutes into Mongkok and the side of the Peninsular hotel so shopping and the Star ferry to Hong Kong island are within easy reach. If you looking for a lower cost stay than you couldn't find better that this one and as a bonus "Happy Hour" lasts from 6.00pm to 21.00pm.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: geezy
Reviews.Content: I was lucky to find this place on my first visit to Hong Kong last year. I paid about $96/night ($83 rate + taxes/srvc fees). On my airplane ride to HK I sat next to this older gentleman who told me that rooms and hotels in HK were small and pretty pricey. So, when I came across MK hotel I felt really fortunate because my room seemed pretty big to me and the price was fair in comparison to the other hotels that I researched. The room was clean and neat, nice decor, tidy bathroom...there was a pool on the roof and I even got to use their tiny - fits max. 4 people gym (a few machines and a treadmill or two). Overall service was friendly and helpful. They also had a free shuttle to the airport and to Tsim Sha Tsui at different times. The hotel is located pretty close (maybe 10-15 min walk) to the Ladies Market so it's convenient to do shopping and exploring throughout Mong Kok. My only beef was that there was supposed to be free internet access in the bar downstairs, except that it wasn't free because you had to purchase something to sit in there. Overall, Metropark Kowloon is a nice place to stay if you can get a good deal on room rates.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Used2it
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as hotels in TST were fully booked due to the conventions. As I have never heard of this hotel before, I was rather skeptical. When I arrived, I was very pleased with the pleasant service provided by the staff. Although the hotel room is rather worn out, it is a clean and bright hotel. The location of the hotel may not be near the MTR (10 mins to Mongkok MTR), but it is a 5 mins walk to Mongkok KCR station. If you are on business trip and most of your customers are in the New Territories (e.g Shatin, Kowloon Tong), then the location of this hotel is not too bad. The hotel is also amongst the residential area of Mongkok so you can be sure there are a lot of nice little restuarants and minimart around. Just directly opposite the hotel, there is a Wellcome supermarket where you can get things from drinks to sushi. The hotel also offered free shuttle bus rides o TST and Mongkok but do avoid it if you want to go to these places in the evening time as the traffic is terrible. You will take about 45 mins just to get to TST. So, you might as well walk down to Mongkok n take a train. It will only take you 15 mins. Overall, it is a nice hotel where you can have a taste of the local lifestyle. Good for free and easy travellers, and not too bad for business travellers too.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location BUT beware the charge for an extra bed!”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrotter_n_Kid
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night prior to leaving for Oz. There were 2 adults and a 5 yr old in our group. We booked this on line which was easy and managed to get a rate cheaper directly with the hotel than any other website BUT I booked a room for 2 adults and 1 child. When we got to the hotel I was told the Chinese usually have their child in the bed with them so if I wanted an extra fold away bed in the room I would have to pay extra for it. The room cost $842HKD (£60) and for the extra bed they wanted another $200HKD. I refused to pay this and they waived the fee. The room was adequate and a good size and although a little rough around the edges it was fine. The staff were helpful and the hotel was generally quite nice and clean. It was located quite close to the markets etc so most places were within walking distance. Kowloon is a very very busy place – avoid it if you have a young child in a pram as it really is heaving with people. We ate breakfast at the hotel which was alright (buffet style). It was included in the room price so couldn’t complain. A taxi to the airport cost $300HKD (£20) which was worth the money. We left early Sunday morning so there was no traffic. Generally a good value hotel with a relatively cheap taxi ride to the airport, conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable stay”
Reviews.Author: LondonBrennan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in mid january as a stoppover trip to china. Check-in was quick and efficient and friendly though nothing special and check-out was equally smooth. We added an extra night which was no problem although we were offered a higher price than my sister who checked in after us. The room was a standard twin, this was clean and tidy although quite cramped. The bathroom was clean but there were limescale marks on showerhead and taps and sides of the bath looked like it was due for replacing. Overall, although a little drab and worn, it was a good resting place as we were hardly there. All the staff from the information desk through to cleaning were friendly and willing to assist when asked. The location was a little out of the way as although there is a free shuttle bus to TST and Ladies market, this seemed to be late leaving everytime. We paid £53 for the room as everything was fully booked due to the new year period so I don't think it was super value but it is definately worth the 3 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: rockstu
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a week and apart from the location, which was a bit disappointing, I have no real complaints about the hotel. Upon arrival the staff were very helpful and took care of our luggage whilst we went to check in, at which we were quickly dealt with. The double room we stayed in was clean and the size was comfortable. We visited the hotel's two restaurants. The food in the restaurant was excellent and varied and is worth trying. The Sip Sip bar (which had a sporty theme) offered a good variety of cocktails and provided an opportunity to catch up with Premiership football matches. One tip I would suggest is that if you ever get a taxi back to the hotel make sure you tell the driver that you want to go to the Metropark Hotel Kowloon, as there is another Metropark Hotel nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Metropark value for the price”
Reviews.Author: Kiwitraveller07
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was called the Metropole and still beared the name on parts of the Hotel and stationary/guides etc. It was not luxurious but comfortable, and in Hong Kong you don't hang around your hotel, you shop or you tour or you are in transit. They are located in amongst the "dirty" part of Kowloon called Mongkok, but given that you could walk to the Ladies and Temple St Markets so if you were happy to be amongst the locals it can be interesting. They had a free shuttle that leaves every 30 minutes to the Mongkok Market and down to the Star Ferry so this was handy, but was often full so had to get in early. The food at the Hotel was quite expensive and comparible to more luxury hotels, so after dining a couple of times for average meals, found other restaurants better value and quality. They offered a special discount to dine at thier restaurant when you book in which makes you question it's quality if they are dragging in punters with specials. We arrived at 3pm off a long flight and rooms were not available but were ready at about 4pm but was a bit inconvenient. Again, it was good value for Hong Kong so you get what you pay for, so based on that we were satisfied in general with our stay. PS....they have a bakery on ground floor, but they buy in and two bakeries are within 50mtrs of hotel and offer fresh baked products for far less.(sorry nice lady in hotel bakery!)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Januaryman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights on our return from Oz. After reading some of the bad reviews before we went, we were pleasantly surprised with the Metropark, it was we felt worth the 3 stars, and rated much better than some English 3stars we've stayed in. We had a Standard double room and found it to be a very comfortable size, a queen size bed and a couple of easy chairs, tea/coffee making facilities and a mini bar, which was useful for holding Juice and Milk (not to mention beers) a nice bathroom. Overall the hotel was spotless and the staff helpful and friendly. The buffet breakfast we found excellent value with plenty of choice for all for around £5.50 per person. The shuttle bus was a convenient way to get to TST and even the walk to Mongkok wasn't that far. We had transfers arranged and both ways was easy, uncomplicated and prompt. Only one complaint the Air conditioning in the Dining room was too cold, on our last night we had dinner in our coats. Apart from that top marks we wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: loftmeister
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Metropark on transit to Oz.. I spent two nights at the hotel. I stayed in an 'executive room' , the only thing i would say is that i would hate to see a standard room. It wasnt very spacious. The hotel staff very extremely helpful, the location was average, but the hotel do offer a free shuttle bus every half an hour to various parts of Kowloon. The room was spotless. The restaurant was very well priced and a tasty meal. I cant really say anything bad about the hotel, it only misses out on top marks because of the size of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Abuse by staff member”
Reviews.Author: cvo81
Reviews.Content: My family of 11 recently stayed at Metropark Kowloon from 2-7 Dec 2006. At first we were happy with the staff, accomodation was decent and the shuttle bus was convenient . However, on the final day my parents went shopping on the morning before checkout and got lost coming back. They were 15 minutes late for the shuttle bus to the hotel and amidst their distress from getting lost and worried about being late to the airport, the staff member who was responsible for checking their room upon checkout verbally abused them to the point of my mum being in tears. He told my father they had to catch a taxi to the airport and that the hotel will not refund the money they had already paid for the shuttle bus back to the airport. As the shuttle bus was awaiting my family to board to take them to the airport, instead of allowing my parents to quickly board, this staff member decided to continuously abuse them and make the people on the bus continue to wait. The language this staff member used was unacceptable and my entire family left with a sour taste for this hotel. It is unfortunate as they enjoyed most things about this hotel. Additionally, when an email was sent to this hotel of this complaint, they failed to address it and have chosen to ignore it. They say that they have a customer-focus policy, but obviously they dont. Our family goes to Hong Kong multiple times each year for business/leisure and have not had any problems with any hotels before. This experience has really ruined their Hong Kong trip. We will not be returning to this hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Enjoyable Stay, Friendly Staff, Hard Bed”
Reviews.Author: Onie13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights early December and enjoyed our stay. We arrived early (about 10.30am) and checked in at executive club and they let us in the room then which was wonderful as we needed the sleep as came from London! We paid about 60 pounds a night which was great value and stayed in exec rooms with free breakfast - the breakfast we had was downstairs and was really good - hot and cold selection. The room was clean and quite spacious, had hairdryer and shampoos etc. The only complaint is the bed... it was SO hard.. like concrete. It was queen size but the hardest bed I have ecver slept on. We used the free shuttle to and from the central area and found that handy. Taxi's are really cheap too as based on kms not time. Staff were friendly and helpful. We stored our luggage there on final day too. We also booked a day tour to Lantau from hotel and that was a great tour - Splendid tours. Would be a perfect stay except for the bed! I would stay there again depending on price.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: junglejay
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Metropark Kowloon for 8 nights in November, and found it to be a very nice hotel. We stayed in a non smoking room, which was very comfortable and clean. The location was great as we loved the hustle and bustle of the Mongkok area. The MTR was a 10 minute walk away, but when our feet were a bit sore from shopping/sightseeing the hotel shuttle bus went to Mongkok and TST every 30 minutes. Some people on this site have complained that the decor was bad, but I found it quite nice! Overall we were very happy with the hotel, and I would have given it a perfect five, but on occasion the Reception staff were not as friendly as we would have liked. If we are in Hong Kong again we will definately consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything stinks of stale smoke”
Reviews.Author: ApplesInMyBra
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not only very poorly located (one has to wait for the hourly shuttle to take you anywhere - nothing is in walking distance), but it is also very very old. Everything is outdated, the carpets are musty, paint peeling on the walls, the bathroom counter tops are chipped. The bar downstair is packed with clutter (see the picture I took in the bar - how can you relax with the place looking like this?!). All in all the hotel is unkempt, dirty-looking and yucky smelling. Whoever came up with the interior decorating must have been on crack - it is uglier than ugly. If you don't care about hotel cleanliness or good service, but just after a good price, then this place is for you. If you are traveler looking for more classy digs, go somewhere else - you can find a much better hotel for the same price in Hong Kong. And in a better location!

Reviews.Title: “Be careful! Bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: truette
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Metropark Kowloon for several days. It appears to be a nice, clean hotel. However, by about the 5th day, I started noticing that I had some small red bumps on my torso. The next day, several more appeared. The day after I left the hotel, the bumps developed into welts all over my arms, waist, shoulders and legs -- about 25 in total. After doing some research, I realize these are bed bug bites. Sometimes it can take up to 9 days for these bites to appear, so I was probably being bitten a little every night without knowing it. If you stay at this hotel, be very careful. Check the bed sheets, blankets and mattress to make sure your room is not infested with bed bugs. You also have to make sure they don't get onto your luggage or chothes or you could end up infesting your home with them. It's actually very unfortunate because this is a decent hotel with good size rooms and nice, helpful staff. However, because of this bed bug situation, I would never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not great”
Reviews.Author: jonorose
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Metropark Kowloon for a few nights recently. I had a room on the executve floor, other than the use of the lounge for breakfast and check in/check out from the lounge, I don't know if I gained much else. Rooms are comfortable, if a little warn. Decent size for the price in Hong Kong. The location is mixed. Its great if you want to go to Mong Kok, and the street market, but its a little far from everything else. Its about a 10 minute walk to the MRT, 5-10 mins walk to the Mong Kok KCR station (handy for a visit to Shenzhen). Waterloo Rd is also extremely noisy, and since I like to usually open a window, it was almost impossible due to the noise. And as stated I was high up on the executive floor. The gym is rather small, as is the pool area. I enjoyed the buffet at the cafe/restaurant, ate there twice. Plenty to choose from including sushi, seafood, roast beef/pork, nice desserts, salads etc. Its a little on the pricey side though. Having said all that, the hotel rate is very reasonable (I paid 850HKD for the executive room).

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Metropark”
Reviews.Author: Didsbury-Traveller
Reviews.Content: We have now stayed at the Metropark Hotel Kowloon, formerly the Metropole 6 times increasing our length of stay each time, until we have now just returned from a 30 night stay. The hotel is ideally situated for easy access to shops and markets and the free regular shuttle bus is very convenient taking you close to many tourist attractions. The room facilities and servicing of them is excellent as is security within the hotel. There is a wonderful rooftop pool together with a small but well equipped gym. Within the hotel the `House of Tang' and `Palm Court' are both superb restaurants and the `Sip Sip' bar used by both locals and hotel guests screens live premiership football and has the advantage of a `long' happy hour. Finally we must mention the management and staff who are efficient, helpful and friendly. From a smile when you enter the foyer to a friendly chat over breakfast, nothing is too much trouble and we have always been made to feel valued guests and very much at home.

Reviews.Title: “No problems with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: whatevernext
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the MetroPark Kowloon for 4 nights and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.(25 Sept to 28 Sept 2006) The non smoking room was exactly that, not a hint of smoke. It was in excellent condition, clean and bright, with sufficient room for all our bits and pieces. The Bathroom was of good size and the equipment in good order, cleanliness could not be faulted. Toiletries were replenished as soon as used, despite a notice advising that towels would only be replaced if left in the bath, all our linen including bed linen was changed daily. (Didn't realise I was that dirty) I was impressed with the bank of 4 square pin electrical sockets at table top level with the internet connection close by, the extra nice touch was a connector cable for use from the point to a laptop. (handy if you leave home without yours.) All the staff were very friendly and more than helpful. We did not use the dining facilities, bar or pool so cannot comment on them. The TV was not even switched on. I was more than happy with the location, yes it is away from the hustle and bustle of the exclusive shopping areas, but I liked stretching my legs with a gentle stroll to Monkok and being with the locals of Kowloon as they went about their daily business. All in all we had a wonderful time and experience, we all have different tastes, so what is good for one may not be right for another. I would happily return to this hotel for another holiday. Foot note, I completed the hotel questionnaire and made favourable comments before leaving, when I returned home there was an Email from the Assistant manager thanking me for my comments and for taking the time to fill out the form, what a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel rooms need updating”
Reviews.Author: pinkgizmo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4nights from the 20th-24th of September. The location was fine as the hotel bus dropped you at the harbour or at the metro if you needed to get anywhere. The metro put London undergrouond to shame it was so clean ,cheap ,on time and easy to follow !! The only complaint I have is how basic the room was I expected something a bit more up to date,the bathroom was dark and dingy and the bath tiny and the room basic,but saying this it was clean the staff were polite and room service was good also the evening I had it as my boyfriend was too ill to go out. For the price you pay its good value and if you are not going to be in the room much then its fine.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up for Metropark Kowloon :)”
Reviews.Author: Piyoo
Reviews.Content: I checked into the hotel on 21st Sept and checked yesterday. The whole stay in the hotel was smooth. The hospitable services provided by the hotel made me feel so much at home. I was always greeted by the room service lady when I first step out of my room every morning with "zou san"-Good morning and a warm smile. :) I asked for a non-smoking hotel room, which was pleasantly clean, well furnished and new! Everything you need for an above average hotel room was there, everything well provided for. I still miss the nice cosy bed and wide range of pillows that I can choose from. The room was spacious enough based on HK standard in my opinion. No breakfast for me as I chose to stay in a standard room. I will always grab some bread at the hotel's bakery just beside the entrance before I go off for my whole day of shopping spree daily. Visited the swimming pool on the top most floor, but has no time to rest and relax over there as I was busy shopping around HK most of the time, Haha.. One minor setback to this hotel is probably the distance from the Mongkok MTR, I took about 5-10 mins to walk from the MTR to the hotel at normal walking pace. However, you can always opt to take the round trip hotel shuttle bus (which operates till 1030pm) to and from the hotel instead of walking. The good service by the bus driver uncle also pleases me :) (He will state the drop off location clearly in English, and advice you accordingly, so you won't miss the place that you are going). There's also lots of buses to access various places just outside the hotel along waterloo road or simply hail a cab (fare to nearest MTR is below 20 HKD only). I walked so as to visit the shops along the way. :) Overall, a very pleasant stay in this hotel, and I will definitely stay in this hotel on my next HK trip and recommend it to my friends!

Reviews.Title: “You don't always get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Blankii
Reviews.Content: Unlike the previous reviewer I can understand why some people gave this hotel a bad review. However I can also understand why some people would think it's not all that terrible. I think it all depends on the timing of your visit and therefore the amount you pay for your room. For my part, I unfortunately scheduled my trip to Hong Kong during a big convention and therefore hotel prices were increased to quite ludicrous amounts. I can’t say this was the fault of the hotel as every other hotel I tried to book at this time was either more expensive or fully booked. Given this situation, I was forced to pay probably twice the amount I would have ordinarily paid for the same room had I had the foresight to travel either 2 weeks earlier or later. Unfortunately as a result of this situation, the Metropole was by far the most expensive room I have stayed in during my travels in Asia, whilst at the same time being by far the least impressive in terms of quality, cleanliness and service. Not to say that these aspects of the hotel were necessarily bad, just that they were far below the standards of other hotels I have stayed in around Asia and at more than double the price in most cases. One other thing I will say is that I generally didn’t like Hong Kong very much, so I think that probably also had a bearing on my overall impression of the hotel (although you could probably argue the reverse as well). As for my actual review of the hotel, firstly the positives: - free broadband internet access in the room (this was not working when we arrived, however the hotel IT manager, who proved to be extremely helpful, came and fixed it in a jiffy); - free shuttle to Nathan Road; - pillow menu with the option of a contour pillow which cured my sore neck!; - access to club lounge (I, like many others, took the advice of previous reviewers and booked and a room on the executive floor). On the downside, as previously mentioned I booked a room on the executive floor on advice from previous reviewers on this website. My general impression of the room was that it was small and cramped with a musty odour and was definitely crying out for a renovation. This was the sort of room I would expect to pay no more than $100 a night for, rather than the $300 a night I was actually paying. The further downside of this was that given the condition and standard of the executive room, I shudder to think what a standard room would have been like. Other than the room, I also generally found the service to be of a low quality although having never traveled to Hong Kong before, I suspect that I probably set my expectations too high given the excellent experiences I have had in Malaysia, Singapore, Indonesia and Thailand. Hong Kong is clearly not like any of these other destinations and therefore my preconceptions of Hong Kong were probably unrealistic. Having said that, we did have some positive experiences with some of the hotel staff (the aforementioned IT manager and a couple of the employees in the club lounge). Overall I would rate this a moderate low end hotel, which means that if you’re paying any more than $100 a night for it you’re being ripped off. If you manage to stay here for less than that then I’d say you’re probably getting what you pay for. So, the moral of my story is make sure you have realistic expectations of this hotel before arriving and plan ahead to avoid any conventions or special holidays that push the prices of hotels up.

Reviews.Title: “cannot understand those negative posts”
Reviews.Author: prudence-kitten
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 4 nights in Metropark and would not agree with ANY negative comments I read on this forum. Everything was exactly as promised The room was airy clean comfortable and well serviced The TV worked (the programmes were poor but I did not come to HK to see TV) The breakfasts were excellent and on special well worth the money. The shuttle bus was very handy and always on time. The staff were friendly helpful and very polite. The swim and gym area was good and well served, It IS a 15 minute walk to Mon Kokl MTR if you do not wait for the shuttle bus but what does that matter at the price paid for such an excellent standard of hotel this walk is ok by me. (helps to wwear off the excellent food) My flight was at midnight but I kept the room until 12 they stored my luggage and gave me towels and all requirements in the swimming pool showers for me to change at the last moment before taking the China Travel shuttle bus to the airport - arranged via the hotel and very reasonable. Speaking with swimmers in the sun - one couple were on their 6th trip - they stayed each year for one months - this says it all.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Smelly Dirty Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bettydog2
Reviews.Content: Just returned from one night stop over in Hong Kong. This hotel is dirty, very smelly. The smell in the room was almost unbearable. Staff were not helpful. Shuttle bus was not pointed out to us. Tourist sightseeing reservations lady has attitude. Would never stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jansten
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two weeks during our first visit to Hong Kong. As a family of 4 we had two rooms both of which were very clean and had all the amenities needed. The Hotel overall is well staffed, clean and helpful. We went for breakfast on the first morning (buffet style) which was quite reasonable serving everything you would expect. Although after venturing out of the hotel we found Teresa's Coffee Resaurant next door which was very cheap and served great food. The pool situated on the roof wasn't the biggest, but was big enough for the cool down you need when sunbathing in the Hong Kong heat! The lifeguards/Pool Attendents couldn't have been more helpful ~ you could also order food and drink from them. (But is more expensive than if you went to the shop near the hotel (7Eleven).) The only little negative point about this hotel is its location. It is well situated for the local markets (only about a 10 minute walk...if you dont get lost!!) but if your wanting to go to the harbour then transport is recommended. Although the hotel runs a free bus service which leaves every 15 minutes to different locations around the island...one of which drops you off outside 'The Peninsula' hotel which is ideal for the Star Ferry crossing to Hong Kong Island. Overall a great stay in this hotel and we will definately return - Cant really fault this hotel, so dont be put off by negative reviews on this site...Give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “It is AUG 3 2006 and I am still in the hotel right now, run away fast!”
Reviews.Author: skmtrading
Reviews.Content: Where do you start. This hotel is a joke, the worst I have ever stayed at after coming to Hong Kong for business for quite some time. #1 you are in the middle of no where, you a good 15 minute walk to the MTR, or any western restuarnt for that matter, and that means mcdonalds, if you want anything better you had best jump in a cab and fork over your 40 HKD to get anywhere. I just paid 50 HKD for a cup of coffee in the business lounge on the 17th floor, my god. I booked this hotel because I was in a last minute rush and Hong Kong was booked, the hotel is cheap there is no doubt but truely not worth it, for me the main reason to book it was the free broadband internet service in each room. My god Broadband my As# I am gettting 1KB a second, a dial up modem in the north pole can pull that off. I have been waiting for 3 days for the hotel staff to send there "engineer" to fix the connection and today they have told me the entire hotel has had this problem for quite some time, Oh thats just great. By the way the Engineer that was checking out the internet connection is no downstairs as a porter for new arrivals baggage. WHAT THE HELL IS GOING ON HERE, LIKE COME ON NOW. I am losing my mind in this place, the bar [----]they charge 10 US for a beer and there idea of good music is Celine Dion Followed by vulgar Rap music full of swearing, THESE PEOPLE HAVE NOT A CLUE. I COULD GO ON AND ON BUT WHATS THE POINT, I AM GOING TO CHANGE HOTELS I DONT CARE THAT I HAVE ALREADY PAID FOR ANOTHER 5 DAYS IN THIS ONE, I JUST CANT TAKE IT AND IF YOUR HERE FOR BUSINESS DONT EVEN THINK ABOUT IT, I HAVE LOST THOUSANDS OF DOLLARS BY NOT BEING ABLE TO STAY IN CONTACT WITH MY SUPPLIERS IN THE MAINLAND AND HONG KONG. HOTEL MANAGERS RESPONSE, WE ARE SORRY, 10 MINUTES LATER THEY DELIVERED A FRUIT BASKET TO MY ROOM, I REFUSED IT AND INSTRUCTED THE MANAGER TO FIND ANOTHER CREATIVE USE FOR HIS OVER RIPE BANANNA THAT HE WAS ATTEMPTING TO BE A PEACE OFFERING. OH BY THE WAY I AM FROM BRITISH COLUMBIA CANADA, TO GIVE YOU AN IDEA OF WHERE I AM COMING FROM. REGARDS

Reviews.Title: “Executive rooms very good”
Reviews.Author: seasonedtraveler41
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights in the Executive non-smoking room (16th floor). We were very surprised by size of the room which we were expecting to be smaller. There is no need to stay in the Executive Deluxe room - the Executive room is about the same and cheaper. The rooms were totally smoke free. If you stay in the Executive rooms you don't need to check in at the 1st floor registration but can go directly to the 17th floor for priority check in. The included buffet breakfast is available on the 17th floor Executive lounge or in the restaurant. It is adequate - not the best but not the worst either. The rooms are very quiet. The location was more convenient than we had anticipated. The train / MTR are a 10 minute walk away, or you can take the free hotel shuttle. We paid US $92/night for a couple through Expedia(including the extra charge of the 2nd person because of the breakfast and all service charges). If you are going into China and back to HK you can leave your bags at the hotel storage at no extra charge if you stay there on your return. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in the erea”
Reviews.Author: gennisis
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here 3 times now. It beats the other 4 & 5 star hotels in the area. The rooms are just like more expensive Hotels...the Buffet evening meals are great value at $240HK. My internet bookings have always been answered promptly. All in all I cant fault this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you know Hong Kong well”
Reviews.Author: Iriss
Reviews.Content: The hotel service was quite good, room was very clean. The location is in middle of Mong Kok-- great if you know Hong Kong very well, otherwise I advice you to stay near TST area. The worst experience I had was when I returned from Karaoke late at night (approx. 3am?), almost all of the lights in the hotel lobby was swtiched off... I thought the hotel was closed for curfew or something! It was very dark and there was no attendant in the lobby area. Out of all the lifts, only one of them was still working (somehow they want to save on electricity, so they switched off all the lifts except one?) The receptionists were all very polite and efficient. Besides the 'I thought there was curfew' incident, my stay there was quite pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “People who gave this hotel 5 stars have never stayed at a 5 star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mitsubishiash
Reviews.Content: Ok, so the title to this review probably leads you to believe I didn't like this hotel. Well, you'd be right but I'd like to start off by saying that the Metropole (or MetroSARS, as it is affectionately known) wasn't too bad and it was pretty cheap - you get what you pay for after all. My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights on the third and final leg of our honeymoon. When we arrived we had to wait 20 minutes to check-in because of the queues. When we got to our room we found it was a twin room (naturally we had booked a double) and it absolutely stank of smoke (we'd booked a non-smoking room). The unhelpful staff at reception only changed their attitude when I became very angry and we were eventually given another room which did meet our specifications. I could now tell you a long story about our incredibly rude bell boy, but suffice to say that he was not very nice. At all. On a brighter note, our new room was ok. A little dark and a little small but adequate. It wasn't until night time that we found out that the Metropole really skimped when buying the pillows - they were filled with sawdust (maybe not but it seemed that way) and were highly unpleasant. So bad in fact, that we actually went out and bought our own! We didn't eat at the hotel as it was expensive and we didn't hold out hope that it would be any good considering how we'd found the rest of the hotel. And don’t bank on using the pool as it’s only open for around half the year. The location was ok - good for shopping with many street markets nearby running until late at night. You may have heard that the SARS outbreak started here. Well, it's true and in fact they managed to trace the outbreak to the lift area on the 5th floor. I for one couldn't have thought of a more appropriate place! Overall, do not stay at this hotel unless it is very, very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: gpw68
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel just before christmas. We upgraded to a room on the executive floor of the hotel, which gave us a fairly spacious room which was of a reasonable standard, but in fairness for the price we paid we were more than happy with what we had. The room price also had breakfast included which was very nice. The shuttle bus ran from the hotel regularly, and the hotel bar on the ground floor was ok for a relaxing drink. The service was good and the staff were friendly. Cabs around the city are cheap which makes the hotels location easily accessible to the main sites of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Would return to the Metropole ? Yes !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We'd read mixed reviews on this hotel and that it was "out of the way". Upon arrival we were pleasanly surprised that the hotel was very pleasant (in a so-so area). The rooms were perfectly fine and clean. The bar and it's limited menu is expensive - in fact eating was a problem in Hong Kong full stop ! The hotel also has a roof garden with a freezing pool, and a small gym. The hotel bus was a great help and if you miss it the No7 bus (stop opposite hotel) takes you to the Star Ferry. HK Island and Kowloon couldn't be more different. HK Island is full of very expensive Malls (we didn't buy a thing), but excellent for window shopping. Times Square was our favourite, with it's enormous Xmas tree. Taxis are incredibly cheap for dashing about it. Must sees are Star Ferry and Victoria Peak. The light show was disappointing also, we expected lasers and fireworks but no. Kowloon is a hoot. Ladies Market was a great favourite for shopping, although the night market was a disappointment. Nathan Road at night is quite dazzling with it's lights and worth a walk, approx 1 mile. The sights (and smells !) are something else. Overall we enjoyed the hotel and would recommend it to you - stayed in far worse !

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient”
Reviews.Author: zazzi2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Metropole for three nights from 16 November. Our 'superior' rooms basic but very clean. Great shower. Minibar prices abit high so would buy our essentials across the road at the Wellcome store. The Metropole is very convenient for shopping in Argyle Street. Some great stores to be found here. Quick access also to the Ladies Market. Frequented the Bakery - nice pastries! Housekeeping staff very friendly and obliging. Only used complimentary shuttle once but very handy and punctual. Our room had a safe in it but friend's next door didn't. Because of having so many heavy bags, we opted to use their Airport shuttle bus. Very luxurious indeed. Cost was HK$85. Good value. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little find...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed Nov 12th for four nights in an 'executive' room which I think is well worth the small difference in cost. First night was in a 'regular' executive room, however our phone wasn't working (we didn't know until they told us!) so we were upgraded for the rest of the stay to a 'deluxe' executive room. Both rooms were a good size and the regular executive room was just fine. The deluxe offering was just that little bit better, with duvets instead of blankets, nicer carpet, a 'new' kettle and slightly better television and a pillow menu! (choice of feather, buckwheat, low allergy pillows and one other type of pillow). Other features for the executive floor were: free daily breakfast in the executive floor lounge (alternatively you could have eaten at the slightly more extensive buffet on the 1st floor - no extra charge): free drinks from 5.30-7.30 each night (small range of beers and imported spirits / mixers available): free coffee / tea all day in the lounge (they had a cappuccino machine which was good): free bottled water in the room each day: free China Morning Post each day: turn-down service in the evening: fruit bowl on arrival. Housekeeping was excellent - room beautifully cleaned and our belongings nicely put away or stacked when we returned each night. Staff in the executive lounge were lovely and always helpful, happy to write down directions in Chinese for taxi drivers etc. The shuttle to the city (via Mong Kok station) ran like clock-work. We took the advice of previous posters and made sure we were at the shuttle 10 mins prior to departure and always got a seat. (The shuttle filled up a couple of times and people had to take a taxi.) The shuttle takes a different route into town than on the way back, the latter being partly on the freeway and much quicker. However going into town the traffic can be bad and the journey take about 35-37 minutes. If you are waiting at the shuttle stop in town to get back to the hotel, bear this in mind - as the shuttle can be a little late to pick you up. Oh - one time the shuttle left early from town - but only because a guest had to be dropped off at the central train station to catch an urgent flight somewhere. In terms of shopping the hotel is a close walk to the Ladies Market, and a short walk to Monk Kok KCR for the train to Lo Wu and Shenzhen (China) where there is GREAT shopping (all fakes of course!). For food, we bought filled rolls from the Metropole Cake Shop - about USD1 each. Between 5-8pm you buy two rolls, get one free. Good way to end the evening for supper. There is a supermarket across the road if you need bottled water. Just to mention that the phone from the hotel is expensive, HKD20 to call your calling card company, or HKD45 for international (minimum). There is a public phone in the lobby, or an international phone just outside the hotel (1 minute call to the States was HK5 - but cheaper if you get a calling card). The pool was open - closes in December. Looked good and clean, with two attendants to look after the 10 or so deck-chairs. The 'health-club' - well yes, I suppose it was small, but there was all you needed including weights, running machine, cycle machine. All in all - a great hotel, excellent value for the executive floor (they even let us sit in there from 0700 on the day of arrival). Other notes: - The executive lounge was very quaint! Not exactly modern, furniture in need up replacement, but in terms of a three star hotel - quite adequate. - They only have two 'twin' rooms on each of the executive floors. We booked direct through the hotel's website and you cannot specify a twin room unless you enter it manually under 'special requests'. Happy to report this was all organised on our arrival.
